name: Madison Smith
text: I love them. They really do their best to take care of me! Even when they’re absolutely booked, they give me a time to look forward to and do their best to work me in. Today specifically I feel they went above and beyond, even though we don’t know what’s wrong with me, they’re going to send in test to try and figure it out! They do a great job at follow up, and always give a when you can return to school/work without even being asked. All there staff are very nice and I feel they take me seriously. Plus the facility is brand new and looks amazing. I’m very thankful for their care!

name: Jennifer Neal
text: I have never had a good experience here!!! I have went there 3 or 4 times ? I waa the 2nd one there before they even opened in line .she tells me to wait in car. And text the number to fill out paper work(very rude) so i do that only to have it say there is no record of me checking in ? Aftter several attempts to get them to anwser she does to say im checked in ? I sit in my car 2 hours 20 min sick as a dog waiting? Calling them to never get a anwser again ?so i couldnt take the heat any longer and had ro go hime and they call me to come in not long after i got home ?? Its always the fromt workers and the ones giving instructions that are so rude ? The drs nurses are wonderful !!if u can get too them? Before dying? I was there for covid test !! I just dont understand making someone sick to wait that long when they were 2nd in line !!! 20 people went in and out while i waited

name: Kayla Smith
text:
I went for a suspected ankle injury (at 3:55 this Sunday -noting they are open until 5pm), and did what the sign in the parking lot said: “text ___ to check in”. So I did, it gave me three options, one being Imaging (which is what I presumed I needed). After checking in and waiting in the parking lot for 45 minutes (now being a little after 4:30), I decided to *painfully* hobble to the door and ask if I was going to be seen. The lady informed me that they had stopped seeing patients a few hours before.

Very disappointed, as with all this covid, the last place I want to go is the ER, so I suppose I will wait until tomorrow. I will give the lady that helped me a star, because she was nice enough, and offered me a wheelchair to get back to my car.

name: Carol Denise
text: Three times on seperate occasions I have been turned away because of different reasons and very rude. 1st time I had to go to ER just to have someone check my blood sugar because we had just moved to Cullman and didn't have a family doctor. 2nd time was for my blood pressure and tonight I have a kidney infection and she cut me off rudely and said they closed at 7:30 and had patients. I was going to explain that my doctor had me given me medicine for my kidney infection and had the empty bottle and appointment Thursday . I am not sitting in the ER for a kidney infection. Everytime I am cut off in mid sentence and left crying and just because I am old doesn't mean that I am stupid. I hope they don't treat their grandparents that way.

name: HHLA 53
text: Told us there only three person wait and we'd only wait. Get there and there are 9 people there and we were 5 min. away when I called. They water down the wait to get business in I feel like. Then we waited another hour to be seen. From check in time to being seen was nearly 2HOURS!

resp.text: If you would like for us to follow-up regarding your visit, please contact our Patient Advocate to share your experience and your concerns by calling (256) 737-2591. Thank you!

name: Rita Busbin
text: The staff at Urgent care was remarkable. Love the online check in. Dr. Petit and staff are top notch.

name: Anonymous
text: I am not one to ever share reviews at all, but seeing the others reviews just validates that something needs to be done about how rude these people are. From the moment I got back there, they were rolling their eyes and huffing and puffing about me requesting that my kid be tested. Once my kid was tested, which should have taken 15 minutes.. Nobody came back into our room for over an hour. There was only 2 other people there.. So there was no reason for the wait to be so long. Robin is super friendly, but the girls that take weights/info and swab you, etc are very rude and for no reason. If you can't be friendly with people, don't work with people.

name: Stephen Speciale
text: The cleanest urgent care facility in Cullman. Friendly staff and physicians. Highly recommended.

name: Leslie Hensley
text: The front office staff was great! The CRNP wouldn’t give medicine for sinus infection- that has been going on for a week.. Just wanted to COVID these with no COVID symptoms......

resp.text: Hi Leslie - If you would like for us to follow-up regarding your visit, please contact our Patient Advocate to share your experience and your concerns by calling (256) 737-2591. Thank you!

name: Dawn bentley
text: Very friendly staff.  Was a great help. Would use again!

name: Chase
text:
Erica at the front desk is quite possibly my most favorite human ever! She saved at least seven hours of my life!!!

Level of care is top notch and the compassion cannot be matched!!! The nurse even apologized when I started to gag on my throat swab.

A++

text: Been trying to call them  for 3 hours and they don’t answer the phones go figure

text: If you are going to turn down patients before you close because it is close to closing time, then your closing hours should be the time you will take your last patient.

text: Amazing they actually care about their patients

name: Jacob Marlowe
text: Staff was very courteous and kind! You can check in online or call when you get there. They were very busy, but I was still in and out within an hour. The offer on-site testing for COVID-19, with both rapid results and send off choices. I highly recommend this Urgent Care Center to anyone looking for a quick but thorough doctor visit.

name: Bruce Pratt
text: Great people and facility. Thanks

name: Kelley Hamilton
text: Nurse Kelly again was so amazing. She is so awesome with my daughter who has Down syndrome. The lady at the front desk was amazing as well. My daughter threw up as we were leaving and she just jumped up and started cleaning it up. So did Kelly. The nurse practitioner was great too. But Kelly always goes above and beyond and I appreciate that so much. 5 stars and highly recommend!!

name: mark emmert
text: Very happy with how I was treated, with everything going on with COVID and how many people was there, they did a great job at getting to me, nurses was kind and helpful and the doctor was awesome

name: Nathan Brock
text: You don’t need to COVID test everyone that walks through the door. I’m sure it’s a great insurance-grab, but it’s unnecessary.

resp.text: Unfortunately, COVID-19 causes such a variety of symptoms our providers are trying to make sure anyone with any possible COVID symptom is identified in order to stop the spread of COVID in our community.

name: Misty Goodlett
text: Dr. Varquez was so kind. She took her time and made me feel comfortable. Thank you for the quality of care you provided me. The staff is also to be commended; very friendly!

name: Katelyn Wright
text: Only giving them a one star because I HAVE to. What a pitiful excuse for a healthcare facility. Staff is rude and incompetent. NO ONE is on the same page as far as protocol or office policies. I was told by the NP that my send off COVID test would come back on Monday (I was tested on a Friday afternoon). I asked if the weekend would affect the timeliness of receiving results and she said no. My mom was tested on Saturday, the same facility, mind you; and she got her results back on Monday. When I called about my results, I was pretty much told by Kelly that I was a lying about my mom's test. She supposedly "looked up to see if her results were back and they weren't" yet someone called my mom to let her know she tested positive. Kelly was totally hateful about the whole situation. Do not even waste your time at this place.

name: linda thomas
text: I appreciate this facility being available instead of having to go to the ER or waiting for an appointment with my primary doctor! I had a fall and hurt my knee and shoulder on a Sunday afternoon. They had an X-ray tech available and I was in and out in no time.   The doctors I have seen here have been excellent! I would definitely recommend this place.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing! Thank you for choosing Cullman Regional for your health care.

name: Karen Sellers
text: I go and the male doctor that came in to see me did absolutely nothing to help me. I have fluid draining from my leg and his response is I can't help you here in the urgent care. Then charged me 65 dollars and he didn't even touch it. This is a poor excuse for health care

resp.text: Hi Karen - If you would like for us to follow-up regarding your visit, please contact our Patient Advocate to share your experience and your concerns by calling (256) 737-2591. Thank you!

name: Douglas Lanier
text: I want my money back

name: Tiffany Cantrell
text: Allison was amazing at getting me checked in and appointment time scheduled quickly, after I had waited an hour and not checked in by the initial worker who took my info( Samantha). Testing was made easy and results were fast.

name: Shelly
text: They was very quick on the testing but the rudest front desk persons ever. They faxed my husband and children’s test results to their place and employment, when I ask them to fax mine to my doctor’s office, the lady said, “we don’t do that and this facility.  We have never done that” well you did, 7 days ago, even called us to get the fax numbers of where to send it. So I don’t know what y’all did to get into trouble but your facility in fact did fax our paperwork and you stood there and called me a liar. So it is what it is... I pray I never have to come back and have any encounter with a few of these bitter ole bitties... horrible customer service with all these sick people... of you don’t like your job go find one that’s not dealing with the public 😡

resp.text: We are so sorry you had a negative experience. We work hard to make sure our staff is providing excellent service. We will certainly address this issue with our team. Thank you for reaching out and sharing.

name: Tiffany Jones
text: The staff is always wonderful and make you feel like a human being and not just a patient number. I tell everyone about the amazing treatment from here. They got us in a room in under 5 minutes. Got us treated in under 30 minutes. AND answered every question I had. They always warm and friendly. They make you feel like the service they would give their own family, is the services you receive. Love them all.

text: I was very pleased and surprised by the wait, the friendliness and professionalism. To be honest I felt like I was treated as family and I highly value the personable interaction. Thank you very much! I will more than likely make this my home urgent care from now on.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing! Thank you for choosing Cullman Regional for your health care.

text: This was my first time to visit this Urgent care as I don't get sick or need any type of ER or Urgent Care visits but the staff here are amazing, they really do care about their patients unlike some other places I have run into. text: I have brought my son here twice and my daughter once. Each time I had a great experience. I was in and out quickly and the staff were all very nice.

name: Janet Widner
text: Staff are prompt and courteous, I saw the nurse practitioner and he was very thorough and spent plenty of time. The facility is always clean,  I love the online check in, I signed in last night for a time this morning and didn't wait long at all.

name: mbhurter623
text:
We arrived at 8:45 PM and although they were closing in 15 minutes the entire staff was friendly, accommodating and no one acted as if they were rushing to get us out.

The receptionist was kind and courteous and the nurse we had was a joy to deal with.

The Nurse Practioner was great,  well informed and extremely helpful.

resp.text: We're so glad you had a great experience! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!

name: Frank George
text: Arrived 10 minutes before my “confirmed” online appointment. Didn’t get called back until 40 minutes after the appointment time. One of the most painstakingly slow places I have been to. This is your warning, the online confirmed appointment time means absolutely nothing and you will be there for 2+ hours. I will never return here.

resp.text: Mr. George - we are sorry to hear that your are disappointed with our service. We do are best to make the times of online appointments accurate & occasionally run later due to unexpected high volumes of walk-in patients. We typically notify patients before they arrive if we are running behind. We’ll do some education with our staff to improve this in the future. We hope you’ll give us another chance in the future.

name: Mary Beth Sellers
text: The staff is great and they were very thorough! I was in and out quickly and had a great experience. I love the Online Check-In feature so that you can wait from home. 5-star service for sure!

name: Honore Glenn
text: Excellent experience from the check-in process thru check-out. Very little wait time. The staff were all very customer service oriented, as well as the x-ray tech. Received great care, in a very friendly environment. Thank you, if I could give 10 stars, I would.

name: Wilma Whateley
text: Great staff. Speedy service. So glad that they are open late and have X-ray services! The online check in really did speed things up too. Immensely pleased that I didn’t have to go to the ER.

resp.text: We're so glad you had a great experience! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!

name: Annette Palmer Johnson
text:
With my health issues, and a choice to want an Urgent Care that was not solely attached to a doctor’s “group”. I was so happy to find out that CRMC was opening their own urgent care facility, with diagnostic labs, for the many issues that can arise with MS. Before them, my choice was the ER. I always felt that I would be in the way of someone that needed full attention from the ER staff, along with the long wait.
I was treated professionally but with a relaxed atmosphere. Smiling and caring faces, “team minded”, sincere and a beautiful facility. I tend to get anxious when I have to go. My MS can create many problems and mask symptoms of other problems. The lady that attended to my problem looked at my issue as “a fresh pair of eyes”, made her diagnosis, and it was like all the puzzle pieces just fell into place.
I was upset and frustrated about a problem I had been having for 3 weeks, even after 2 doctor visits, and waiting for an appointment with a specialist that was still several days away. I left smiling and feeling like there a light at the end of the tunnel.
I can’t thank them enough for what they did for me yesterday!  Welcome to the neighborhood!  I am your biggest fan!

resp.text: We're so glad you had a great experience! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!

name: Chris Vogelpohl
text: LaShae: all the staff were so amazing that what would have normally been a high stress situation with my toddler who hates doctor visits turned in to his most calm and enjoyable visit ever... he didn't even cry when being swabbed for strep. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and the Dr was very thourough.

text: My daughter Madison went in tonight not feeling good at all. Yal took such good care of her, but her nurse she loved so much, she said she wanted to start seeing her all the time. text: Can not say thank you enough for how caring and understanding they were with my screaming toodler who wasn’t feeling well. This place might be good but whoever was in charge of seeing patients that night was not doing her job at all

text: Everyone was friendly and professional. We checked in online. Our wait was minimal. Nurse was very thorough. We will definitely recommend to others.

name: Rodney Thompson
text: The first visit Wes arrived at 8:45, I was asked to leave because the do not open until 9.  The pharmacy and imaging was open, if you was there for either of those two services you could wait in the lobby, but if you need the urgent care you wait in your car.  Funny how that works considering  that all 3 services share the same waiting room.   I spoke with the office manager, who was a very sweet lady, she gave me the name of the person to talk to at the hospital about my complaint.   Needless to say, after serval attempts to contact them, leaving my name and contact info I still have not  heard from them.

resp.text: UPDATE: Mr. Thompson, you will be happy to know we’ve updated are policy on this, and patients waiting for urgent care can now also wait in our waiting room. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are sorry you feel you did not receive exceptional care. If you would like for us to follow-up regarding your visit, please contact our Patient Advocate to share your experience and your concerns by calling (256) 737-2591. Thank you!

I'll definitely take my business elsewhere.

name: Buckshot (BK)
text:
I’ve had two bad experiences with this health provider main May 2021 and august 2021 I needed blood work results for severe abdominal pain! I left multiple messages for Dr Felgner to get my blood work results. I was unable to get a call back after leaving some 7 messages within a weeks time. I even went into the facility to get the blood work results but I was turned away and told that Dr Felgner world have to give them to me!  What is a patient to do?!!! I even filled out a records request, but I never received my CAT Scan & Blood Work results!!!

Stan as far away from this facility. Dr Felgner seems to be very compretent, but his staff at the Lakeshore location are completely incompetent!!!

They absolutely have not interest in the wellbeing of Dr. Felgner patients!

In 2 separate situations, I left 10 messages in the third week of May 2021 and then in the first week of August 2021 I left 8 messages for inquiries about my blood work. Both times I never get a call back. I had to make an appointment to talk directly with Dr Felgner!!!

The most recent situation, I was having to live with severe abdominal pain. The doctor told me to call him if the pain continued. I did, but no on would return my calls. I ended up having to request my records and go to a doctor to researched on my own. I was told my records world be ready for pick up in two days. It has been 8 days and I have yet to get my records!!!
I had to pay for new blood tests out of my pocket because MedHelp would not release my records!!!

I have retained an attorney and filed complaints with the Alabama Medical  Board. No one should have to fight with a medical facility to get help!!!

Stay as far away from these evil people!!!!!!!!!

name: Kendra Brown
text: I have always  had a wonderful experience from this clinic. Cynthia at the front desk always greet me with a smile. When I ever call with a question all of staff get right on top of it. Dr. Felgner has been one of the most caring and loving doctors I've ever had

resp.text: Thanks, Kendra!

name: Emma sandoval
text: They don’t answer the phone, some of the staff are extremely rude. They don’t call back with results for the labs. Honestly safe yourself the emotional uproar they may cause due to the lack of response, an unwillingness to answer phones to get basic information..

name: Mark Asperger
text: A spreadneck, covidiot anti-masker owns this place.

name: Nathen
text: The nurses say they will submit your preauthorization and never do. They tell you they will call you back and never do. You can't leave a message because the voicemail is full. The doctors are good though.

name: Tanya C
text: My husband needed a bunch of tests done for his work and in a rush turn around.  We called many clinics to get help but the only one who greeted us w kindness and went above and beyond was Med Help.  From Angel P who was very helpful in finding out if they could do the tests we needed done in the time frame we needed to when my husband got to Med Help having Haley making the process as simple as possible and quick. To Dr McFaden being kind and understanding. We cannot thank Med Help enough for helping us. We know it was a  unique situation and very grateful for all their help.

resp.text: Thanks Tanya!

name: Darius Conner
text: I had a wonderful experience with the young lady Ayanna who helped me. She brought me and answered every question that had. I was in and out in less than 15 minutes with everything I needed. Very professional and knowledgeable. Please give this young lady a raise!!👍 great experience

name: Colton Spain
text: Drove 30 minutes to get told they stop testing for Covid at 6 PM and you can’t ever get the front desk for help no matter what phone number you call. Not surprised at all.

resp.text: Please visit our website and complete the online form for COVID testing. Thank you for choosing MedHelp.

name: samantha stephens
text: I came in super sick and no other place was offering me any answers. I came to Med Help and they were so kind and considerate, despite my difficulties regarding needles. Robert and Alyssa specifically were so professional and I would 100% go back.

name: Spencer Wilson
text:
I have to say that my visit today to the Medhelp on Lakeshore was one of the better experiences I have had at any quick care type of doctor's office.
The person on the phone who initially booked my visit, the nurse who administered the test, and the doctor who followed up with me after my test results came back, were all great. I'm sure MedHelp like all other similar doctors offices are overwhelmed right now, but these guys were extremely professional and made the process much easier than several other similar quick care facilities I visited recently.  Great job MedHelp in Vestavia!

name: J A
text: I be could NOT be more disappointed (disgusted) with the POOR quality of treatment my 19-year old daughter (student living away from home) received  at this clinic. Multiple visits, multiple tests, lack of action and follow through. The last issue being a failure to update her medical records which resulted  in delays in receiving prescribed medication. With little to no help from this location in resolving. No way I’d ever refer anyone to this clinic. Awful.

name: Ms. Cyd Bailey Howard
text: I have seen several doctors at this location. Never had any problems. Dr. Thayer Moore joined the staff in 2020 and she is very unprofessional and refused to listen to her patients. She just prescribes meds, meds to wake you up and meds to put you to sleep. I attempted to voice my concerns about all of the meds she prescribes and I received a certified letter saying that Medhelp will no longer service my medical needs. It’s Very important to listen to the patients. When I left the office the very last time. She had sent 12 Prescriptions to Publix for my diabetes and high blood pressure. Completely unreal and very unprofessional. Run away from that office if they schedule you with Dr. Thayer Moore. I have concerns that she may have some agreement with the pharmaceuticals company’s. Everyone else there has been acceptable.

resp.text:
Ms Bailey asked me to put my medical license at risk and I declined.
I am saddened to see that she decided to retaliate by making slanderous and false remarks online. I hope she finds some peace. Dr. Moor

name: David Paden
text: I've gone here several times over the years and have always been impressed with the quality of the care received.  I've also taken or sent family members and they also have been happy with the service.

name: Mell Rose
text: Ok so when I first got here I was disappointed I had some things too do and the process slowed me down . They did however correct the situation . It was okay

resp.text: Mell, we do see that you were the first person seen this morning and that you were seen quickly. We apologize for not having change, but we are glad to have provided you with excellent care.

name: Martha Bath
text: I had an experience that I needed help with the finance department, the person that stood out to me was Kristi McAdory!!!!! She took my need serious & she really helped me, she had the BEST attitude!!!  Very caring, kind & helpful!! The world needs more Kristi’s💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖

name: Casey Gewirtzman
text: Several people have already commented about this, and my experience has been the same. I had a really bad sore throat, and I went in hoping to get an antibiotic or something. I was told I needed a COVID test, even though I already had COVID not long ago. I waited an hour and half. I had to call multiple times to make sure I got tested, because they clearly forgot about me. Plus, I was also supposed to get a strep swab, and they forgot about that, too. I’m never coming back here again.

name: Emily Butler
text: Tried to get tested for Covid. Sent telehealth form as instructed by website around 1:30-2 on a Wednesday. After sending form, instructions said I would be contacted by a nurse to setup curbside test. No one called. Thursday morning I tried to call telehealth line and site I had requested curbside test. I only got voicemail. Left a message explaining situation, and just requested someone verify they received my info and I was in line to be called for an appointment. This was around 9 am. It’s now 4:25 pm and still no response. In the meantime, I went elsewhere to be tested.

name: danielle aaron
text: Jada and Sabrina were AWESOME on 2/25/21. Highly recommend!!!

resp.text: Thanks Danielle!

name: Erica Scaife
text: I went in on 12/26/20 because I was having sinus trouble. I explained to the nurse what was going on with my sinus. He told me they had to do a covid test I said okay. I told him that was fine but I needed to be seen about my sinuses. The nurse told me once they get the results back from my covid test the doctor would call me so to leave and they would contact me. So I never saw the doctor. An hour and half passed and I called them the lady that answered told me I was negative for covid and the flu. I said okay what about the symptoms I came in for. She put me on hold and came back to the phone and said the doctor would be calling me. I never received a call and I get an email saying it was filed on my insurance. But I never saw the doctor and in turn had to make an appointment to see my doctor. I am very disappointed in the service I received or should I say did not receive. While I understand being careful and not wanting to get other people sick this process was not right and I feel like how can you charge me if you don't treat me. I will not be visiting this facility again.

name: John Dorsett
text: All the staff was very helpful, cordial and led us thru this procedure effortlessly. This is a great group of people who took good care of my loved one. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks, John!

name: Mohammad Firouz
text: Very polite staff and nice service

name: Marla Dean
text: I have never had an experience like I had there today. Was seen by a female physician by the name of Moor i believe. Will never go back. Hopefully, the other physicians ask questions before they start talking about your history.

resp.text: Marla, we hope you feel better soon and wish you the best of luck in your search for a new provider.

name: Kimani Evans
text: Firstly the staff here is phenomenal. They go above and beyond to ensure that you are getting the very best care. I dealt with the “African American doctor from OKC” (pardon me for not remembering her name) but she was very understanding and patient. The nurses were very well trained. My only recommendation would be to develop  more private way for patient to describe their Symptoms at the check in desk. Other than that I was very  impressed.

name: Jason Williams
text: Wonderful. Kind. Professional. Efficient. Very impressed.

resp.text: Thanks, Jason!

name: whitney dillard
text: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you're unhappy with the service we provided. Please give us a call so we can better understand your frustration. 205-547-3901.

name: Melissa Snyder
text: Please note that if you go to Med Help in the evening or weekend, you will be charged a non-advertised $44 night/weekend clinic charge. This is charged despite the services being marketed as "urgent care." They don't seem to use the actual urgent care billing code and use primary care code instead. I'm assuming to make more money and later charge the extra night and weekend fee. If they would advertise honestly, I would not be so upset by this. My specific grievance is with the Trussville location, but I'm sure this is a company-wide practice.

name: Christine
text: Dr. Bernreuter was excellent - very thorough and went through all the treatment options.

name: PJ Albano
text:
Drs Vaughn and MedHelp Administration:

I literally felt like the proverbial train hit me, and  was being beyond a wimp.  After labs, rapid flu, & CXR , Julie Phillips, MSN, CRNP, and her NP student Christina Ray, RN, doing her clinicals) were probably the nicest and most caring providers I've ever come in contact with.  The two of them and their support staff went well above and beyond taking care of me today.
I've been in the medical / pharmacy field, physician relations for well over 20 years, and they're simply  top notch.  I know you probably get, albeit completely undeserved, complaints of some nature from patients, so I thought I'd drop you a quick review and say GREAT JOB, GREAT HIRES, GREAT MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS... I'll be transferring my records from to MedHelp as soon as possible.Thank you again...PJA.

resp.text: Thank you, PJ!

name: Charmaine Perry-Livers
text: Very nice greeting when I entered the clinic. Clean and free coffee! But the service I received from the Doctor was excellent! I recommend this place to all that have Urgent Care Needs!

name: Valerie Rodgers
text: If Dr. Smothers is there, go somewhere else.  Don't get me wrong, he was a really nice doctor but he is VERY slow.  Walked in at 4:50...didn't leave until 7:10.  There were four people in the lobby in front of me & I saw 2 people come from the back.

name: Mallory Edmondson
text: Both my husband and I went in last month. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the doctor was great! We were in and out within an hour!

name: Jose Cortes
text: Excellent environment, the Dr. associates are very helpful, fast to do their good job, and the Doctor is great, perfect to visit by anyone, is well recommended.

name: scott gamble
text: Dr. Felgner wasn't there for my scheduled appointment and they didn't call me or send me any notice via the online portal so I showed up and had to leave or come back 4 hours later for a different Dr.. Don't waste your time coming to this place.

name: Frank Lloyd Bite
text: This place is truly the worst. Super rude and judgmental doctor and staff. Will definitely never go back.

name: rebecca smith
text: Just went in for a check-up. The staff was very friendly and my appointment was quick. Dr. Orso was friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. All together I was only there for about an hour! The waiting room is really nice too: spacious, well lit, with drinks, snacks and coffee dispensers.

name: anita brunner
text: Nurse Pam was a wonderful nurse to work with! She was very knowledgeable and answered all of our question with confidence!

name: Dallas Carroll
text:
Dr. Smothers ran blood work, flu and streph test all of which came back negative. I had a horrible headache and and a temperature of 102.8. He did no additional testing and came back into the room and said, "You're not going to like this, but I think you have a serious infection- meningitis! You will more than likely need a lumbar punture or spinal tap."
He recommended that I go to the ER, but dont worry his medical assistant to offer the ER a heads up that I was coming...
After waiting countless hours at the ER and NUMEROUS TESTS I had a viral infection. All of which required fluids, ibuprofen, and lots of rest. I will NEVER return here. Apparently telling someone -after running a handful of tests- it's perfectly fine to tell them that they most likely have one of the most UNCOMMON and RARE infections. He didnt even ask if I was vaccinated as a kid- which my mother made sure I had every vaccination know to man.

name: Lauren Brady
text: Front office was friendly. I didn't wait long. Doctor was knowledgeable and kind. Doc sent meds to 24 hour pharmacy and I was on my way. Great experience!

name: Christopher Anderson
text: I am out of town on business for a few weeks here in Birmingham, and needed an emergency refill. So I walked in here to see if they would be able to do this for me, and I was promptly told they were not able to do so by the front desk without actually consulting the nurses or Dr. On staff. So I went down the road to another urgent care and got my prescribtion refilled within 10mins. So yeah, terrible service, do not recommend.

name: Marty McArthur
text: You can either make an appointment or just show up.  Those with appointments go first, of course, especially if they allow "first available doctor," but I have never had a horribly long wait, even during flu season.  For convenience, there is a complete pharmacy on the premises.  I believe the pharmacy closes at 5:30 or 6:00 PM.  I have never been displeased with a doctor or a staff member there.

name: Ross Carpri
text: I went to this site per my Doctors instructions to have blood work done.  They refused to do the work because they said that I needed an appointment and was not allowed to work on me since my primary doctor was not in that location.  Thank God I didn't have an emergency or they would have probably let me die right there on the lobby floor.  Very bad service and the two employees were not compassionate in the least.  I won't  ever go back.  I'll take my chances somewhere else.

name: Reed McMullan
text:
MedHelp is the worst example of a medical establishment. I can't even begin to describe the worst medical experience I have been through. I took my wife to this MedHelp after she was recovering from the Flu, because she clearly was not recovering. Dr. Solomon Saul has the WORST bedside manner of any physician I have ever met. As he began to look at her symptoms, he kept shrugging them off. He said, "your symptoms are general, so I'm not sure why you came in." He continued to verbally harass her and question her symptoms. After he sat in silence staring at us, he finally said, "I guess I can prescribe you something for your GENERAL symptoms." What a jerk!

To top off the whole experience, I wrote to MedHelp's Facebook page, hoping for a different, friendly customer service experience. Boy, was I wrong! After not even receiving a reply, I followed up. I have posted the conversation below. DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT use this medical company for any service.. They do not care about the patient, not care about the medical betterment of their PAYING customers. What a rip-off.

name: Cats Mcc
text: I'd been here multiple times for urgent care issues, usually respiratory infections, and they've always been very fast and nice! I recently decided to establish with a new PCP and became a patient of Dr. Felgner, who is extremely nice and really cares about his patients. He's very kind and actually talks to you instead of over you. I'm in and out in less than an hour, even with urgent care problems after 5:00. From the front staff to the end of your visit, everyone cares about you and I've yet to meet a rude person there. I can't recommend Medhelp Lakeshore any more highly! Great people giving great care! --Liz M

name: Walter White
text: Friendly staff and knowledgeable doctors. Needs more Auburn stuff in pharmacy !

name: Juju Vyez
text: Avoid at all costs! The doctor I saw for my back pain was nice. The lady at the desk said they'd send a bill if anything was owed. Nearly a year later and not a single bill received, and I find myself dealing with a collections agency due to their ineptness. I wish I'd suffered through the back pain. It would have been far less painful than getting dinged on my credit report and having to clear that mess up.

name: Gabrielle Hernandez
text: They were very quick with bringing me back and I was in and out right away. Exactly how an urgent care should be.

name: Gene Floyd
text: Recently drove myself here with chest pains. As I walked in there was a sign that said they handled "heart attacks". I walk in, tell the lady at the desk I thought I might be having a heart attack. She replied that they were full and couldn't get to me. I looked at her and asked for her please to check that I was in a lot of pain. She finally walks into the back and then comes out and tells me again that they were too busy I would have to go elsewhere. This meant I had to get in my car and drive to Brookwood, where I ended up having to have a stent put in as I had blockage. Needless to say, I wouldn't take my ex-mother-in-law's dog to this place. I mean what kind of people, especially at a doctors office would tell someone having heart pains to go somewhere else without even offering to call an ambulance?

name: Andre Campbell
text: Thank you for your great service would highly recommend medhelp to any one and will definitely go back for any future needs thanks to Beverly bridges and your wonderful staff for your care and compassion....

name: Olivia Stiles
text: I had a great experience Tosha the nurse was the bomb dot com at giving shots. I had a great experience.

name: Susanna H
text: As a medical professional, I'm not going to go see a doctor unless I absolutely have to. I went to this urgent care on a weekend when I couldn't go see my regular doctor. Dr. Orso, who saw me, did just that--looked at me, shouted out a diagnosis and sent me on my way. He was rude and rushed (spent less than 60 seconds in the room), didn't even touch me, and became angry with me when I asked about whether I could go to work or not. He also completely dismissed the primary reason I had come in, and told me treatment for my primary complaint was "excessive." It would have been nice just to be listened to and felt like he gave a flying flip about his patient.

name: vandalyn green
text: I give this a -5 for service! I went to MedHelp Lakeshore on 2/11/16 at 8 am. I had a temp and chest pain. The wack doctor gave me a shot for sinus and a list of vitamins to take. I told him 3 times how bad my chest was hurting! On 2/14/16 I went to AFC. I had the flu and pneumonia! A lot of fluid in my lungs.

name: Grace
text: Don't waste your time. I have been here once and I don't know what happened in a year but apparently a lot. Waited an hour for the staff to find my insurance and talk to me about my co pay. I was told because I was an emergency visit and they werent my Pcp it would cost more which is garbage. They were unwilling to work with me on figuring out the issue and so I left. Not worth the time.

name: Bobby Wallace
text: Great Physicians and a great place for walk-in medical care

name: Pamela Flanagan
text: I see Dr. Southworth , he has been a very good caring Dr.

name: Cynthia Stewart
text: On the rare occasion I need to go, I see Dr Pink (sorry, just love saying my dude dr. has a color name :) ). While his staff are probably the most non-congenial group of folks, he seems nice enough. He actually takes time to have a conversation and explain things well. My husband saw the black female dr. (sorry, didn't catch her name) and she was friendly as well. As far as Dr. Orso, he was my OB when I lost my first child in 1990. He delivered my first-born and 23 years later, he remembered me when I walked through the office. He hugged me and asked how the kids were. So while the staff have no personalities, the doctors seem knowledgeable and I have definitely had worse experiences.

name: Jana Lee
text: Friendly, prompt service from a knowledgeable staff! Will definitely be back!

name: Michael Hoadley
text: Hello: I had an extremely unfortunate experience today at the Med Help, Inc. Lakeshore (Birmingham, AL) location. After arriving just on time for my 11am follow-up appointment with Dr. Richard Crittendon, and paying my $30.00 co-pay up-front, I took a seat in their waiting room. After about five minutes, I was escorted to the back patient area by a nurse who proceeded to weigh me, then take my blood pressure and my temperature. She then took me next door to an exam room to await Dr. Crittendon. "He'll be with you in a few minutes," she said. I sat in that exam room for the next 55 minutes, listening to the nurses' and Dr. Crittendon's voices passing outside the door. AT NO TIME did anyone "check in" with me or acknowledge the doctor's tardiness. At 12:05pm, I left the room and attempted to speak with one of the four nurses at their station just outside; however, each one was seated and on the telephone. Eventually, I just explained to the receptionist that I could wait no longer (another appointment was pending), and left the building. Now, I understand that physicians are often over-booked or encounter unexpected issues with their patients, however, I do believe that a modicum of professional attention could have been paid during my almost one-hour wait. But, of course, they did have time to process my debit card for the co-pay. I'm afraid my second visit to Med Help on Lakeshore will be my last.

name: Ricky Whitley
text: Love this place!  Quick and professional!

name: Jim Cowley
text: Very Impressed by the Medical Care provided. Will use them again for both my urgent care needs as well as primary care.

name: Elena Neumann
text:
Wow! Not what I was expecting for what I thought was a general "walk-in clinic." I called & made an appointment to meet with Dr. Pink Fulmer.

This place exceeded my expectations. As it took a few minutes for the front clerk to check me in; it didn't take long (maybe 10-15 mins) before I was being called back. (I am a new patient). The lobby to this office is modern, has plenty of seating, and has a neat "charging station" for smart phone users who are running on their last fumes. :) I got called back and the young lady who took my blood pressure/weight was really nice. We talked briefly of the symptoms and she got me back into my private waiting room.

It wasn't long before Dr. Pink was in my room talking to me and asking me about my symptoms and conditions. He has a very calming and relaxing personality which puts a nervous person like me to ease. He truly seemed to care about my concerns and listened to all of my worries about my "condition." He gave me a thorough examination, and even had some tests/xrays done that made me feel a lot better about what I "thought" was happening to my body.

He thoroughly went over my results and overall I was really pleased with he and all of his medical assisting staff. They were all really nice as I was super nervous about even being there. (I rarely go to the doctor). I also ended up getting a flu shot while I was there, and the girl who did it (med assistant) was sweet and did the deed quick and painless.

I was sad to learn that Dr. P. Fulmer will be retiring sometime this year; but I really liked this office and will give their other doctors a shot. Fast and convenient!

I also visited their in-house pharmacy (Rx Pharmacy) and I was thoroughly pleased. They were extremely quick and you can't get any better than picking up your prescriptions up at the same time you saw your doctor. It was cheap and the Pharmacy Owner (can't remember his name) was so down to earth and really pleasant to deal with.

Overall, really pleased with this medical experience and glad to know I have this great place so close to where I live!! :) My husband and I will be using them as our PCP.

**Side note** They also do walk-in's!! So if you are considering this as a walk-in option; try it. It's just as good (in my opinion better!!) than your typical "American Family Care!"

Thanks MEDHELP LAKESHORE!

name: Patrick O'Donnell
text: I have been seeing Dr. Pink Folmar since I was transferred to Birmingham in May of 2013.  The level of care this physician provides is the highest I have received in my 46 years.  His bedside manner is that of an "old world doctor" who would make housecalls if the need arose.  He genuinely cares about his patients.  As a modern physican, Dr. Folmar uses all current diagnostic tools and an incredible wealth of information to provide accurate, efficient health care solutions.  When you leave the office expect to have a detailed printout of your individual care and instructions for patient compliance.   January 6th, 2013 Dr. Folmar saved my life by finding a spontaneous pnuemothorax (collapsed lung) and directing my induction to Brookwood Medical Center.  I am grateful for Dr. Folmar.

name: DJ RaptorXS
text: Dr. Hickman is the best!

name: Sarah Inman
text: Dr. Felgner is one of those old school doctors that will sit and listen to you.  The office staff is friendly.

name: stam ahat
text: This place has the worst customer service I have ever seen. Zero in crowd management. This is a business after all, and they don't appreciate you.

name: Linda Wolfe
text: Excellent care at Med Help

name: Jarek Murdock
text: Terrible service, it's been this way for years! My mother had a SCHEDULED appointment and waited on the doctor for TWO hours just to be told that he couldn't see her. I contacted the COO and the supervisor only to be given a mediocre response. Never going back.

name: Emmalee Tidwell
text: The staff ignored me as I entered in and no one was at the desk when I came and signed in. They finally noticed me after a half hour and asked who I was. It was very frustrating and the staff was in no way punctual. I do not plan on returning.

name: Stephanie Smith
text: Best doctors & service

name: jd
text: Good doctors!

name: Mintrel Stewart
text: No sir go elsewhere

name: Kenny Sample
text:
(Translated by Google) Very rude front hand.

(Original)
Very rude front dest.

name: Lacy Kuenzel
text: I have been here numerous times between my children, my husband and myself. I have been for myself twice in the last few months and both times were less than an hour. We have never had a bad experience. The entire staff has always been super friendly and knowledgeable. I am very pleased with the service and care provided.

name: Rachael Dannelley
text: If you are going to utilize a contactless registration system, you should make sure that someone is managing it during your scheduled business hours. Waited an hour and a half to find out that “because of an issue” the clinic had not opened on time and we would have an additional hour wait before being able to be seen. Also, placing a sign on the door would have been a simple way to let the public know that you were not able to see patients at this time. The parking lots full of waiting patience could have made the decision to go to a neighboring urgent care or go back home without wasting their morning.

name: Kevin Rush
text: This place is supposed to be Veterans Administration approved as indicated on the VA's website. I am a veteran with VA insurance and over a month after my visit I received a text that payment was denied and was sent a bill for over $600 for an office visit! No one contacted me but my credit card was billed $125. I will be contacting the VA to have them removed from their approved walk-in clinics!

name: Mary Cathryn Brooks
text: How do you speak to anyone on the phone??? My visit was fine. I get the wait. I work in a specialists office so I get it. I just can't get ANYONE on the phone! The prompt says to push 5 to talk to a staff member, so I push 5. Then it takes me back to the main menu. Please fix this. PLEASE!

name: Sasha Bishop
text: My daughter was just refused care because my phone couldn't scan the registration code and wouldn't load their website.

name: Miller Sherling
text: Awesome: friendly, efficient service. QR code on door so folks can register outside in car. Receptionist & 2 folks in waiting room wearing masks, with both mouth and nose covered. NOT awesome: person who took my kid’s temp wearing face shield only, no mask, in small closed room, no ventilation, and used ORAL thermometer. So kid had to lower mask. Not safe for anyone. I should’ve said something and didn’t.

name: Eric Phillips
text: Went here for our kids ear ache.  The sign on the door says mask required if you don’t have one please request one from desk.  Went in and they would not let us in because we didn’t have a mask and when I requested one they said they were out.? What kind of urgent care do not have mask.

name: Denise Thrasher
text: When I decided to get my Covid vaccine with them I was delighted because they were always organized and it’s convenient. The day I was to go they called me and asked me to come the next day which was New Year’s Eve . They said someone didn’t take it out of the freezer. Ok then the next day I went as I was told, it took a while but I was ok with that because it was new. They were nice and apologized because they were “ learning” and that’s fine. Well I was suppose to go Thursday the 28 but I told them I work out of town that day but I could get there by 6:00pm. The nurse said just come Friday morning, we are open half a day, ok that’s fine. So today I tried to register just as I was told to do and it didn’t have an option for Covid follow up so I called the office, explained it to the nurse she said let me call you right back. Ok, I waited and waited, finally someone from CORPORATE called me explaining they didn’t have anymore vaccine to give. WHAT?? She started out telling me well you were suppose to be here yesterday. I stopped her and said hold on , I told the nurse I could come but it would be 6:00 and she told me to come the next day,I even called WEDNESDAY and told them again I could come but again I was told to come Friday!  I didn’t do that on my own! She said well she didn’t have the authority to tell you that. After going back and forth she said she was gonna have to find me a vaccine and it would take her a week! So guess what Iam not a happy camper. I told her Iam in healthcare and I am pretty upset for being able to get it because if their mistake. Am I wrong for this?? I know this is all new and I realize mistakes happen but come on give me a break! I have pts and family members to think of!!  Still upset!!

name: Brandy Gray
text: It wasn't the 3.5 hour wait that was upsetting to me.   It was the nightmare of a sign in process from your car!  Once I finally got through the many many many questions, copy of drivers license,  insurance info,  copay info,  etc and I finally get to the 'finish' button at the end, the circle went round and round and round and it never submitted my info after spending at least 30 mins on filling out all the info.  I walked inside only to be handed an iPad and told to fill it out again!  Needless to say I left and went to Pricare.  They were able to see me immediately.   Very very dissatisfied and disappointed with the long sign in process at Main Street when im already feeling absolutely terrible and exhausted.

name: Katrina Kennedy
text: I registered my boyfriend online for a COVID test at 9am. We waited outside until 1:49pm!!! AND HE IS STILL INSIDE!! Its 3:15 and they still arent done yet. If we ever get out of here, we wont be back that's for sure. He could literally have COVID and they got him up in there for that long.

name: W “Annie”
text: Register online now?. What an annoying pain in the backside! Wasn't this way first time we came for testing. Over an hour trying to get the online registration to work.!  Still sitting here outside trying to register. Place be closed by time we finish.

name: Tom Lozaw
text:
Medical assistant Tameka provided great service. She was professional, friendly and caring. I was impressed that she took history information, blood pressure and even took exrays.

Nurse Practitioner Callie diagnosed my illness and prescribed medicine to help me get well.

resp.text: Thank you so much Tom! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Debbie DiBenedetto
text: I have had 2 out of 2 great experiences at MainStreet.  I've never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes and the staff is all so friendly, efficient & caring.  NP Ellison is wonderful as are her nurses.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Debbie. It was a pleasure serving you!

name: Destiny Benford
text: I would like to give it NO STARS but it want let me do that but this place sucks and needs to be shut down permanently. The reason why my 71 year old grandmother went there for abdominal pain at 2 p.m and didn't get out till after 6 and in between all of that they were sneaking patients in and out through the back door skipping over her and still didn't solve her  problem she came back home even worse than she left and with this place supposed to be urgent care she might as well went to the ER as long as she stayed in there my family is completely done with this Urgent Care of can't say the same for the others but this place the one in Alexander City AL needs to be closed down (NOT A FAN OF THIS PLACE) NO STARS IF POSSIBLE

name: MainStreet Family Urgent Care
text: Love the convenience of having an urgent care clinic that is open after work.      The staff was very friendly and the facilities were Super Nice!  They even have Free Coffee and Juice.  Oh and I love that they had my medicine on site so I could go straight home afterwards!

name: Sha Lewis
text: Fast and professional. And they also have fleece blankets if you get a little too cold. Very thoughtful in making sure patients are comfortable from beginning to end.

resp.text: Thanks Sha! We always want to make sure are patients are comfortable and well cared for the second they come in the door.  We appreciate your kind words.

name: Wendi Alexander
text: Fast, friendly,  and very professional!! Great staff!!

name: Brandon Thornton
text: CRNP Cassandra Gammage was great. Very caring and thorough. Went above and beyond for my little girl. Seemed passionate about her work.

resp.text: Thanks so much Brandon! We love Cassandra and are so happy we could make you feel like part of the MainStreet Family!

name: Kevin Brown
text: They got me in fast. And the staff and DR was very professional and friendly.

resp.text: This is great news! We're so happy to know that you had a good experience.

name: Sheretha Woodyard
text: I took my son into the Urgent Care on Sunday for abdominal pain & vomiting.  Upon examination of my son, the Nurse Practitioner said she would have to send him to the ER because she could not scan him there.  My first thought was, she is in a hurry because it's close to closing.  To my surprise, she called the ER to let them know she was sending a patient and told them what she thought was going on.  We arrived at RMC where my son was diagnosed with appendicitis and had to have emergency surgery.  Today I received a call from I think Lisa the NP that was working on Sunday calling to check on my son.  I appreciate the thoughtfulness & her taking the time to check on him. Awesome Customer Service! Thank you Main Street Urgent Care & Nurse Practitioner Lisa.

resp.text: Sheretha, thank you so much for your kind words!  We always strive to treat our patients like family and want to make sure your visit was great!  We certainly hope that your son is on the mend!

name: Amanda Hill
text: My husband and I went to the clinic a week ago. We both have the cold crud going around. He was diagnosed with URI and ear ache, they diagnosed me with the flu even though I had no symptoms, and my husband had all the symptoms. They took us back at the same time, to the same room, and tested us at the same time. They treated us with steroids and mucinex d. A week later we are both worse off. I don't have insurance so I paid $125 for nothing. I would not recommend this place and I will not go to another one of these clinics.

resp.text:
Hi Mandy,

We appreciate your feedback, and we're sorry your experience was not satisfactory! Someone from the clinic will be reaching out in the next 24 hours to see how we can help. Thank you for choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care.

name: Brian Dodson
text: Never again will I visit this place.  So you said that my insurance denied my visit to you.  So you charged me cash price for a visit.....Really? And you charged my card without my consent.  No thank you, if my $ is all you’re worried about and not my health or how you treat your customers.  Don’t care to do business with you.

name: Joe Littrell
text: Waiting over 4hours  as walkin.And still waiting.

name: Fran Arnold
text: If I could give 0 I would. Do not take your child there. I have a toddler who was prescribed a medicine both his physician, choa and the Walgreens told me he should never have been prescribed... they do not have drs there only pa or np... I get they are medically trained but this is not a place for children at all...

resp.text:
Hi Fran,

Thank you so much for reaching out with your concerns! I've passed your information along to our Chief Medical Officer to review your child's chart. The medication prescribed is approved by the FDA and CDC for children, but we'd be more than happy to discuss any concerns with your child's pediatrician!

name: Tasha Reese
text: Very fast pace and knowledgeable staff.

name: Bama_ Diesel
text: The staff was very friendly and respectful. They got us in and out fairly quickly.

name: Misty Goodson
text: Long wait time

name: Kerry Bulin
text: Very friendly, caring, and efficient staff.

resp.text: Thanks, Kerry! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care!

name: Robert Vines
text: I received a covid test here in Jan. and tested positive. I received 2 "check-up" phone calls while in quarantine which I have never had happen before. I was never told I would get charged for those calls. Not long after they showed up as charges on my insurance. Complete money grab.

name: Constance Taylor
text: No stars for me if I could give. I came in about 857am signed it and they asked for drivers license and insurance card! I sat down and noticed it was 935 and I haven’t been called back up to pay co pay or sign new patient forms. At 935am I asked if she already entered my information and she said not yet so I asked for my cards back and came to AFC and was in the back in less than 10 minutes. I do not recommend at all! The young ladies behind the glass were just sitting around laughing and joking. Avoid this place if you can

name: Tiffani Parnell
text: Today I made a visit. After waiting 40 min the desk clerk advises me that the doctor prefers that I go to the ER. Mind you I haven’t seen or talked to the doctor. Because I’m an asthmatic patient having some chest pain he didn’t want to “risk it.” This comes after I watched the desk clerk attempt to turn people away because they were closing in 3 hours! What. I left upset and crying and still unable to breathe. Don’t go here.

name: Sylvia Smith
text: It is 1:59 p.m. I arrived at 1:44 and the doors  were already locked. However, one of nurses let me in. I walked to the check in desk, where there were TWO PEOPLE and they let me stand there until 1:57, before asking how they could help me! I said that I needed to see a doctor and was told that it's almost closing time, so we aren't seeing anymore patients! I would not be out in this rain, (I have lupus) if I didn't need to be. I understand that I was cutting it close BUT THE SIGN SAYS THAT THEY CLOSE AT 2PM  AND NOT WHEN THEY DONT FEELING LIKE CHECKING PATIENTS IN ANYMORE. It's unfortunate because I love Dr. V and  don't know if I'll be bringing myself, my husband, or kids back. It was WHOLLY UNPROFESSIONAL!

name: Stan Fortner
text: Do not recommend if you have breathing issues, I have asthma and copd with trouble breathing and they won’t see you without a mask. I’ll never go back even after I get the breathing problem fixed because anyone with an ounce of common sense knows if you have asthma and copd you don’t wanna put a mask over your face especially if your breathing shallow as it is!

name: Linda Wickliff
text: Poor front counter service. They do not inform you nor provide any instructions to how their process works. They just leave you in the lobby and assume that you know what to do. They nurses in the back were nice but that’s the only thing.

name: Kristie Hutto
text: Have been here several times for various reasons. Always easy and efficient experience.  Staff friendly.  Facility clean and safe. Doctors professional and courteous.

name: Hannah Miller
text: Dr. T has been the best urgent care doctor I've seen in the montgonery area so far. He was very kind and listened well. I had to wait a bit but not too horrible, was in and out within an hour.

name: Treyy Treyy
text: Very nice people ‼️

name: Jeremy Warnken
text: 2 hour wait to then be rushed out.

name: Rachel Mcgough
text:
update: went today and it's still been the best doctor office experience. I actually prefer to go here than to my regular doctor because they are so kind, fast, and thorough. My regular doc may have more equipment at her fingertips. But I feel like these folks care more.

2 years ago: I've been here twice so far. Once for a back injury that could have been serious and they sent me straight to E.R. at no charge for the visit to the clinic telling me to go now. The doc didn't charge because he wanted us to feel less of a financial struggle and resistance to going right then. Second time, my husband had pneumonia and I was with him. Both times, they thoroughly explained what all the potentials were sac answered all of my questions. They even worked with us on pricing the second time. I saw a previous review claiming racism. My husband and I are a mixed couple and yes, he happens to be black. He was with me both times with a different doctor and nurse each time. And, yes, they take people without insurance. I'm not sure what that last bad review was about but my own experiences have been completely different, treated with respect and a lot of consideration I never would have expected at a walk-in clinic. It didn't feel like a walk-in. The folks there seemed to genuinely care, especially when I was pregnant.

name: Guy Fawkes
text: You come in knowing you have a nasty infection brewing. Dr. T simply tells you to take sudafed. I told him I had high blood pressure. So he saud I would just have to take claritin. I asked if I could at least get a steroid shot and he saud that might help with the swelling and reluctantly gave me one. Basically, you have to be ypur own doctor. There are way better doctors at otger doc in a box locations. Not impressed. They also tell you when they're open when you call. Then you show up abd they're closed. Just try somewhere else..

name: Fredrica Johnson
text: The amount of time it was taking to just be called up and give my insurance information was ridiculous. I was one of the first people there and 35 minutes later the first person in the door still had not been seen.

name: Amy Asay
text: I have stage 4 cancer and ended up with pneumonia.  The entire staff was amazing. What I thought was a routine get some antibiotics visit turned into so much more. It turned into a 2 day visit for IV antibiotics each day, which made me very sick during the infusion. Amazing and caring staff! My husband and I are a mixed race couple and I'm on medicare, that didn't matter to them. They were very good to us

name: Anne Paine
text:
Service here was super awesome and environment exceptionally clean.

Staff was extremely professional and caring.
Dr. T and amazing staff, from the bottom of my heart °•○● thank you●○•°!!!
I highly recommend this urgent care.

name: fillup87
text: Dr. T was awesome. The support staff was super friendly. The facility was clean. Would recommend.

name: Kristy Bales
text: I have a stomach bug and was treated at Eastside Urgent Care. The staff was very polite and Dr. T was quick to act in treating my nausea and vomiting.  I felt like he was very knowledgeable and did an excellent job explaining the treatment plan throughout my visit. I am currently breastfeeding and he knew what meds he could give me that would not be bad for my milk supply or my baby. Would definitely recommend this urgent care clinic.

name: Riketa Johnson
text: This place ruined my entire life how can a person come here and take a drug test for a job that they have had for a year and pass due to no drugs in their system but fail due to a small piece of the line where the temperature line is was not all the way shaded in is ridiculous. They black young lady was very rude to my husband he has a hernia mesh in his stomach close to his private area he passed why would you keep making him strain himself to use the bathroom for you then to watch him take his 2nd and 3rd sample what kinda of training is this. What kind of customer service do you people think that you are providing y’all ruined my life and I would like you to know that you made this man lose his job when he passed clear as day but hmm no proof because you know it’s all about who you get don’t know the lady name but she needs to be fired and lose her job too this place is for Caucasian people I guess because they treat black people here any kind of place here do not go here if your black especially

name: joey shelby
text: Super fast experience! Great caring doctors and staff!! love this place! in and out super fast every time

name: Becky Henderson
text: Love this place. The people are so nice and friendly. Dr. V.J is the best.

name: Nathanial Howell
text: I have had a cough for a month and finally decided to go to the doctor. The nurse dos her job but the doctor that saw did nothing. I understand that I went on a Saturday and he probably had better things to do. But I still have a cough and I believe that it is getting worse. No prescription. No diagnosis. Nothing. I paid $56 for nothing.

name: Mae Payne
text: These people have become my family! Dr Vjay Tirumalasetty has literally been my lifesaver. I don't know what I would do without them they're are quick, yet very thorough the Doctor is very knowledgeable. Will continue to keep going.

name: Junior
text: They close earlier than they're supposed to.

name: will t
text: DR veejay is the absolute best and the staff is so nice

name: auwildflower
text: Super nice! Got me in and checked  fairly quickly. Very attentive and kind!! Highly recommended!! Dr. T was great!

name: Sam Lynch
text: Super friendly staff. In and out in no time after getting sick while visiting from Texas

name: Bryony V
text: Dr. T did a great job treating my son. The entire staff was super friendly even after we showed up 20 minutes before closing.

name: absouthern1986
text: Paid a $40 co-pay, sat there for two hours, and the doctor refused to treat me and told me to go to the ER instead. I might as well have put $40 through a paper shredder.

name: Kiki Jo
text: My husband was injured while at work and this was one of the two places he could be treated. I’ve never been treated so rudely & been so disrespected by anyone or any facility. Nurse practitioner Lisa King was very rude and obviously needs assistance in bedside manner. My husband injured his hamstring very badly and she wrapped him up with an ace bandage and gave him ibuprofen and told him to come back Friday. When I asked why he was coming back & what meds did they send she immediately got an attitude with me and stated, “she’d call his job & speak with them since they’re the problem?!?” We asked her for a referral to an orthopedic specialist since there’s nothing they can do for a hamstring & she refused to give it. If you can’t treat someone then refer them to someone who can! There’s no need to come back Friday when you could’ve referred me from the beginning to someone who can actually help. This is my first experience with this facility and I can promise you we won’t be returning. And after speaking with “his job” they won’t be referring any of their employees there either.

name: Lauren Farrow
text: I went yesterday set over a hour and half to be seen once called to the back nurse ask me what was wrong i told her i wasnt sure if it was the flu or sinuses but once the doctor came in and asked what was wrong i told him and the tech was like they always change whats wrong with them when the doctor comes in she was rude and unprofessional the doctor ask me what i want instead of prescribing me what he thought i should take wont be back

name: kemi Bamigbola
text:
My experience over here was super horrible.  Do yourself (or at least if you are black) a favor and go somewhere else. I have a Daughter at Alabama State University and when she complained of a very bad stomach pain, I immediately consulted with our insurance company Aetna, who referred us here (because it was in network), On getting there, they refused to treat her because she did not have a copy of her insurance card on her, I pleaded with the receptionist over the phone and she bluntly told me no, we don’t treat people without insurance. Here is the case I told her, we have insurance, in fact we have the really good kind, (everyone knows college students misplace stuff all the time), so I told her, I will email her a copy of her insurance card, for her to call the insurance company to verify (the standard procedure).  She refused, and said she is unable to verify her identity. I asked my Daughter to show the receptionist her driver’s license, ID card and a copy of her driver’s license and she still refused her care.
At this point, I am hearing my daughter in the background almost in tears, so I offered to have the insurance company fax her the proof of insurance, she refused and proceeded to refer us to another urgent care center that takes “people like us without insurance” I am deeply saddened and disappointed.
At the end, we ended up in the emergency room. DO NOT GO HERE

name: Patricia Bell
text: The staff and Dr. Is very nice friendly people the Dr. diagnosed me correctly and very concern about his patients he also remembered me from the last visit the stay is not long at all I was there about 45 minutes if that AWESOME PLACE TO GO WHEN YOU ARE SICK!

name: Phillip McIntosh
text: Always quick and efficient! Dr. Vijay Tirumalasetty is great

name: Sonny
text: Very professional and quick.  Also a beautiful building.

name: blacky
text: Very fast. Professional staff.  They care about the patient.

name: Michael Irving
text: Saw the Dr yesterday with a diagnosis of a bladder infection. Prescription never called in to pharmacy. Not very professional!

name: Scott Plagmann
text: Had excellent experience at the imaging center!

name: Amber Allison
text: When this place first opened the Doctor was great as well as the staff. They listened. It became my go to place and a place I recommended. The last few times it has gotten worse every time. Yesterday I came in and the staff was rude. The nurse had a bad attitude, you could see and feel the dread in her attitude. She didn’t listen. The doctor was just okay. The other nurse that came in to give me a shot treated me like a dart board. I get sick often so I’ve endured my fair share of shots. After the first STAB I let her know that was really hard and she didn’t blink an eye to STAB me again. Then they called my scripts in to the wrong place after I waited at the pharmacy for an hour. I call the doctors office back and they said it would take awhile to get it to the correct pharmacy so I said I’d just pick it up where they sent it. I get to the next pharmacy and after waiting 30 minutes to get my scripts they informed me the doctors office called and moved them. I call the doctors office back, not happy, and the receptionist had an attitude. I asked why they moved them after I asked them not to and where did they send them this time and she had an even worse attitude. 3 hours after my visit, I got my scripts. 6 hours later I arrived back home. Not pleased with at all! If there was a rating of 0 they earned it. I understand everyone is running ragged here lately. Doctor offices and sick people but rude treatment is still unacceptable. Disappointed!

name: Nancy Waller
text: Whenever I have to go to Southeast Urgent Care, I am welcomed immediately.  I have rarely had to wait more than just a few minutes to go to a room with a technician.  That process goes very quickly and professionally, and within minutes, Dr. Taylor comes in to make his assessment of my plan of care.  I usually require a shot...and the best shot-giver is Josh.  He is a very caring technician and does a great job.  Even though going to a urgent care clinic is due to an injury or illness, this is a wonderful place to go and I always have had a positive experience.  Thank you all!!!

name: NiKki C.
text: The girl's that run this office, from the nurses, to the girl's at the front desk, they are all so helpful and they are always so sweet and very patient and polite. They have gone out of their way to help me with questions even though I called them several times for a few days. Even though their waiting area was full of people, they never did say anything rude to me at all. The doctor is very good also. He is very caring and he's a great doctor.

name: C Willingham
text: If zero were an option that is what they would get. Made me feel like a moron for walking on their door. I was diagnosed with Flu at another facility on Wednesday and went in on Sunday because I am not any better. The NP said well what did you expect? You have the flu. She was so condescending to me it was ridiculous. I have a terrible cough, guess what she prescribed? Phenegran!!! That is not for coughs!!! Terrible place

name: Toni LaVecchia
text: If negative stars were an option that’s what I would pick. I’ve never been treated so poorly at a Doctors office. To top it off they sent my prescription to the wrong pharmacy after telling the Doctor AND the nurse which pharmacy to send them to. Then tried to get me to go pick it up at the pharmacy I had never been to!!!!! I do not recommend this place to anyone.

name: QJ Jordan
text: I was very pleased with my experience. The clinic was very clean and the staff were really polite and professional. I feel the RN gave my toddler an accurate diagnosis and the appropriate treatment. I would definitely recommend Southeast Urgent Care at Fultondale!

name: Rhonda Lovell
text: I have always had a great experience here! From the receptionist to the nurses. The doctors take time with you and don't try to rush to the other patient. Also the wait time has always been minimum.🤒🤧😷You go in feeling bad and within a day usually a lot better!🤗😉😇

name: Mike Prather
text: Love this place. Jessica gives great shots.

name: TL STEWART
text:
Dr. No Bedsidemanner was callous. Nurse basically threatened me because I was crying from news dr gave me. Didn’t want to do my blood work.
Was a nice Dr there before.  Won’t go there again unless I feel like being emotionally abused!

name: Terah Phillips
text: If zero were an option, that's what they would have. My husband nor I have ever received a bill from them, we haven't been to this clinic in over 2 years, but we have received 3 notices of being turned over to collections. Never received a call apologizing, still fighting a $40 charge that was paid 6 months ago. Unbelievable. I cannot say enough bad things about this place.

name: Amelia Garcia
text: Not too happy. I was told that there was one person in line ahead of me when I signed in online. When I got there there were about ten people ahead of me. I was lead to believe that my spot would be held when I called. I have a very busy schedule. When I asked if it would be a reasonable expectation for me to be out at specific time, the lady at the front smirked and informed me that all of the other people were still ahead of me regardless of me previously signing in online. I'm so glad that she got a kick out of it.

name: Nelda Drummond
text: I arrived 30 minutes before closing and an employee locked the door as I was getting out of the car to come in. She looked at me as she was doing it. I was parked in the nearest parking space to the door. This shows no caring and compassion for the sick! I will never go there again and I will tell everyone I know of this experience!

name: Lucy Kiley
text: Took my husband, was treated great, in and out in a timely manor, doctor very through! We will go for our next ER needs!!

name: Meredith Knight
text: I saw Dr. Taylor and he is amazing.  I got my shot and prescription and was done in about 22 minutes!  I usually hate going to the doctor but I will be going here from now on!

name: Dearilo Arnold
text: Everytime I go there they r always helpful.

name: Emile Hughes
text: I went in because I have been having some neck pain. They did a great job, took an xray, talked to me about the problem, and we agreed on a plan if it doesn't resolve. A+

name: Greg Randall
text: I went up to this urgent care with a nasty cold, and they got me in to see the doctor in just a few minutes. It was awesome cause they took care of me, and got me in and out FAST!

name: Lee wright
text: Very nice the Dr was very polite to me.

name: Designs by Me
text: Dr. Jacobs will take care of the situation.

name: Misty Williams
text: So slow... took forever to be seen.

name: JM Wilson
text: No tests, no x-rays, diagnosed within 5 minutes with a stethoscope.

name: Rebecca Jones
text: Fantastic & quick.

name: Jennifer Berry
text: Signing in on line was nice. The front desk staff was so friendly to everyone that walked up. The nurse who triaged me was very kind. The NP that took care of me was knowledgeable, answered questions, and made the experience less stressful. Very satisfied.

name: Caitlin Seahorn
text: We came in at 7:30, right before closing, and we were the only patients there. The staff did not show any sign of any frustration. They were quick to assist me and allowed my husband to do what he could for me. The NP kept me talking to get my mind off my migraine and without realizing, it actually helped. She recommended a pharmacy right down the road since it was after hours and would be easier to get than the pharmacy I listed. Both ladies were super friendly; I’ve never had such a great interaction when I was in such pain.

name: Kei Bottoms
text: It's nice to be able to hold your spot from your phone, and enter all of the necessary information before heading out. You still have to wait some from time to time, but nothing compared to just walking in. Front lady is always very nice, she listens to you well and gives you what you need. I can tell how busy she can be, yet she is very very patient and polite. Entire staff is very nice group of ladies. Highly recommended.

name: Carolyn Holt
text: I am a veteran and the Muscle Shoals location is approved for urgent care needs of veterans when we can't get into our outpatient clinic fast. Upon arrival, I gave the receptionist the info she needed to make sure I am approved for care thru the VA. This poor lady was on the phone for close to 45 min trying to get the information she needed on a reference number. She was transfered to other numbers, only to be disconnected.
