I'll NEVER go here again and I'll tell everyone I know what a bad experience I had!! They didn't even call my prescription in to the pharmacy in in a timely manner!! Y'all truly suck!!

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Gunn,

We appreciate you reaching out and providing us with your feedback. We'll have someone review your chart so that we can follow up accordingly.

name: glennie kirby
text: Awful experience staff doesn’t give out correct information In several different areas from appointment to waiting to when results are back didn’t even post them to the portal so what was the point!

name: Vaniesa Cain
text: They provide Great, caring services, Thankful I Chose to visit them today for medical issues. I would recommend & use their services again if & when required. Thank you!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for choosing MainStreet Family Care! We appreciate you sharing your experience Vaniesa!

name: Trevor Farris
text: waited in the lobby for 2 1/2 hours while others that showed up after me got tested.

name: ANGELA WATSON
text:
I was very pleased with the service I received today. The place is so clean and inviting. Troy was super amazing with everyone, but there was a little boy there and we all know kids can be a little terrified about going to the Dr. Troy made  this little guy feel like the star of the show. Troy complimented his super cool shoes and wanted to play basketball with him. This was probably the first smile on my face all day.
Then I got to meet Super Troy and super he was. Bedside manners were SINCERE and AMAZING! Then I met Maegan who was a charm. Very professional and personal, which made me feel relaxed about being there. She was so sweet and got my second smile of the day!!!
Last but not least was Tory. She was super busy when I arrived, but friendly. She administered my three shots and breathing treatment. Best shot giver EVER!!!! She was so sweet and caring.
I only have rave reviews for the staff and the cleanliness of the facility.
I honestly NEVER thought I would visit here. A very good friend of mine is the Dr.
at the urgent care at D W McMillan, but I knew I couldn’t wait a week to see her. I was in tears when I saw Dr. Garrett was out until next year. She’s the absolute BEST in my book.
Much to my surprise, I was very PLEASED with my service today.
THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing this Angela! That is the SUPER experience we hope to deliver every time! Thank you for choosing MainStreet!

name: Pamela Ivey
text: Our service at the Urgent care was great ,Troy and Megan did an excellent job they were efficient in taking care of my husbands very bad cut and were happy to do follow ups. Thank you Urgent Care I’m glad your there.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us, Pamela! We're glad we could help your husband heal and feel better!

name: Brian Barrow
text: Call first if you can. Here's a secret even if your not needing them but you know in a emergency  this is going to be we're you have to go. Stop in and give them your information that way your paper work is on file. You will be surprised how much easier things go for you.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  Our goal is to have you in and out in less than an hour.  The registration process is much easier if you have the intake form completed upon arrival.

name: Busy Bee
text: SHOUTOUT TO DEBBIE IN BILLING FOR BEING AWESOME!

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: Bill Bettilyon
text: Very kind and friendly staff. The place was really clean and bright.

resp.text: We are glad that you were pleased with our staff and facilities!  Thank you so much for the positive feedback!

name: Box Kidd
text: Unsanitary.

resp.text:
Hi Caspian,

Thank you for reaching out. We certainly try to keep our clinics as clean and sanitary as possible. We would love to get additional feedback on what you observed so that we can follow up accordingly. Please email any details to info@mainstreetfamilycare.com.

Thank you!

name: leslie sherban
text: I had a great experience here. I went on the weekend for a cat bite that became infected. There was hardly a wait which was huge for me and they even called back a few days later to see how I was.   But the thing that impressed me the most was when they told me I could call anytime I had a question or that I could even pop in for them to do a quick visual to make sure it's healing. Not only would I return but I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Ms. Sherban, thank you for your positive feedback! We hope you are feeling better!

name: Monali Chaudhari
text:
WOW. This urgent care used to be my family's favorite urgent care but not after the experience I had with the lady on the phone around 3pm today. Called today to see my brothers covid test and yes I did call twice before today just for some clarifications  and medicine questions about the diagnosis they gave him but nothing about covid because we know covid test can take awhile. Well when I called today for the results the lady on the phone was so rude and kept saying how they've already talked to 2 people and that she doesn't know how many sisters my brother has but she's already talked to 2 people. Ok??? If we knew his results we wouldn't have called to ask for it and wasted your and mine time. She did not want to just say negative or positive for some reason and was being incredibly rude like I was bothering her and like that isn't her job.
Unfriendly and definitely wont be back since we are so much of a bother to this clinic

resp.text: Good morning. We had documentation that the patient/family was notified of all results. We typically receive those type of test results all together. It is highly unlikely that you would have only been notified about one or part of the results. Due to HIPPA and protecting patient confidentiality, we limit information provided over the phone. We apologize for the misunderstanding.

name: Rachel Hooker
text: I had a wonderful experience at Parkway Urgent Care! Only had 2 short pages of paperwork, and I was in and out within 30 minutes on a week day during lunch time + already had my prescription called in to my pharmacy. Originally I had gone to another walk-in clinic where I was told the wait to just be seen was going to be 90 minutes. The staff are very friendly and seem to actually care about your problems. Elena, the nurse practitioner, is super nice and explains everything very well. I will never go to another walk-in clinic after this amazing experience I had at Parkway Urgent Care!

resp.text: Ms. Hooker, thank you for your positive feedback! We are so glad you were pleased with your visit. Come back and see us anytime. :)

name: Megan Lewallen
text: I have visited Parkway Urgent Care twice now. The first time I came in on a Sunday right as they opened with a horrendous ear infection. Elena, the Nurse Practitioner on staff, was quick to get me in the clinic and I was out the door within 35 minutes with my medication called into the pharmacy of my choice. I had such a positive experience that I chose to come back today when I accidentally shut my middle finger in my car door. It was bleeding from incisions on both sides and hurt terribly. A friend of mine who was an Air Force medic came to take a look and determined it would likely just need to be glued and helped me bandage and drove me to the clinic. I arrived at 3:50pm and was seen and treated again by the wonderful Elena and out by 4:21pm. I am so impressed with the kindness of the staff and the attentiveness of everyone I have met here. I feel truly cared for and will definitely choose to come here for my future urgent care needs as well as recommend this clinic to my friends and family. My mother has also been here at my recommendation and was seen and treated quickly as well. Highly recommend checking this clinic out!

resp.text: Ms. Lewallen,  thank you for your positive feedback. We are so glad that you have been pleased with your visits. Come back and see us anytime!

name: Florence Taylor
text: I taught urgent care was to have onsite lab. What is the need of urgent care when your lab takes 48hrs. I was disappointed because I taught they will diagnosed and start the treatment immediately.

name: Chris Bispham
text: Due to the pandemic finding availability with my primary care doctor was hard. The staff here was always very welcoming and helpful. I would recommend these ladies to anyone looking for medical help. They are professional and patient. I have always left feeling as if I've gotten the best care possible. Dr. Kruse is especially amazing and a great doctor. Her bed side manner and tact are top tier.

resp.text: Thank you for your positive feedback. We greatly appreciate it!

name: Bailey Bentley
text: I will definitely be coming back here! All of the staff was very nice and my whole visit only took 45 minutes. The nurse practitioner was awesome. It was an overall great experience!

resp.text: Ms. Bentley we are so glad you had a great experience. Come back and see us anytime! :)

name: Mary McCormack
text: I arrived at PUC at 10:45 on a weekend, and was on my way home by 11:45. I was only asked to fill out a one page medical history and current medication sheet. All staff were friendly and professional. Elena, the Nurse Practitioner, was thorough in her questioning of my symptoms, and even checked my vital signs. She prescribed an antibiotic,  and suggested a tetanus shot if it was 5 years since my last. She answered other medical questions and was very helpful. I highly recommend Parkway Urgent Care for any medical treatment needed. It was an all round pleasant experience,  and I will definitely be back!

resp.text: Ms. McCormack, thank you for your positive feedback! We are so glad you were pleased with your visit. Come back and see us anytime! :)

name: Jennifer Wilson
text: Have been extremely happy with this clinic, as someone who rarely goes to the doctor when I do I am looking for someone that will listen and “believe” the issues I’m having! This place has been amazing at doing that and taking the time and effort to figure out the problem. It’s always clean and inviting, staff is friendly and wait times are low! 10/10 recommend.

resp.text: Ms. Wilson, thank you for your positive feedback! Come back and see us anytime! :)

name: Haley Koch
text: The staff at Parkway Urgent Care was so amazing. I don't have a primary physician and needed to see a doc asap to take care of an infection. I was seen right away after filling out 3 pieces of paper for being a new patient. NP Elena was attentive and made me feel so much better about coming in! She diagnosed me within 10 mins. She called in a prescription that was ready for me as soon as my pharmacy was open. I highly recommend Parkway Urgent Care!

resp.text: Hi Ms. Koch. Thank you for your positive feedback. We are so glad that you were pleased with your visit and that you are feeling better! Come back and see us anytime! :)

name: Julia Blackburn
text: Elena the NP and Courtney at the front desk went above and beyond to help me with a last minute employee health screening that I needed. I called all over town and they were the first and only ones to go above and beyond to help me get seen and get my forms filled out. They were both extremely friendly, fast, and knowledgeable. It was quite literally the best appointment I've ever had and I will definitely be back for future care. I'm so glad that I found this place.

resp.text: We greatly appreciate your positive feedback. We are so glad we could assist you and that you were pleased with your experience. Come back anytime!

name: Cheneka Hayes
text: I was in and out in 45 mins. The staff was so kind to me and the CRNP answered all of my questions and showed that she cared about my health and well being. She didn’t just give me meds and send me on. I would recommend this urgent care to anyone!

resp.text: Ms. Hayes, thank you for your positive feedback. We greatly appreciate it!

name: Brittany Flemmings
text: Moving to a new town can be hard and being sick doesn’t make it any easier. I’m so glad that I was about to find a place that took great care of me. The Nurse practitioner Alayna was very knowledgeable and helpful and kind. I definitely would be back in the future.

resp.text: Ms. Flemmings, thank you for your positive feedback! We hope you feel better soon. Come back and see us anytime. :)

name: Lori Batey
text: I was seen a couple of days ago. The wait time was not long at all. The staff /NP was very friendly! I was seen for my visit from the car. But with covid that’s the new norm.  I highly recommend Parkway Urgent Care. I will definitely be back in the near future!

resp.text: Ms. Batey, thank you for your positive feedback! Come back and see us anytime! :)

name: Kelley McPhail
text: I called and emailed the Urgent Care Clinic a couple of times and was given clear and concise information that I needed before my visit. Came in and they filled out paperwork for needed labs. Next day I came back, lab results were in, met with the CRNP reviewed my bloodwork.  Staff were very knowledgeable, it was a thorough office visit, short wait time, the clinic was very clean and neat. I will come back when in need for urgent care.  Would highly recommend!

resp.text: Ms. McPhail, thank you for your positive feedback. We are glad that you were pleased with your visit. Come back and see us anytime! :)

name: Gretcha Perry
text: This place is wonderful! Low wait times and very kind and knowledgeable staff. Also providing COVID vaccinations and scheduling them faster than anywhere else I've looked into.

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Perry. We appreciate your positive feedback!

name: Jeremy Self
text: Just saw Elena at Parkway urgent care and it was a great experience. I come in with a sprained ankle and she was very thorough in describing the best way to heal my foot. Would highly recommend.

resp.text: We greatly appreciate your positive feedback. We hope you feel better soon! :)

name: Wynter Gates
text: I was sent home with Covid symptoms and happened to pass by this clinic on my way home—-I decided to stop in and get tested. The staff that answered the phones were prompt and friendly. I really appreciated the fact that I did not have to get out of my vehicle for any portion of examination. Elena was friendly and efficient and even called to check in with me a few days after leaving the clinic. They were all kind and very patient with me as I fumbled to find my insurance card and ended up having to call BCBS. I felt important and heard and cared for by this facility and it’s staff! They also have a quick turn around in calling back with results!  When my son became sick a few weeks later I drove from our house in Madison to this location simply because I wanted him to receive the same level of compassion and care that I had received. Elena was patient and gentle while testing him—-she was very personable and made for a good experience even during a difficult time. We will continue to return and I always recommend this facility to anyone searching for a welcoming medical environment!

resp.text: Ms. Gates, we greatly appreciate your positive feedback! Come back and see us anytime. :)

name: Nancy Wheeler
text: Everyone was very nice and My dr was attentive and listened and explained what I needed her name was Kendra and I am starting to feel better I went in for UTI and I didn’t wait long in waiting rm

resp.text: Ms. Wheeler, thank you for your positive feedback. We are so glad you are feeling better! Come back and see us anytime. :)

name: Daveda Chatman
text: I am so grateful for the ladies at the urgent care. They took care of in a timely manner and so professionally!

resp.text: Ms. Chatman, we are so glad that you were pleased with your visit. Thank you for your positive feedback. Come back and see us anytime! :)

name: robin jewellson
text: Highly recommend! Ilove this place!  I would recommend for anyone to go here. The front desk both ladies were very nice. I waited about 5min after filling out 3pages of new patient paperwork. They took me to a room and a NP came in within maybe 3min. She was very nice and asked lots of questions. They did an x-ray and tested me for COVID-19. I dont like going to the dr at all but this place was very professional and they didnt make me feel nervous at all. Thanks for making this a great experience.  Will definitely be returning.

resp.text: Ms. Jewellson, we are so glad that you were pleased with your experience. Thank you for the positive feedback. Come back and see us anytime! :)

name: Beau Blanding
text: The experience was very professional, and I still felt cared for and attended to, even from the car where I had to do my checkup cause COVID symptoms. Excellent place.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Blanding! We are so happy that we could give you a great experience. Thank you for your positive feedback. Come back and see us anytime. :)

name: Dave Adams
text:
Amazing visit!  No real wait time, not much paperwork for a first time visit, and the services provided was great!
Went in with bad back pain, and I was feeling better after the treatment.  Will be coming back as needed, and highly recommend them to all.

name: April Henley
text: Wonderful experience. Very sweet and professional. Also very quick.

name: Drew Yarbrough
text: Fast, professional, and super helpful!

name: Nesha Pruitt
text: Staff Was Friendly, Nurse and Nurse Practitioner Were Nice . Although My Initial Wait Time was WAY TOO LONG for it to be Just Myself and One Other Person in the Office, Once i Got in an Exam Room, I Was Seen and Given a Diagnosis/Prescription in No Time ‼️‼️

name: JASON J
text:
This has to be the best urgent care around. I walked right in, and did not have to wait.  I could not ask for a better Dr or staff.
My husband just recently went there, and they have been calling to check on him. How many Dr do this anymore?
I would recommend this place to anyone!!!!!

name: Tully Kesler
text: Was able to get in quickly. Staff was friendly and efficient. Was in town working from out of state and they accepted my insurance. Will use them again.

name: Frank Coseglia
text: My wife visited Parkway Urgent Care and received prompt care for her injured wrist.   The staff was friendly and professional. They even followed up with a phone call to check on her to make sure everything was OK and she was not experiencing any issues.   Highly recommended!

name: Chris Baker
text: No wait today. Quick , professional, friendly.  Will visit in future if needed. 2 thumbs up !

name: Jaenelle G
text: Nurse Practitioner was friendly and thorough.

name: ROCKET CITY RECORDS
text: They have a very friendly staff that will have you in and out in no time

name: KATHY ZENTNER
text: It's 1100 on a Sunday.  Website says they're open, sign on door says they're open. Building locked, no lights, and no answer on the phone - not even an answering service- after 30 rings.

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience yesterday. Due to circumstances beyond our control came up. No provider was available. Please come see us today. In the future we will certainly try to put a sign on the door.

name: Mary Ellen Millbranth
text: We are long time patients of Dr Zaheer Khan so when I fell at home and had an obviously fractured wrist, I knew to go to the Parkway Urgent Care in the same building,  I was thrilled to enter a beautiful waiting room where there was NO waiting. The staff was very friendly and I was immediately x-rayed with state of the art equipment. The atmosphere was warm and informal. On my visit, I was seen by Sydney Carriger, a certified registered Nurse Practitioner, who impressed me with both her clinical expertise and her caring manner. I didn’t even have to wait there but returned home to be called in less than an hour by Sydney with the radiologist’s interpretation of my films. As it turns out, I also had a non-displaced fracture of my left fibula. They subsequently made me a CD of the films so I could take them to my orthopedist. In addition to radiology, they offer lab services and can, if necessary, rely on Dr Khan’s expertise. I highly recommend this facility.  They are located on the Parkway access road between super Walmart and iHop.

name: Matt Moon
text: These people are fantastic, I highly recommend them!

name: MIKE KIRKWOOD
text: Staff was very professional and almost no wait time! The care that was provided was very professional as well!

name: Torrey Strickland
text: Dr Clark & staff are extremely friendly & professional.  They handle emergency care with ease. After multiple visits the care is consistently excellent. Always a calm & comfortable environment. Prices reasonable. Parking convenient. I Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback 😊

name: Sarah Swann

text:
DO NOT GO HERE! ! ! ! They bill for services they do not complete!  I only left ONE star because I have to leave something so that potential victims can see this warning. 10/19/2018- One of the dentists started on my root canal, charged my insurance, took my money, LEFT a piece of the dental instrument in my tooth and did NOT tell me until I came back on 10/26/2018 complaining of pain. She told me that she'd have to refer me to an Endodontic office so that they can fix what she messed up and assured me that everything would be refunded since they didn't finish the job/procedure. The woman at the front desk who does the billing told me that she would call me back  that day regarding the refund. If she called me, Daffy Duck called me. When I came in on 11/6/2018 she told me that she couldn't process a refund to me until MY insurance sent a form.... Why is a form needed from my insurance when Family Care Dental took money from ME? She also told me that the Endodontic office should not charge me much. and the cost should be well under the $135 that they charged me. Well, the Endodontic office charged me $280.
I opened a Better Business Bureau complaint 10 days ago and unsurprisingly, Family Care  has not responded.... AND their restroom is disgusting. The trash is always overflowing- well it was each of the 3 times I was there and they're too lazy to fix the toilet tissue holder. So they just leave the toilet tissue on the counter because apparently, that's the healthiest place for things that touch your private parts. Just save yourself the unnecessary drama and unscrupulous business practices and stay away from this establishment.

name: David Chambers
text: Everyone was welcoming and friendly.  Not in a rush, which is crucial for me.  Great staff.  Even got to talk "Harry Potter" with Gretchen.  Jennifer was thorough and SUPER kind.  The Doctor (Renee) was a complete professional without being aloof. A great experience.  I will return and encourage others to give the new crew a chance.

name: Marcelus Joseph
text: Absolutely amazing. The new staff is so much better. They take care of you and make you feel comfortable and at home. The wonderful ladies who took care of me were Madison, Rene, and Gretchen. I highly suggest everyone come here.

name: Marissa Lycans
text: This was my first time going to UCM and I was very impressed. The NP was super friendly and so was the staff. I was in and out in 15 minutes. The NP had my diagnosis and prescription within 5 minutes. The only negative is there wasn’t a purse holder on the back of the door in the bathroom. I would recommend UCM!

name: Krista Graham
text: Very nice from phone call to when I got there til the time I left. Very knowledgeable and worked with u to make ur visit easy and smooth.  In and out in no time as a walk in. The front desk, nurse,  and doctor was on the same pg and a very nice staff. I enjoy going here and very reasonable pricing.

name: Geri White
text: The staff is friendly, quick ,and efficient at UCM.  I get seen within several minutes.  The doctors and Nurse Practitioners have always diagnosed me correctly with correct medicines to resolve the issue.  Excellent facility...very clean and modern.

name: Heather Rice
text: I loved how quickly they got me back and seen by the doctor. I let them know I only had a short time until I had to be at work and they were very accommodating. The office was very clean and had a friendly atmosphere. The doctor made me feel like he was my friend and truly cared about me. I would definitely recommend this doctors office!

name: Maddy McKinney
text:
UCM

Very sanitary and clean environment. Caring and nice staff. I come here every time when I am ill and the doctors listen and care and try to get the best medication for you.

name: Robin Jones
text:
I went in and there was no wait... I got in and got out ! Ms. Jennifer and her team were AMAZING ! I do not normally rate business but this Urgent Care patient care and customer service deserved 5 stars.
If I was to make a recommendation, I would love to see some modern upgrade.

Thanks Team 😊

name: ANN PETTUS
text: I had the pleasure of being seen here today. The Staff was amazing and so kind. I was in and out they jumped right on my issue. Which was severe pain in my right wrist. I got grays that came out good and the Dr resolved my problem with 2 shots. 5hrs later I feel great no pain. I definitely recommend!!

name: Billie Jo Flowers
text: I was very disappointed in doctor even though I had been there several times in past year. Without divulging my medical problem,  they should and do have my medical history. The nurse seeing me before doc seemed to be more aware. Poor bedside manner. Done with this place!

name: Samantha Booker
text: I came in today as a new patient, I waited only approximately half an hour including the time it took to fill out the paperwork before being called to the back. The staff was very kind and professional. After being taken back my vitals were taken immediately, a little while later the doctor came in and introduced herself and got right to what is going on with me, called me in a prescription for my antibiotic and hot me right on out there for door. I was here maybe a little over an hour altogether. I will come back in the future and I definitely recommend to anyone else in need of urgent Care.

name: Josh Hiatt
text: I had an awesome experience at UCM! The staff was professional, very competent, efficient and thorough. I highly recommend.

name: Rick Jaramillo
text:
Waiting in lobby for three hours. Then into waiting room for 30m at least now. Here for sore throat, staying here til I'm dead apparently.
*Update* still waiting and probably contaminating this room with my sick. Also noticed the window is bordered up with plastic patient gowns taped to the window frame.
*Update* nearing hour four still waiting in my cell to be seen. Getting pretty hungry.
*Update* apparently walking out of your cell and asking how much longer earns you to be seen immediately by the doctor.

name: Madisen Molitor
text: I really enjoyed this place. The staff was very friendly and funny. They got me right in and explained everything very well to me. One of my favorite urgent care places.

name: Travis Eberhart
text: This is my third and final visit over the past year.  Pay close attention to your bill whenever you receive it.  They will often charge for items never conducted or agreed upon.  The wait times are ridiculous and the doctors are not very knowledgeable on common illnesses. They will automatically order lab tests ran despite having a correlating symptoms for those tests. I went in for the last time today with complaint of a sinus issue and they ordered abdominal X-RAYS to be conducted with lab tests on Strep, flu, and blood work.  I asked to speak with the doctor and they just asked me to leave the office.  I wish I would have read these reviews prior to ever coming to this place.  Again, pay close attention to your bill.  They charged me for a specialist co-pay instead a normal office visit co-pay.  I asked the lady at the front desk what "specialist" I was seeing and she stated that the owner of the clinic was a Pulmonary specialist and that is the reason why they are allowed for the increased fees.

name: Brother’s keeper
text: Had a great experience @ UCM. It was fast and friendly. Was in and out within one hour. Will be back for sure!

name: Brien Dickson
text: I was treated at this urgent care and had a very good experience. The front desk receptionist provided courteous and professional service from the moment I walked through the door.  I had a TriCare prior authorization which they accepted without issue. The nurse practitioner who took my vitals and history was equally pleasant.  She provide excellent care.  The Doctor capably provided his diagnosis and treatment plan.  All services were efficient and clearly communicated. I would have given 5 stars had they accepted an alternate id number besides my ssn.

name: A Google User
text: Do not go here! I have been twice now, once last year for a severe case of flu, and recently for an STD test. Last year when I had a bad case of the flu, I went, and was assured that insurance would cover the shot they gave me to get better. A month later, I got a bill in the mail. When I went for the STD test, they took my copay before seeing me, took my pulse, my blood pressure, and then took me to another room where they told me that insurance might not cover the tests. They then tried to give me a shot and a prescription for some pills. I refused, as I had not had a test, let alone a test that came back positive. They wouldn't refund me my copay, and told me to hold on to the prescription "just in case." This place is a scam designed to get your money. NEVER GO HERE!

name: elogrl
text: This is the WORST Urgent Care. I have ever been to. It’s a dingy office. The receptionist said she couldn’t pull up my insurance information. I called the insurance company and they gave me the exact membership number that was on my card. I also asked the receptionist if she needed to speak with them. She told me it was not pulling up and she would call them. She told me she called and they were closed as if I lied about calling. I called back and put the insurance company on speaker phone in front of people in the office to prove my innocence. I handed her my personal cell phone for her to complete my paperwork. I have never been through this much to see any doctor. The care is not urgent either. I came in at 10:30 and left at 1:05. There was only 2 people in the lobby ahead of me and 1 other patient that walked out of the back. The Practitioner came in and didn’t even introduce herself. ( Angela Gann ) She gave me my diagnosis and asked me to come back for a follow up. I told her I won’t be back and explained the situation. She gave me a dry apology. She went to the front desk and started talking about me. My door was open. I heard everything. I addressed the Nurse Practitioner letting her know I heard everything. The nurse that checked my weight said make sure you tell them in the review that you told her what you wanted prescribed. I told her I would. There’s absolutely nothing wrong with me suggesting the medication I would like to be treated with. The staff is not friendly or professional.  Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else.

name: Janelle Wassell
text: I have taken my son here several times and have been happy each time. UCM staff is friendly, courteous and the wait time is more than acceptable!

name: Kelly Redman
text: I got there at 5:10 on a Saturday afternoon.  The doors were locked but the website says they are open until 6 pm.  The girl at the front desk never even looked my way.  I noticed all the times have been removed from the door.  So, I drove over to American Family off Nance.  I arrived at 5:35 and was seen quickly.  I won't even bother trying Urgent Care next time.

name: de vida loka
text: Great place. Front desk is very nice, NP is great and Gretchen is a fantastic nurse.

name: Austin Marsh
text: We waited for 2 hours just to get back and an hour to see the doctor only to be prescribed over the counter medications that my wife has already been taking. I made him aware of the medications she has been taking and that they were ineffective. I called to request a different prescription and they refused

name: Kara Pleasant
text: They were very quick but no one was in there. Staff was friendly, but everyone seems to be unsure of themselves. Also,.recommend they get a female nurse.

name: Sarah Stimpson
text: This is a great office with a wonderful caring doctor. The office is never full and I am always seen very quickly.  Highly recommend!!!!

name: Derek Hunt
text: My Doctor was very knowledgeable and my experience here went well. Plus they got me in and out. UCM

name: Scott Simmons
text: My name is Scott Stiles. I am a Google Maps Local Guide (Level 6). My experience allows me to attest that the bad reviews of this place are real and genuine, not fake or manipulated. The public vetting process that is Google Maps reviews has exposed a bad apple in the local community. Consume a portion of this apple at your own risk.

name: Rachel Rozelle
text: They took me back immediately. The staff was friendly and helpful. The doctor seemed knowledgeable. They definitely resolved my problem.

name: Jon Bryant
text: This location is sluggish and slow with getting results back. I'd recommend going anywhere else when it comes to getting tests done. Buyer beware

name: George Barnett
text:
Their website states their open until 730pm M-F...
I went in at 655pm on Friday night and was told the doctor refused to see anyone after 630pm.
I have a chronic condition that needs attention at times but, this doctor couldn't be bothered to
take what would have been 5 minutes of his time to see a patient in need or URGENT CARE....
Too bad, what a way to present your business to Madison and the surrounding area.

name: Leeanne/Aaron Brown
text: Dr. seemed nice and knowledgeable however it took almost four hours from in the door to leaving.  Sitting with a badly sprained foot in a waiting room chair was not a pleasant experience.  If the least bit crowded, go elsewhere! Do not wait!  They are VERY slow.

name: Melitza Tonn
text: This urgent care has hours listed from 730am-7pm. We arrived at 6:10pm to be told they have taken their last patient for the day and will not be seeing any me patients. They made no exception for the fact i was there due to a severe cut on my finger. I was told they would reopen tomorrow at 730am and to go to an E.R. Why post hours that you are open until 7pm but so accepting patients at 6pm? Change your hours or make it clear that you stop taking patients at 6pm. Very unhappy.

name: Chris Dale
text: This place is great. You can get in and out rather quickly and the staff is amazing.

name: Dharmendra Kumar
text: Review is related to billing. I went there for preventive checkup. I asked them multiple times before visit and they assured that they handle preventive visits. They claimed to insurance as sick visit and insurance did not page as I did not have copay. I got a big bill for single visit and they were not ready to correct the bill after many follow up. I ended up paying from my pocket. Will not recommend anyone to go there as they gave me wrong info during visit

name: Grant Baker
text: Rudely turned down a 3 year old with a 103 fever at 5:30 PM, despite being open until 6:00pm.  The nurses and dr were behind the counter laughing about as my child suffered.  As fast as I could, I went down the road to to another urgent care (AFC) that also closed at 6:00.  They gladly accepted us at 5:58!

name: Jasper Kigar
text:
I'm going out of my way to complain in order to warn people. Pick your red flag: A). It's a reconstituted bank complete w/drive thru windows, B). Vomit stains on the lobby carpeting. C). Teenage receptionist who did not make eye-contact, doesn't know basics, and doesn't care.

These flags caused my sick self to not trust the care I might have received, and walk out untreated. I felt like I was in a less-developed country, to be honest.

name: Whitley Dawson
text:
Went in for cough and shortness of breath early morning on 4/7/18. This was my 3rd time here over the course of 2 years, the previous times I sought treatment here the experience had been fine. Long story short I was given only amoxicillin for my cough, ear pain, shortness of breath and congestion. When I asked for something for my severe ear pain I was told to take ibuprofen. The diagnosis was an upper respiratory infection. After 3 days of taking the amoxicillin my symptoms got worse and the ear pain didn’t go away. I went to a different urgent care center where they did a full work up and told me I had bronchitis. They gave me a steroid shot, z-pac, inhaler, steroids, ear drops and cough medicine. I’m not sure if they are afraid to prescribe medication at the other place but I will not be back.
A month or so ago my sister was in a car accident. She went to the urgent care center of Madison where they attempted to do an x-ray but they didn’t have someone experienced with the equipment as they took x-rays of the pillow and other places other than my sisters back. After exposing my sister to all that they referred her to an imaging center. They also sent her home with ibuprofen.

name: Katie Phonthibsvads
text: My husband went in for back pain . The doctor thought it might be sciatica and was going to schedule an MRI. 4 weeks later my husband called wondering what was up with the MRI. He was told they called to make an appointment but didn't know what time to make it for so they didn't schedule it, instead of calling my husband to see what time was good for him. He told them schedule it for whenever and the nurse said she'd she take care of it that day . 5 days later and nothing. I went in to see what was up. The doctor that my husband saw no longer worked there and she had to get the MRI approved by another doctor. Then they had to clear it with our insurance and she'd get an appointment for the next day. It's been 2 weeks now and still haven't heard from them. I have an  appointment with another doctor who will hopefully be more reliable and more professional than urgent care.

name: Sean Lovell
text: I went in on Labor Day and despite it being a holliday they were very fast, thorough, and friendly!

name: Erik Lakso
text: I will never go here again.  Ever.  An hour before they close we were turned away by the staff despite the waiting room and parking lot being empty.  Ended up spending 4 hours at the emergency room because they wouldn't spend 15 mins to check out someone in severe pain.  This place will NEVER get my business.

name: S Sidney
text: Update on my HORRIBLE experience. Visited the office Wed. Was diagnosed with a muscle spasm given a shot and 2 sample muscle relaxer medications and was told by Dr Dyer to let her know if the meds worked because she would call a prescription in. Meds seem to be providing some small relief,which is better than none. I call Fri, speak to "receptionist" Ashley, let her know I'm needing the Dr to call the prescription in. She tells me she'll let her know when she gets back. I ask if someone (the Dr, a nurse or herself) will call me back & notify me that it's been done. She says yes. 2 hrs later, still no return call, I call back to follow up. Ashley informs me NOW that the Dr won't be back until Mon. I let her know I'm in pain today and want to see if any other Dr is able to call script in. She says she'll ask & I'm told AGAIN someone will call me back. No one calls. Saturday I call a 3rd time, get Ashley AGAIN. Immediately ask to speak to a nurse. She doesn't put one on, instead wants to take a message AGAIN. I inform her this is my 3rd time speaking to her and was ensured I'd get a call back the 2 previous time and NEVER did. She simply states "we're kinda busy". OF COURSE, hrs later still no return call. A friend calls from her phone, Ashley answers. She ask to speak to a Dr. Ashley takes a message. My friend received a return call from the Dr in office NOT 10 MINS  LATER. I however, have called 3 times and NEVER ONCE RECEIVED A RETURN CALL. Never again will I spend any of my money in this place and I will tell EVERYONE I know to avoid them at all cost. The way the conduct business is REPREHENSIBLE!

name: Paula Spicerkuhn
text: I have been to this clinic twice over the last 18 months or so, on weekends with my doctor is closed.  The first time I was waiting on my new insurance card, so they gave me all the paperwork I would need to get reimbursed and each time they have listened to me.  This last time I had trouble at the pharmacy so I called them and they offered to call the pharmacy again.  It turned out the pharmacy was having phone problems.  I went back after the first time because of a good experience and will continue to use them when I need to get in on weekends.

name: Heather C
text:
Experience is very hit or miss here although the nursing and front desk staff have been great. This is the only urgent care in town that will accept my sons' insurance, so we came here early last month when he had the flu. That diagnosis went fine, and he was better in a few days. However, my husband started experiencing symptoms within days of my son. We came back here thinking it would be a simple diagnosis and they would give him a Tamiflu prescription since they diagnosed my son. However, they performed a flu test that came back negative (too early), refused to give him Tamiflu, and told him he needed to be seen by another dr if his symptoms got any worse. Because of this, we ended up in the ER the same night and were told at that time that is was too early for him to have a positive flu test. $800 ER bill later, we received the Tamiflu prescription. Urgent Care of Madison could have saved us money and time, but they would not even write a prescription for Tamiflu after diagnosing someone else in the family, and now they are sending a bill after doing nothing.

This is not our first poor experience here either.

name: Jim Williams (CenterFade)
text: Friendly staff that really makes you feel at home.  Would recommend them to anyone.

name: Kelly McGlynn
text:
I had an ingrown toenail and no insurance.  I was told my flat rate was 125, yikes big price.  But I paid it.  I was second on theblist and arrived right when they opened at 7:30. Had to wait about thirty minutes to forty before I was called to an examination room.

I sat there from 8ish until close to 11. I was told over and over again the practioner would be right with me.  It was freezing in that room might I add.  I was also tested for a blood infection cause of my toe.  She finally came in a little after 11 and examined my toe. I figured she would be able to cut along the side straight down.  I was told then and there she was not certfied/cleared to do such a procedure.  This confused because it is listed on their site they can treat ingrown toenails.

It was treated and it was painful.  I was told the proper care,  Ina small dose.  But what really surprised me was the lack thereof of a bandage. No ointment was placed on it after it,  but a guaze and a single bandaid was placed on my big toe.  It did not stay on long and started to peel off after an hour,  thus more infection invitation.

After that ordeal,  I go to pay and I am hit with a twenty buck charge for my blood work.  I was confused because I had no blood taken from me.  No, it was the prick they did and I was not told at the time it'd be another charge. So I did not appreciate that.  Nor did I appreciate the fact it was 145 for just a blood pressure and pulse check,  examining my toe and clipping?/ draining it and a prick ob my finger.  Nor did I appreciate waiting for so long when I was the second to arrive.

Also,  when I exited I saw many people dressed formally talking down the hall and outside blocking the path to the doors.  Thus,  they were blocking the way for possible elederly and/or people with special needs. I was told they were busy and hence why it took so long.  I heard people come and go through those hours I was in my room.

Anyways,  she did what she could and did help my toe some and the pain has died down  but i was over charged and unfairly charged for the blood work. The employees should inform their patients what and why they are being charged. So no i am not coming back and dont reccommend this place for urgent care.

name: Benjamin Khammar
text:
This urgent care clinic is very quick - you are in and out in a very timely manner; unfortunately, they don't bring anything else to the table. The nurses are instructed to run order tests (technically under the doctor's orders) before the doctor actually speaks to or looks at you -  this happened to me multiple times. Each time, a nurse has told me that the test are "protocol" and I can't turn them down - after I signed a patient's bill of rights, containing a clause stating that a patient can refuse any medical care - which is federal law. I had to argue with a nurse to turn down a chest x-ray for a minor sore throat. First, I asked why- she said that it will detect bronchitis. A quick google search told me that it bronchitis shows up on a chest x-ray about 25% of the time. It also informed me that I didn't have any symptoms of bronchitis. Turns out that they also ran a completely unnecessary white blood cell count test, which the doctor told me would not have affected his treatment, regardless of the result (after the fact). The doctor actually looked at me after this ordeal. He was able to tell me that I had an ear infection after a 2-minute physical examination. None of the three protocol tests were in any way necessary.

In a separate incident, there was another minor sore throat that had persisted for 2 weeks, accompanied by a couple bumps under the tongue. The nurse followed protocol and said they were running 3 tests, including a strep test. I declined this, only to be told in an extremely rude manner - by a different nurse this time -  that it is "protocol" and I can't change protocol. I reminded her that her protocol is internal, and it can certainly be deviated from. In fact, it is federal law.

My insurance company was actually billed for the 2nd incident (I was billed for a small portion as well). I went to the office to request a refund for myself and my insurance company - only to be told by the head nurse that they can't do it. Of course after digging deeper - she literally meant that they can't refund, but their billing company can. This was only the beginning of the battle of semantics. She also told me that she I can't speak to her manager, because she is the head nurse and the manager. After discussing further, I learned that she does have a boss (surprise!). She finally agreed to email him/her and have them contact me the next day. That was a week ago...

Please understand that this is one of the most important factor in rising health care costs and boycott this place. I have also been to North Alabama Medical Care in south Huntsville twice, and although they do try to pull some BS- it is not nearly to this degree. They actually have the doctor look at you before running unnecessary tests.

name: Bryant Keller
text: Dr P is a wonderful doctor that truly cares about his patients.

name: Tammy Coonfield
text:
NEVER GO ! EVEN PHARMACY NOT IMPRESSED WITH THEIR KNOWLEDGE of what they prescribed me AND SERVICE.
URGENT Care Madison Sullivan St.
They were not busy at all. Now understand why. Have bronchitis told dr over counter cough med was NOT WORKING . COUCHING keeping me awake and huurting in my chest. Was told giving me a liquid cough med and pill cough medicine decongestion and antibiotic and an antibiotic shot . Went to pick up prescription at pharmacy only pill cough medicine. Called them they called pharmacy to get straightened out. I called pharmacy they said it was an over the counter cough med insurance would not pay. Get it off shelf. I called Urgent Care back explained she said no that is not correct . URGENT CARE spoke to pharmacist and then called me. I then called pharmacy again. The pharmacist stated that neither the two employees she spoke to INCLUDING  NURSE EVEN KNEW THE MED that was prescribed to me and that she THE PHARMACIST WAS NOT IMPRESSED WITH THE URGENT CARE STAFF and NEITHER AM I OR MY HUSBAND.

name: Carol Foster
text: Not so urgent.   I waited 4 hours when there was no one in the waiting room.   They wanted to talk about everything besides what I was there for.   X-ray tech was incompetent.   I waited over 6 weeks to get info to file with insurance even though I called the same afternoon, and had to call and remind them after 4 weeks.   2nd piece of info was promised to be ready to pick up. I was left waiting AGAIN so they could collect Co -Pays from other patients sitting in the lobby even though my Information was laying under the counter and could have just been handed to me.  Avoid this place like the plague.   ER would be faster and less hassle.

name: April Zimmermann
text: Don’t waist your time if you’ve got an infant. My insurance company suggested I bring my sick 4 mo old here ASAP. Upon arrival was told they didn’t have a nurse practitioner present that could see a children under 3 years of age. Save yourself the hassle and go across the street to the Urgent Care off of Ivory Pl.

name: Steven Sims
text: DO NOT GO HERE!!! Insurance did not cover my visit because Urgent Care doesn't bill as an office visit and had to pay $140 out of pocket + medicine costs for routine visit. They would not adjust or change billing so insurance would cover after several calls.    I have used other "urgent care" such as American Family Care numerous times with the same insurance and never, never had to pay more than my co-pay out of pocket. I have BC/BS.  I will not be back.

name: shelly moo
text: I am EXTREMELY greatful for the Dr Benjamin Fabvis( sorry, if spelling is wrong:-) ) who helped my mother. It was truly a matter of life & death for her. And for that I will be forever greatful. With that being said, I hope & pray we don't have billing issues like other patients according to the reviews.

name: K Pax
text: Waiting for at least an hour for something as simple as a prescription.

name: Kimmese Smiths
text: Terrible service. after seeing a nurse we had to wait 2 hours before the doctor came in. The front desk nurse gave us dirty looks when we asked how much longer we needed to wait. Will never come back.

name: Shawn Sullivan
text:
When I first went to Urgent Care, I had a good experience. Unfortunately, I developed Thrush when I was put on strong Antibiotics. I called when I discovered my tongue was covered in white, and i was told that I didn't need to come in, that they would just phone it in for me. I waited a few hours and nothing.. I called and I was told it was phoned in. I asked them which prescription was phoned in, and when she checked my files, she said "Oh, it hasn't been done yet.."  I was assured someone would call me back in 30 minutes, which didn't happen. I then called back in and was again given the run around.. I told her I expected an update ASAP, and if they didn't have one, I'd call back in. Well, needless to say, they didn't give me one. I called back at 4pm - almost 6 hours after my initial call and was told "it's in the doctors file and they're waiting for him to approve it, which he will in between patients.." The next day, at 11am, I called back to find out what was going on. I was then told that the doctor that was now there didn't feel comfortable prescribing me an anti-fungal cream because of the legal risk - like I'm going to be freebasing Nystatin?!? They gave me two antibiotics, including Levoquin.. How could I not develop Thrush? All they cared about was getting my $$.. No one bothered to call me once. I had to call them a total of 4 times to eventually be told that they wouldn't help me unless I came in.. The irony is I OFFERED TO COME IN ORIGINALLY AND THEY TOLD ME IT WOULDN'T BE NECESSARY!!! They wasted my time.

MDVIP - Here I come. I'll pay money to get someone that cares, and not just trying to pack in as many patients and copays as possible.

name: Colleen Noletto
text: This Urgent Care was advertised as being open till 7pm. I arrived, sick, at 6:30 pm. I was turned away because things were "slow" and they decided to close up shop early. Will not be back. So unprofessional.

name: Thai Huynh
text: Worst service ever. They will not see you unless they feel like it. 3 hours between getting into a room and actually seeing somebody.

name: Robert Turner
text: this is the most horrible place to go to!!!! I will never go there again . the staff was horrible and the nurse practitioner was worst. The wait was forever and the staff was not nice and i could hear them complaining about  pt's in my room. Very unprofessional staff.

name: Peggy Cobb
text: Madison Urgent Care opens at 7:30 a.m., I'm the only person here and after 30 minutes, I'm still sitting in the lobby.  The Doctor and staff just got here.

name: Machelle Naulty
text: Wanted to charge $30 for a flu shot even if I had insurance.

name: Joseph Oberlander
text: Front office staff was unprofessional and the doctors tend to be in a hurry and do very little to diagnose. Had to go to another clinic.

name: Janna F
text: Terrible experience. Office billed with incorrect diagnosis code, and services were not covered by insurance. I've been calling every week, and their "billing" department states they will call me back but never do.

name: Brian Stewart
text: They claim to open at 7:30 so I get to the parking lot at 7:25 and am the only one here.  Staff begins to rolll in about 7:35, doors don't get unlocked until 7:45.  Finally make it to a room at 8:10 and don't get to see a doctor until 8:50.  If the 7:30am open time is your selling point on this location, don't bother.

name: Jonathan
text: This place is no longer in business

name: Tristan Myles
text: WORST PLACE I EVER BEEN TO. WAS THERE FOR 3 HOURS AND DIDNT EVEN GET WHAT I NEEDED!

name: BOBEYR HIALL
text: Worst service ever, took 3 hours just to get in a room!

name: Michael Jones
text: They are a walk in clinic and refuse new patients after 6 even though they're open until 7.

name: Amber Yell
text: The Staff is very personal and friendly. Really Listened to me and the wait was not long at all! We be going back!

name: David Keel
text: Thanks for the warning.

name: Henry Purvis
text: Why is it that when your back locks up and you’re in so much pain you can’t put your boots on or get in and out of your car that they charge you for seeing a doctor but only hand you off to a nurse practitioner who “can’t prescribe pain medication” I have never had any problems with pain medication and never will. I’ve been a few times in the last 7 years I’ve lived in Florence and they’ve always given me a shot and a prescription for flexoril, steroids and a few pain killers. I’m not going to waste my time with these places anymore. Thanks for nothing med plus.

name: Isabella
text: I was in and out within an hour. I saw Dr. Lee and she was very welcoming and warm. I usually come here at least once a year. I’ve never had a bad experience.

name: Rebecca Kent
text: Run, don’t walk, away from here! They never answer the phone. Front desk staff is horrible they don’t wear masks, and they refused to let me see my primary care provider they sent me to the ER , which the ER told me I should have gone to a primary care provider. They sent me away because it was a Friday and I was an inconvenience. The floors are filthy and it is clear they do not clean. I just left and there was blood on the floor in my exam room!!!!! The PA was very nice, but overall a terrible clinic I will not go back.

name: Sabrina Samano
text: So fast. Truly care about their patients. Had different healthcare providers the past two visits & all have been wonderful!

name: Linda Ealey
text:
I've been going here for years and always paid my bills but recently received a threatening letter (during these awful times with the corona where people are losing jobs and have no income by the way!) that claims this is their 3rd time sending me a notice (it's not! it's the 1st) and that if I don't pay the high amount that I can't afford right now, that I'm no longer able to come back and they will send it to collections.

What a great way to treat your long time paying customers, I'm never going back to Med Plus, it's time for me to find a permanent primary care Dr. anyway.

name: tyler inman
text: I have lived in Florence my whole life and it’s sad to see a doctors office like this. They have the WORST customer service and I mean the WORST. Every time I call, they have a terrible attitude. This is the reason I would rather go somewhere else to visit the doctor. The people at the desk are rude in person and over the phone. They hardly pickup the phone when I do call. I have to call 2-3 times for them to even answer. Not to mention I called last night to get antibody tested and they told me to come up there and they would, but when I drove 30 minutes to get there they told me they couldn’t test me and told me to come back at 7am. They did not close for another hour at that time, so the fact that they couldn’t draw my blood is ridiculous. It frustrates me and if anyone is trying to get tested for covid or visit a doctor in Florence, go somewhere else. Med Plus is not a friendly environment and they do not treat patients nicely. If you work at med plus.. do better.

name: Madison Stewart
text:
The staff and physicians here do not care about their patients. They are the most incompetent people I’ve ever had to deal with. Speaking with Brandi the physician after what happened earlier. Hoping to get a resolution but instead. She has no regard for her patients and defends the incompetence of her staff.
They will kill someone if they already haven’t and they will feel no remorse whatsoever. Do not go here if you have the choice!

name: Rachel S
text: Linda Lee is the best doctor I have ever seen! She listens, is empathetic and knows just how to help. She is obviously very intelligent and is the best at helping you feel your best. I strongly recommend her to anyone that feels they aren’t heard or is needing help medically.

name: Elaine Price
text: I would like to thank the MD who was working the evening of 1/23/20. My son needed stitches. She was very compassionate to him and to me. She listened and even hugged both of us. There is more to this story that I don’t want to share publicly, but let’s just say she was a listening ear and a shoulder to cry on when we needed one. She could have just stitched it up and sent us home. But she took the time to connect with us. She made a true difference in our lives that night. We won’t forget. Thank you.

name: Matthew Nowack
text: This review is a follow-up of my visit to this unpleasant establishment. Where do I start with the utter inconvenience of a visit this has been? The phone call: I decided that I would attempt to book an appointment (like a normal human being) and avoid wasting half of my day to be treated for a basic clinical diagnosis. This business doesn’t take appointments for some reason (because they’re stuck in a 1900’s complacency mentality). Thereafter, I walked into the waiting room and there were only 3 visitors in total (including myself). No surprise there, given the fact that this place is a nightmare. I was rudely informed that I needed to fill out administrative work regarding my visit, and I asked if they already had my file (since I have been here before). They continued to explain that my file was old (it wasn’t) and I needed to update information (not true). Around 1 hour later I was informed that INFORMATION was finalized. At this point, I was the only patient waiting for treatment. After a few more minutes of waiting I was finally called into the Patient’s Entrance. Wow, the holy grail of treating a cold/sinus infection has finally gotten prepared to tell me I need a Z-pack. The doctor proceeded to ask me the same 4 questions 3 separate times. They were rude, they were slow, and they didn’t respect me or my time.

name: Allen B
text: Came in with a severe sinus infection.  Went to another clinic the week before and they told me to go home and sweat it out.  By the time I reached med plus, I was in serious pain and could barely talk.  Everyone was very friendly and didn't waste a bunch of my time asking irrelevant questions.  Dr. Grutzik was very thorough and friendly.  Was starting to feel better within a few hours.  My hats off to Dr. Grutzik and med plus.  Job well done 👍.

name: Stephanie Cornatzer
text: Brandi Ray is wonderful she has been truly a lifesaver for my family and even my sister family. She is so awesome!! All the doctors are great and truly care. And also the best nurse in the world Alli works there and my son wont get a shot from anyone else! Lol they are all great!!!

name: WMBW Love
text:
I get a different Dr. every time I visit, I've been back to back,  most of them really don't know what they're doing, every time I go back I'm getting told something completely different.

I wish they would do x-ray, blood work because I feel like I wouldn't have to go back still sick with the same thing over and over, they'd prescribe me meds and then I'll be back sick with the same thing in about 2 months, it's like they're Dr.'s in training and don't know what they're doing.

Even my sister went, she was still sick after they gave her meds so she had to make another appointment (and pay) and get different meds and she's STILL sick!

I'm just going to find a real Dr. else where, it's not worth it staying sick and wasting money on their service if they don't know what they're talking about, none of them!

And all of the ladies in the back have nasty attitudes (the ones that write down your info and check your weight)

They also wouldn't give me a temporary refill on my diabetic medication until I found a  real Dr., so it was pointless and the bills they sent you are so high!!

name: Jordan
text: Doctor Ferguson is fantastic. Always professional and explains everything thoroughly. Sometimes it’s a little bit of a wait but not often. Worth the wait if they are busy

name: Big Hand Dave
text: In and out very quick. I was very impressed with reception staff. They were quick and professional.  The nurse and nurse practitioner was very quick, thorough and professional. I was in and out in alittle over 20 minutes. Thank you. So much

name: Julia Savoie
text: Did not listen to what I had to say whatsoever

name: Rachel Berry
text: Every time I've been here I've been welcomed with open arms. Doctors and nurses are always sympathetic to my needs. They consistently listen to, and consider my symptoms, and take me seriously. 5/5 Would recommend to everyone.

name: Jimi S
text: Brandi Ray is the Nurse Practitioner for General Family Practice there and she is a literal life saver. She is the utmost kind and caring and genuine medical professional I've ever worked with. She takes the time to really listen and address all my concerns no matter how big or small. And when I'm sick she works me in and has even stayed late to see me. If your looking for a Family Medical Provider she's your woman. I am so thankful for her and her guidance.

name: Major League Carpenter
text: Dr. Lee was amazing, made the experience as enjoyable as possible. Very pleased.

name: Mitchell M
text:
I had a very fast visit and the administrative ladies were wonderful. However, the doctor was talking over me and didn't seem interested in hearing what I had to say. Seemed more like he was ready to get me out than give me an accurate diagnosis.
All in all it was an okay experience.

name: Kaylee Walker
text: Dr. Lee was absolutely amazing with our five year old! It’s so nice to have a kind doctor, who truly loves their work! It makes all the difference!

name: Charlie C
text: Dr Lee is great, willing to listen to your concerns. Always a good feeling when seen here. Nurse practitioner and nurses here are great as well.

name: Josh Berry
text: Dr.Lee is one of the best physicians i’ve been too, she is great. Took awhile to get back there though.

name: Casey Corbett
text: Don’t accept Tricare....military and military families, FYSA

name: Paige Montgomery
text: Slowest doctors office I’ve ever been to. It’s not particularly clean, and when I was getting an IV the woman sticking me did not wear gloves and had sparkly long nails. I have never been to a medical establishment that allows employees to have nails. They were rude and dismissed almost everything I said about my own symptoms and body. I will not be coming back, I don’t recommend others be treated here, either.

name: Maha7951 ___
text: the receptionist was so rude oh my goodness i am so beside myself. It's your job to be nice to patients why work there if you're going to be mean?? If i could give it zero stars i would

name: Kristin Hawkins
text:
I had to go in today because of a fall I had, resulting in a shoulder injury today. I had to wait a little over an hour (it's flu season, so that's to be expected) before I got in. One thing that really left a good impression with me was that the receptionist made note that I wasn't sick and pulled me over to another waiting room away from everyone that was showing cold and flu symptoms...I greatly appreciated that, since I'm a germaphobe and have health related anxiety issues.

Dr. Lee is amazing! She has such a bright personality and she's very wise. She was aware I don't have insurance, so she made sure to check my injury to make sure I didn't need an X-ray, so I wouldn't spend the unnecessary money if I didn't have to.

She sat and talked about some personal issues with me and took the time to show me some exercises I could do for my arm and even some breathing techniques I could do for my anxiety issues. She's a great doctor.

Even though I'm sore and hurting, it was still a really good doctor's visit...and I say that as someone who is terrified of going to the doctors office.

name: Taylor Evans
text: Receptionist in this awful establishment was so unprofessional and very rude! Basically started laughing when telling me they couldn’t process my payment method tonight, due to nobody there to process it. I will never go back and she needs to loose her job.

name: Richard Cornatzer
text: Definitly the best walk in medical facility we have around here the staff is always curtious and professional I've never had any problems with this place or the staff and were very thankful to have doctors like brandi ray and dr lee and dr furgeson to help out when your sick

name: Joe Bama
text: Not the same without Good ol dr Ferguson around as much. He is truly best doc we have had. but new staff has really made improvements still go there when needed.

name: Johnny Vaughn
text: I've been using Med Plus since the mid to late 80s. Alway great care. I've received no-nonsense advice, and exceptional care at reasonable cost every time. Much thanks to the doctors and staff.

name: elmer Pierce
text: Staff is awesome and they do not make you wait all day.

name: Chandra Stewart
text: Quicker then the ER. Doctors where nice and listened to why you were there.

name: Freda Butler
text: Great staff and doctors. I trust them to take care of my family.

name: Steve Merry
text: In and out quickly.  Really good hours.

name: Avery King
text: I would never return to this walk in clinic. I have never felt so disrespected and dealt with such rude people in a professional setting. I would never suggest this place to anyone. After waiting for 30 minutes to see a doctor, they ask me to leave and come back tomorrow because it was after hours (they closed at 8 pm and I was there with all paperwork completed by 7:40.)  Not impressed with a doctor's office thats so rude.

name: Tracy Biggers
text: Walk in and out quickly.

name: Tim Spidel
text: In & Out! Much quicker than the ER and nice doctors.

name: Kelso Morton
text: The doctors are more than professional & kind .

name: Paige Smith
text: This clinic should be closed, and if they continue on the way they are, they will be very soon. Be forewarned that this tacky little "Walk-in Clinic" refuses to see patients who are 65+.  And I do mean AT ALL. They will not tell you that until they see your insurance card; then they will pretend it is because they do not see Medicare patients/take Medicare.  When I pulled out a credit card (a rather upscale one.... ) and offered to pay for the visit then and there and let's forget about Medicare, the little bozo-ette at the window just kept saying, "It's not my fault, it is just the policy." Well,  of course it is not your fault, little Bozo-ette, nothing ever is with flunkies like you.   I eagerly await, soon, reading in the paper that due to a monstrous lawsuit over ageism, that MedPlus has had to close.  Given other reviews of this nasty little place, they will have to close over a  lot of things.  Please post if you ever see a sign in there that says, "We do not treat Black patients," or "No Hispanics allowed."

name: Tabitha Griffith
text: After my visit I called and left message for the Nurse Practitioner to call me back and she didnt. And it was about the prescription she gave me. I will not be back to see her.

name: suyog moon
text: Service is rediculously slow..Doesn't matter how sick is the patient they will make wait for hours..:X:X:X

name: J S
text: This the horrible uncompassionate place I have ever been to I don't recommend going there

name: Steve Willingham
text: Great care

name: Haley Finley
text: Friendly And fast

name: LOUD N PROUD
text: Excellent

name: Dana Sutton
text: I have been to this office at least 5 times, and each time have experienced excellent customer service. Yes the wait was a little long, but compared to other offices it's similar during these trying times. The nurse practitioner that I saw was compassionate, genuine, and though. All the office staff are very kind. I have worked in the medical field, and believe me being treated in a professional manner is something you will experience here. I do wish they would hold open slots for the elderly who are not computer or cell phone users.

name: Angela Formby
text: We live 30 minutes out from the office and, after signing in on the web service, waited until the wait time dropped to 0-30 minutes before leaving our house. We sat in the empty parking lot for an hour before we started to get antsy. We received a text saying they were almost ready for us after we waited another hour. We went inside to an empty waiting room and were told it would be another hour— all the while my sick child just wanted to go home. The receptionist reluctantly “moved us up the list” (again— empty parking lot, empty office, and enough time for her to play on her phone) but at that point I’d had enough. My husband was able to get an appointment with his regular pediatrician so we left. Needless to say, if it was possible, I’d give zero stars. Never. Again.

name: Darrell Spears
text:
-edit- why didn’t I read the reviews before I came?!?....

I called at 11:30 am and asked to make an appointment. I was told that they didn’t do those and to come around 5pm when they would be less busy. I arrived at 4:45 and was told that they were “at capacity” for the day... They “close” at 8 pm and stopped taking patients   over 3 hours before they close... I drove 35 minutes each way for this nonsense. My other option was another Main Street but that will not happen lol. Steering clear of this operation in Talladega or any other city thank you very much.

Long story short: AVOID.

name: Katrina Owens
text:
I was given a 3 hour wait time... Sick as a dog sitting in my car. After 3 hours, I was told it maybe another 3!!! Total wait time from registration to receiving the text to come in... 8 hours!!! E I G H T!!!
Thankfully, I'd already left and went to my local ER. In and out in LESS than 2 hours.
8 HOURS Y'ALL!!!! And I have screenshots of the messages to prove it!

name: Miki Fuller
text:
No matter what time you show up, youll.be able to eat two meals before youre even seen. Theres a 3-6 hour wait every single time. But if they know the walk in, bet they will be seen right away.

Save time and money by going somewhere else.

name: Shane Parton
text: Hard working nurses and Dr during covid 19 pandemic

name: John W.
text: Walk in Covid???? Walk in and wait 3 hours.  Do not tell you when checking in there is a 2.5-3 hour wait till questioned many times.  2pm and to be told people in line before that have waited many hours.  To to other clinic.  Bad Bad Bad

name: C Jones
text: I went in for Covid testing and was told that I had to register online. According to the receptionist, the registration opens at 6:30 am and closes when 40 people have registered.  There were several elderly people there that were turned around because they had not registered. This is a bad process as everyone may not have access to register or may not know that it’s required.

name: Todd Alexander
text:
Maybe tell people you aren't taking patients in that long recording before they drive 30 minutes at 11AM

Edit:  And again on a Wednesday at 1:00

name: Melissa Lemaire
text: I've been to this office twice now trying to be seen early in the day and have been turned away both times being told they have a limit on how many people they see a day. I am sick and need to see a Dr. Hours of this place are open till 8pm yet they're not seeing anyone? What kind medical care is this?  No service and told to come stand in line at 6am and hope to be seen even though I'm sick?

name: Estefani Colmenero
text: I hope this place stays open and with the same people for a long time. They are the kindest people that you will ever meet, especially if you are like me, afraid of a blood test. I have had 2 bad experiences with blood tests in the past, and they totally understood. They are very kind and gentle with people,they really are great about making you laugh and not worry. Thank you urgent care, I will be here for a long time, hope you stay as long as I'm around.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind works Estefani!

name: Lizz Garrett
text: Horrible service! Felt like nothing I told them mattered. The guy at the desk was down right rude! And we left with no resolve. Wasted 4 1/2 hours of my time trying to get my 1 & 3 yo kids well.

resp.text:
Hi Liz,

Thank you for reaching out about your experience. We will certainly follow up with our staff. If you have any additional details that you can provide about your visit, please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com. We always appreciate the opportunity to improve. Thank you again for bringing this to our atteniton.

name: Blaire Butler
text: I went to MainStreet for a chest cold on a Saturday around 11:30am - I was the only patient when I arrived, filled out paperwork and got called back in around 15 minutes. Very nice waiting room, clean and comfortable. The medical staff were pretty quick in assessing my symptoms...did not ask as many questions as I would have liked and were pretty quick in prescribing me meds - I guess I just expected more of an exam/conversation but I just had a baby 3 months ago so am used to more involved doctors appointments! They did take my weight, temperature and blood pressure as well as listen to my chest real quick.  I was pretty descriptive of my symptoms as well as didn’t have much of a voice so diagnosing me probably wasn’t that hard! The nurse practitioner said she had seen a lot of what I had going around and knew what I could take with breastfeeding. Overall I had a great experience and will for sure be going back!  They offer water/juice/coffee hot cocoa in the waiting room too!  They followed up with a text and email and do seem to really care about their patients!! I am so glad we have an urgent care in Talladega!!

resp.text: Thank you Blaire! We are SO very happy that you had a wonderful experience during your visit. We hope that you heal better, feel better fast! Please let us know if there's anything else we can do for you!

name: Ashley Paris
text: Great Staff! Especially Katherine Owens! I hope I get her again, if I ever have to go back! Felt much better when I left!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing Ashley!

name: Megan Cagle
text: Never thought that the best doctors' office experience would come from an urgent care clinic, but it did! Everyone went above and beyond...from the front desk person to the CRNP. Highly, highly recommend for your needs. Sure do wish this clinic could be our primary care facility! Great work

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Megan! We love our patients and try to do our best to make you Heal Better Feel Better Fast! We hope you'll continue to choose MainStreet Family Urgent Care for all your urgent care needs!

name: Kayla Taylor
text: MainStreet is a convenient place to go when your sick. Katherine Owens does a great job making patients feel welcome and making sure they get treated in a timely manner!

resp.text: Thanks so much Kayla! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Matt Riley
text: Don't waste your time at the place nurse practitioner there is a joke. Went in for a sinus infection and she wanted to give me a bunch of medicine to cover up the symptoms instead of giving me the antibiotics I need to get rid of the infection like every other decent medical provider has done for the many, many sinus infections I've had in the past. If I wanted to try to mask the symptoms and not treat the cause I could have went to the piggly wiggly and got some nyquil. I came there to get my illness taken care of because I  got things to do and need to be well too work to provide for my family. I ain't got time to be laying in bed hoping some flonase and a steroid shot is going to get feeling well. It was a total waste of my hard earned money for nothing. Now I've got to go to a place that really cares about getting me well instead of trying to cover up my symptoms.

resp.text:
Hi Matt,

We’re sorry your experience was not satisfactory, and we appreciate you sharing with us! We will have our Chief Medical Officer review your visit to see what we might have been able to do differently!

name: W Stein
text: Wish they were my family Dr’s. Had a sinus infection and were here visiting Shocco Springs. This clinic was very professional, very clean up to date facility. My family Dr’s office is not this coordinated.

resp.text: Great news W! We now offer primary care! You can schedule your appointment online at any time!

name: Dixie Roberts
text: The medical staff was great. But Improper music was playing in the lab.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your feedback Dixie!

name: Charles Hedrick
text: In and out in 30 minutes.  Very friendly and professional staff. I will definitely be back if I need care in the future.

resp.text: Thank you for your great review Charles! We are so so happy that you had a great experience. We hope that if you ever need us that you choose MainStreet in the future!

name: Daniel Castleberry
text: Nice people but for a 50 copay I expect someone to answer the phone and someone to call me back with out having to track them down when i need a referral and not be directed to a half working so called Portal

name: Lisa Kate
text: Great service

resp.text: Thanks so much Lisa!

name: kimberly arnold
text: So thankful and impressed with the care I received today. Dr.Thompson and his staff were so sweet, attentive and caring today.  Considering my bad circumstance, the visit could not have been any better in any way.

name: Xylair Sanchez
