Medicine he scripted was BADDD for me, thank goodness my family came by to check on me...

Will I use Dr. Reddy again ?  Never
His P.A. Alan was excellent though.

name: Mike Sprinkle
text: Fast service.  Very professional personnel.  Dr.  Reddy is one of the best Dr in North Ala in my opinion.

name: Carol Hitt
text: Love Dr. Reddy and his staff. Very caring people.

name: Ron Mcgee
text: Have to do a dot physical here and it is ok just your typical medical place. The people are very nicr

name: Krista Juric
text: Loved Dr. Alan Heidt very caring the staff was great as well

name: Cory Dunaway
text: Just fyi they won't see anybody after 4:30pm even though their hours say 6pm

name: Larry Vickery
text: Went for DOT renewal and took over 2 hours. To many standing around BS. Should have not taken 30 minutes at the most.

name: Amanda Tedford
text: Horribly long wait times - avoid if possible.  Have waited over 4 hours for a procedure that required extensive prep ahead of time so can't just walk away.  Haven't eaten in over 24 hours also.  Horrible customer service

name: brian davis
text: The woman up front is very rude. It took 3 hours just to get a dot physical done. Waited 45 minutes after the physical just to get the medical card because of incompetence .

name: David Goodwin
text: Drug testing , medical center

name: Joshua Schaffer
text: Tiffany in mammogram was so professional.

name: drau92mk
text: Took me when my regular Dr was closed for a cut in my hand. Very thorough, quick and kind.

name: matt simpson
text: If I could rate zero I would. The nurses are rude. I've waited four plus hours just to see a nurse practitioner for chest pains.

name: Bobby Dees
text:
I love seeing NP Spencer and Dr.Johnson. The staff is great as well.

NP Spencer always takes good care of me!

name: James Wacenske
text: Dr Allen, nurse lorry are incredible. Very professional, prompt, considerate of patient needs. I genuinely love them.

name: Jason Carlton
text:
Usually I have a good experience here.  Not today, though.
I have a hernia.  When I spoke with the uab surgeon who did my other hernia surgery I was told if it wasn’t poking out it wasn’t an emergency and to go to my pcp or the urgent care to be seen.  She said if the pain got worse I could go to the ER.
Since I knew I wouldn’t be able to see my pcp on short notice I went back to the urgent care who told me to come back today and they could most likely get me into the Kirklin clinic to get imaging done the same day.  I showed up at 7 this morning and was the first in line.  I’m guessing everyone who worked there was late since they were late answering the phone (the woman came up about 705 and opened all the blinds before finally answering the phone even though there were several people waiting outside).  When they finally called me back at 718 I was told all they would do would be to send me to the ER.  This is after a UAB surgeon told me not to go to the ER. And after the urgent care told me to come back today.
The problem is that I now will have to wait hours in an ER, and I could have just gone last night if the urgent care was going to change their mind and refuse to help me.

name: Karen Witherspoon
text:
Everyone was nice. They actually helped me instead of just trying to push me out of the room (people who have had to go through the health system for years understand what I mean by that). The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was because my condition is rare and the doctor admitted to not understanding it enough, but the honesty was much appreciated.
Edit : Slightly changing my review. My first review is still correct for my first visit. My second visit went a lot worse (different doctor treated me). She didn't care what about anything I said relating to what I came in for. She preformed an incision and drainage procedure with very little numbing agent. When I expressed this via my screams in pain , she didn't care. She just had people hold me down to the table. She proceeded to pack the area but i was in to much pain so she stopped and said "I'm not putting anymore because you don't seem to tolerate this part well (mentioned this part because in my discharge paperwork she said I tolerated everything well & there was no problems). After that she just walked out of the room and had the nurse tell me to leave. (The nurses were excellent just like last time). This particular doctor is who you want to watch out for because if you get the one I had on my second trip then I feel very sorry for you.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: Had a great experience here. They were fast but thorough. The receptionists were delightful and certainly added to the experience. The extra hours they are open make this a very convenient location. I would highly recommend and would certainly come back.

name: James
text: I am 58 and have seen dozens of physicians in my life. Also have been to several urgent care centers before. I’m from out of town and needed to see a doctor, so I came here because I knew of UAB’s reputation. I have never had a more thorough examination or a more knowledgeable physician than Dr. Andrew Allen. If I could, I would have this doctor be my primary care physician. I highly recommend UAB Medical Urgent Care to anyone needing quick, thorough examination and treatment.

name: Carly Shay
text:
This UAB urgent center is dis-organized and does not seem to care about the patients health. I was very disappointed in the staff and process of my entire visit. I hope they read this and change their flaws for future customers.

They also claim not to be a covid testing center and they required me to take a covid test with them for me to be seen, seems like bad business to me.

name: Sweet'N Divine
text: Nurse Angela Absolutely Made My Day With Her Awesome Vibe & Her Care For Me. I walked Out Smiling , Something You Rarely  Get At Most Places. She Also wished me luck , as I Am Trying To Conceive  again. 💕 I think she had a belly bump of her own🥰 WAY TO GO UAB , We Need Angela x2000000 more Nurses Like Her ❤️

name: Adrienne Savage
text: I saw Dr. Allen today and I have to say that he, as well as the entire staff, were so caring, kind, and considerate. From the moment that I walked in to the office I was greeted with a warmth and genuinely concerned attitude. The check in is so simple and quick and the wait was so short that I almost thought it was a joke! The short amount of time I spent in the waiting area was comfortable, clean, and had lighting that was not too bright. I was treated kindly and with respect even though I looked like hell and felt like hell. The nurse was thorough, Dr. Allen was truly concerned and showed actual empathy. I did have to have x-rays and the technician was superb and so quick. I expected to wait a long while for the x-rays to be read and interpreted but it was at the most a 10 minute wait and I would actually say it was closer to 5 minutes. When Dr. Allen came back in he explained EVERYTHING to me, provided follow-up instructions, a work excuse, and a necessary prescription. He genuinely cared and that type of care is both refreshing and restorative. The entire process was professional while also managing to be quite personal. I wish our entire healthcare system ran this wonderfully.

name: Laney Lewis
text: The staff took amazing care of me yesterday. They all went above and beyond to make sure that I was okay, and still able to take my exams. It’s rare to find an urgent care that is that personal and helpful. They set a great example for future health care staff in Birmingham.

name: Joe Watts
text: Went there with my wife 1.5 years ago for what turned out to be a badly sprained foot. They were quick and helpful. The facility was clean and they had access to all her records since she goes to UAB for everything. Highly recommend.

name: Kelsey
text: Never a disappointing visit. Usually quick service. Kind staff. Conveniently located near UAB with all the great UAB knowledge of urgent health needs. I haven't been satisfied with UAB primary care over the years but this place works well for what it was designed.

name: Rita Rita
text: I used their services didn't get the care I needed. I went to the E R and since then I've been admitted for 7 days. I loss money if you ask me.

name: Chris Browning
text: Been here several times and have been blown away by the professionalism and kindness.  The doctors, nurses, and office staff have consistently been extremely friendly and accommodating. The doctor even recognized me during a visit for my wife even though it had been 2.5 years since I had last visited. The best urgent care facility I've ever been to.

name: Lia Brady
text: I HIGHLY recommend this clinic for any non-emergency needs. The staff is very warm and friendly and I did not spend much time waiting to be called back. The doctor I saw was Dr. John Hurt. He is incredibly personable and took the time to explain everything to me without making me feel rushed. He also sat with me after giving my diagnosis to chat and give advice about our new baby (I am 7 months pregnant). Dr. Hurt is very knowledgeable and has a great demeanor. Wish he could be my baby doctor!

name: Rosemary Wendel
text: I had an incredible experience here at UAB Urgent Care! The entire staff was friendly, helpful and extremely knowledgeable!! The team went above and beyond for my care and it was an extremely quick trip. I was seated in a room and talking with the doctor within 10 minutes! Best experience I've ever had at an urgent care!

name: Malia Tartt
text: Everyone from the front desk to the RN to Dr. Johnson greeted me with a smile and understanding. It was the middle of the flu season and the lobby was understandably full, but I got in and out of there in time to be at work by 9:30 (got there at 7:00 AM). Dr. Johnson listened to all of my concerns and was very thorough. In fact, her office hooked me up with a specialist for an appointment THAT DAY. Conveniently located downtown and opening at 7:00 AM, I'd recommend anyone looking for a doctor for any reason to give them a shout.

name: Teresa Guyton
text: I was feeling so sick and they treated me like they cared. It was fast and I liked everyone there.

name: Tim Sullivan
text:
The UAB urgent care system is quite barbaric. They make you wait in the waiting room with 20 or so sick people to see the doctor - my wait was 1.5 hours. I asked if I could wait outside the building and have them call me on my cell phone when it was my time. They said that was not allowed.

These people claim to be health care specialists???

Within 2 days of leaving urgent care my symptoms  greatly worsened. I am running out of the meds they prescribed and my sinus & lung infections are still very active. Now they want me to come back in for re-evaluation and sit around with a bunch of sick people again to catch another disease. NO THANKS!

name: Oscar R Garcia
text: Dr. Jenna Johnson is amazing! She treated my wife with a lot of care and followed up on us with blood results. What an excellent Doctor and human being! Muchas gracias!

name: Lesley Watson
text: Everyone was super nice and worked hard to figure out what I had going on. I only waited about 15-20 minutes after filling out my paperwork, and was only there a little longer overall because my symptoms were weird. The waiting room was really clean and inviting too. It's great we have an urgent care facility like this right downtown.

name: Suzanne McCreedy, Esq.
text: Today was my first visit to this clinic. The employees were all outstanding, caring, and professional. I don't think I've ever been at a medical office where everyone was so friendly! The wait time was almost non-existent. I was in and out in no time. It's such a luxury to have a great place like this where I can walk from my office to have my issue resolved.

name: kristye dixon
text: They are efficient, easy, and competent. I have nothing but high praise for this facility and the UAB network in general.

name: Allison
text: Best experience I have ever had at an urgent care!! All the staff I encountered were friendly, professional, and efficient. Would definitely go back here if needed!!!!

name: Alexandria Pearson
text: I've always been seen promptly and have always been impressed by how knowledgeable and courteous the staff is from the front desk to the back; especially Dr. Allen. I'm very thankful to have this clinic available so close by. The only small issue I've had here is every now and then a radiology tech was not available, but they let you know when you sign in if that's the case so that you can plan accordingly.

name: Amanda Horsley
text: I had a WONDERFUL experience here. I get very anxious whenever I go to the doctor, and the nurses were so friendly and eased my mind about everything. Dr. Johnson listened so carefully to all my symptoms and truly cared. She ran every test that was needed and helped me figure out the cause of what had been ailing me for so long. It was the first time I have ever felt like a doctor took the time to properly care for me.

name: Dr Sandra Atwell-Laz DC
text:
My husband entered UAB
ER 7 days ago with severe abd pain.
Diagnosised with several cancerous masses. .  Since then Ive been sleeping in hospital room - my husband cannot communicate.  His ",team" wants me here to help.. . they dont want me gone for any lengthtime.They sent me to this clinic and told me "they would help due to extraordinary circumstances".  The pain meds i had with me for 7 days ran out. "Dr. Allen would not even see me.  No help on any level.  They could have cee on my records that am not a drug abuser. Yet i was treated like one, or call my doctors. Now i could spend 8 hours in emergency room or 8 hours driving home to get my meds.  No strength of conviction - NO INTEGERITY - NO STRENGTH OF CHARACTER.  SHAME ON YOU

name: drew patchett
text: Over-all well ran. Wait times never been over an hour, even if busy. Normally in and out within an hour and a half to two hours. Everyone past the front desk is pleasant and informative. Front staff is unpleasant and dismissive. They are not fun people to talk to if you're sick.

name: crystal davenport
text: Usually not a long wait . Great staff

name: Cam Mackenzie
text: I went later in the day, so the waits were relatively long, but for a walk-in clinic that's to be expected, so I brought a book to read and was fine. Other than that, the nurses were friendly, Dr. Johnson was very helpful, and I was very pleased with my experience.

name: Amy Shackelford
text:
I had a wonderful experience at this UAB Urgent Care location. They took me back as soon as I finished my paperwork. I did not sit in the back for more than 10 minutes before seeing a doctor. The entire staff was friendly and willing to discuss my symptoms without brushing off my questions.

This location also was considered tier 1 by my Blue Cross and Blue Shield Insurance, while the hospital is considered a tier 2 location. Very glad Blue Cross left the Urgent Care as tier 1 because they were wonderful.

name: Kelsey Freeman
text: My experience here was absolutely wonderful. From the receptionist, to the nurses, to the doctor, everything was smooth and as enjoyable as it can be when you aren't feeling well. I only waited 15-20 minutes. They listened to my issues and got me fixed up! Continue the good work and thank you!

name: Arie' Smith
text:
My experience at for the last 3 visits (in 2 years) have been Much better than any care that I've received from any other urgent care facility. The staff was friendly and fast. I've never waited more than 20 mins which is a plus, given the fact that they were very busy. Found it very helpful/convenient that I was able to get an X-ray and a referral when I needed it.
As for the Reviewer that complained about a Viral infection issue, they gave you correct instructions. With a virus you must allow it to run it's course for a few days first.

name: John
text: Professional and accommodating staff! Dr.Allen was thorough and very informative about what could be causing my symptoms and discussed some possible followup testing if my condition doesn't improve with medication.  Highly recommend this clinic

name: Daniela Cook
text:
My first visit there. From the receptionist staff, the get your vital signs staff, the phlebotomist and others,  everyone was extremely professional but foremost caring!
Thank you Dr. Allen for not rushing through my visit . I truly felt that I was getting the best care

name: Jillian Carter
text: Love this place! It is a very clean environment  and everyone was nice. The time I spent there was phenomenal.

name: Amber LeClaire
text: I've been here a few times and everyone is so friendly and helpful. No surly attitudes that you find a lot of urgent care facilities. No long waits either. This is by far the top urgent care facility in Birmingham!

name: Blastnoe06
text: Terrible . the xray tech didn't know the difference between my left and right shoulder. She had to xray me twice due to that .the physician assistant said my heart sounded good  I told her nobody listened to my heart .then she proceeds to listen after my prompting. Dont waste your time at this clinic .

name: Ed Duke
text: Except for the bad address everything else was 100% better than expected. Thought it would be a long and difficult wait but was almost immediately.

name: Melissa Fancher
text: Clean facility, staff appear to have all equipment and processes in place to do their job efficiently. However, in my experience with this staff they are very insensitive to sinus issues. I highly recommend going elsewhere. Not only was I feeling terrible from sinus pressure, but I left feeling like they did not care about my needs as a patient.

name: Rokeia Westbrook
text: Service and providers are always nice and considerate. Plus, the nurses are ALWAYS there with compassion.

name: Joseph Gray
text: I came in because I had a sudden sickness and the team here saw me promptly, had me feeling well taken care of long before we even had results. The team works like a well oiled machine here and it shows.  It feels like they care and are knowledgeable- the two qualities I look for most in urgent care.

name: David Ball
text: The staff are fantastic and are quite professional.  Everything was handled efficiently and to my satisfaction.  I highly recommend this Urgentcare site.

name: Bess Booth
text: Told me it would take 2-3 to get my cultures back. Called to check on them, the told me they would take 10 business days, called 10 business days later (2 weeks), told me I would have to come back in, do the whole process over again just to get some antibiotic, since too much time had passed. Never again

name: Velda Richardson
text: I have had good care from the Staff at UAB Urgent Care.

name: Lynn Duvall
text: Both times I was seen quickly by friendly, knowledgable professionals. Diagnosis and treatment appropriate and thorough. A real asset to the community that I highly recommend.

name: Barbara Bonfield
text: I found the treatment at the Urgent Care Clinic outstanding. Dr Andrew Allen was thorough in his examination and consideration of my issues.The treatment that he recommended was conservative and I agreed with him. We are fortunate to have this facility in Bham.

name: Altovise Crear
text: Always good service!

name: Omar Maximo
text: Polite, caring, and they figured what I had in a manner of hours (had to get a CT scan for that). Overall, great experience

name: Liz Appling
text: I was seen at this Urgent Care location for a sprain/ligament injury this past Sunday and I could not have been happier with the treatment I received. The staff got me in a room immediately and had x-rays done within 15 minutes. The nurses really took the time to listen to me and take me seriously when I explained that my tumble down the stairs was a result of ongoing and sporadic numbness in my legs and hands and spells of intense dizziness. They got me in contact with a facility that plans to get to the root of the problem. I'm so thankful to them for taking me seriously when no other doctor did because "I'm 29 and healthy, so the numbness and dizziness isn't something I should worry about." I digress, but please know that THESE NURSES ROCK!!!!

name: Johnnecia Peterson
text: I have been here since 1:45, and was told when I got here that there was a 30 minute wait. And yet it turned into two hours!! And on top of all that they took someone that came 45min after me and when I asked they couldn’t give me a reason why !! Because I was also told when I first came that patients were seen based on arrival times!!

name: Vonda Holman-Bell
text: They sent me home with a shot only.  I did not receive a Rx for Strep.  I’m extremely sick and can’t return to work.

name: Leslie Hill
text: I will NEVER go again....the lady told me if I'm still feeling the same way in 3 days to come back. I had to ask for a shot🙄 I paid $25 for nothing. Then the take home instructions said I had an upper respiratory infection and she told me it was nothing but my sinus. Just a waste of time and money!

name: Chris Bright
text: Dont not go here if you are pressed for time no peolpe in waiting room and not noticeable busy in back lot of standing around.A simple check for cold/flu symptoms took 2 and a half hours and i left before they got last result from nose swab.

name: LaQuinta Megginson
text: 1st visit was successful, 2nd visit was mediocre, I don't feel my problem was resolved, just patched over. My 3rd visit there, 2nd visit with this same lady on yesterday, she walked in and immediately said, "I'm gonna tell you now you'll be dealing with this for the next 8-10 days". Mind you she hadn't touched me nor asked me any questions. She went on to tell me that we'd be treating it systematically, I asked her to explain she stated otc sinus meds, otc cough meds I stopped her and asked about antibiotics she said this is viral and no antibiotic would touch it. I mentioned my symptoms again she totally disregarded them. Now she still had not touched me, nor looked in my ears, eyes, nose or my mouth. I got up and said "I'm not going to be playing around with my health like this" as I was leaving the exam room (with no exam having happened) she said "I've been formally trained I know what I'm talking about", I didn't respond I had my copay credited back to my card and went to another Urgent care where I was seen by a real Dr. who had an actual bedside manner and knew that you had to touch a patient and look at and listen to their patient. Had chest Xrays and blood work done. I left with 3 prescriptions and a couple of shots. So much for her formal training. The male Dr was nice and handled my issue well. She is not equipped to deal with humans. Not my 1st choice. I don't plan on willingly going there again. The rest of the staff were pleasant and kind.

name: Linda Shields
text: Fast, courteous, and knowledgeable care -- what more could you want?

name: Vi Parramore
text: Excellent care by knowledgeable, caring staff!

name: Aidan C
text: My mother has been here twice and turned away twice because they had already taken their last patient. 2 hours before they are supposed to close. Pitiful.

name: Timothy Richey
text: Nurse and doctor were very rude and non accommodating. Refused to help with medical leave  papers. When I asked if they could do anything about the ear pressure, the doctor stated no we aren't ear surgeons in a condescending tone.

name: Heiress
text: Extremely slow and NO patients... been waiting over 30 minutes.

name: Tracy Thornton
text: They had a two hour wait after calling and telling me that it was not a long wait. After finally getting called back i was told that there was another two hour wait due to a major procedure. I also picked up a new virus from being there as the would not let me sit in my car and be called like most urgent care places do. I will NOT be going there again and i love UAB.

name: Michael Cooper
text: I was sent to this place by my doctor for an x-ray of my foot. After driving downtown, having my vitals taken, being seen by a nurse and a physician's assistant, and waiting for 45 minutes, I was finally told (but only after I asked) that their x-ray machine was not working. What a pathetic excuse for an "urgent care" facility!

name: Karri Neal
text: I checked the hours before arriving and their phone message stated they closed at 7. I arrived at 6:25 only to have them shut the lights off as I walked through the door. They said the doctor was closing early and to come back the next morning when they open. Hours should state they close at 6:30 if they're turning off lights at 6:25.

name: Sabrina Long
text: Very nice and efficient!

name: Dionne Stewart
text: Professional,  friendly,  effective, and efficient care.

name: Dave Wright Jr
text: I’ve been here twice in the past few months! Unlike some other clinics, I found my wait time to be respectable! My initial trip late in the afternoon, I’d gone to several other clinics to try and get taken care of, but all were either closed, closing soon and couldn’t see me. Has become my first choice when I need assistance! Highly recommended!

name: Joshua Schaffer
text: Amazing clinic!!! They treat your symptoms and are very friendly

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review Mr. Schaffer!

name: Destiny Hogan
text: First and last visit. I was asked to wait in my car due to allergy symptoms. I asked the nurse who brought out my paperwork if I was going to see a doctor and she talked to me as if I were a nuisance. I let it ride as I assumed she was having a bad day. I received a phone call a few minutes later requesting a phone triage. I asked the young lady to send someone out due to taking another call from the hospital for an emergent matter. The original moody nurse came back out and reached through my window attempting to snatch my paperwork out of my hands. Suggested I go somewhere else and called me ignorant. I asked what her problem was and asked to complete my visit and she continued belligerently yell at me in the parking lot. Literally told me to leave and stop filling out paperwork. Another lady came out about the same time I asked for her superior. The second lady was the office manager and the younger nurse seem to have no regard for her attitude or behavior, even in front of her boss. Mind blown at the actions and behavior of the some of the staff at this facility. The office manager was understanding and compassionate to the situation and took the time to explain the visit due to sick symptoms. Visit with actual dr was pleasant as well. I hate to base this review of my visit on one bad apple but that lady chose medicine as a profession and if dealing with people makes her that miserable , she needs a new job.

resp.text: I’m sorry Destiny about your visit! I’m the office manager and today is my off day so you didn’t speak to me. I will get to the bottom of this and find out what’s going on ASAP! Again I apologize for the actions of my staff, that’s very out of character for one of my front staff memebers!

name: Diaa Shinne
text: I would give this clinic a 10 star rating if I could!!! I absolutely love this walk in clinic.. so convenient.. clean.. staff is WONDERFUL... the doctors there are amazing! They know what’s wrong with you when you give them your symptoms... the doctors listen.. and actually hear you out..I love coming here! They’ll get you where you need to go.. they always know what type of specialist to send you to.. it’s an outstanding place. I’ve came here maybe 4 times in the last 2 years.. and I never had any issues with them! Lol again the staff is OUTSTANDING 👏🏾👏🏾

name: Dave Beck
text: I have been here in the past and the doctors were excellent On a visit Thursday, 4/22/2021 at 3:30, however, the receptionist was unbelievably rude and disrespectful. I walked out before finishing the paperwork and won't return.

name: Michael Johnson
text: Front desk clerk absolutely rude!! Wouldn't send my pet to this place

name: C K
text: They did an excellent job taking care of my wife when she was ill.  We had just moved here and didn't know our way around. They were quick, professional, and gave her outstanding treatment.  Glad we found them so close to home!

name: John Tidball
text: Wonderful quick operation and firmly adhere to Covid-19 restrictions. This was my first visit at this clinic. I went in for a spider bite infection that was spreading. Diagnosis and treatment were clear and concise.  I received a shot and prescription in less than 30 minutes.

name: Rebecca Ortiz
text: Alway extremely knowledge and usually quick service harder with COVID

name: Rhonda Lang
text: I was very displeased with the logistics as well as the physician visit.  I was told to drive around to the tent, but there was no tent up.  I was told I would not have to get out of the car, but I had to go in to see the doctor.  My current symptoms:  coughing, red and sore throat, runny nose, fatigue, cannot sleep, tired.  I did not have a fever, but I have been constantly talking Tylenol, because I don’t feel well.  According to the doctor what I have is probably viral and will run it’s course.  Doctor ordered a Strep test and a steroid shot.  The STREP TEST was negative, but no COVID test ordered so now I have to go to another doctor, pay another copay and get a COVID test because I’m still sick and not sure what is going on.  This is how COVID is being spread efforts are not being exhausted in order to identify those infected.  I inquired about their criteria for administration of COVID test and was told they did not have a specific criteria.

name: Taylor Bedenbaugh
text: The business has posted hours that say the business closes at 5pm. My wife and I walked in, myself with possibly a sprained wrist, only to be told the doctor is leaving early and there’s nothing they can do. I advise anyone who needs urgent care to find somewhere else. I understand that everyone wants to go home on a Sunday, but if someone in obvious pain, I find it in bad taste to turn someone away. Receptionist was very polite and deserves a better place to work for.

resp.text: Taylor I am so sorry this happened, and you are correct, you should have never been turned away especially with you being in pain. We will discuss this first thing in the morning and make sure this does not happen again.

name: Annalise Harwood
text: Great staff here from receptionists to doctor. Took my 6yo for a cough and the doctor was wonderful and thorough. Will absolutely use this place in the future.

resp.text: Thank you so much Mrs. Harwood for the kind words! We love taking care of the kiddos here!:)

name: Gina Fee
text: Took my husband here and was in and out quickly. Dr took time to figure out what was wrong. They did tests there and some results were immediate. They referred us to a specialist and gave meds to treat condition. Very pleased!

resp.text: So glad we could help you guys! Hope your husband is doing well and thank you for the wonderful review!

name: Arnell Watson
text: I have been seen a few times and won’t go to another urgent care. Dr Allman LISTENS to what I say and has consistently provided appropriate medical care.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Mrs. Watson!

name: Chris Zitting
text: The nurse was fine. I could not understand anything the doctor was saying due to her heavy foreign accent. They charged me $78 to wait an hour for the doctor to come in, talk to me for 3 minutes and tell me she can’t remove the cysts from my head. Never ever go there. Place is a rip-off.

resp.text: Hate to hear of this Mr. Zitting! Dr. Allman has been with our practice for over 4 years now and have yet to receive a complaint of anyone not understanding her, or atleast asking for clarification if needed. Would you mind if our office manager reached out to you to investigate this in further detail?

name: Andrea Simpson
text: I always have a great experience here.  The doctors are knowledgeable and care about the patients they see.  My sister, mom and myself have all had great experiences.  Honestly I see the doctor's here more than my PCP. Clean facility and it doesn't feel like some of these other urgent care facilities that I've been to that seem to be dirty and rotating doctors and nurses.  I highly recommend this place especially for the minor stuff, flu, sinus, UTI's etc. AND! the wait is never really that bad unlike some others around here!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Mrs. Simpson!

name: April Clawson
text: Waited very long to be called back. It wasn’t busy.

resp.text: Good morning Mrs. Clawson. I am so sorry for your long wait here at the office this morning. However, although it seemed we only had a few patients in the waiting room while you were here, we understand you had no way of knowing there was also 13 patients being treated through our drive thru at that same time. Our girls are working hard to get everyone in and out in a timely manner but sometimes we come up short and overwhelmed with the high volume of patients in our drive thru. We appreciate your feedback!

name: Emily Valich
text: I arrived first thing with a very sick kiddo and the staff was all very kind: especially the nurse. She was amazing and took the time to make the visit enjoyable for my daughter. This is my go to clinic when we can't get to our regular doctor.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Mrs. Valich!

name: Deck Jr
text: The staff was friendly but the dr knowledge is no good Dr. Bailey told me i just needed to clean my ears thats why I had a headache and fever and cough for 3 days and gave me cough syrup and ear drops , this was Friday by Sunday im feeling worst so i went to the emergency room and i do have the flu after they told me i didnt have it at Dr. Bailey office so if you see him get second opinion, and i just lost $95.00 for a Doctor visit that wasn't helpful...

resp.text: We apologize for any miscommunication and additional care you had to receive sir. We will have our office manager reach out to you shortly regarding your visit. We hope you are feeling better!

name: Madison Frederick
text: I was slightly nervous about seeing a physician concerning the issues I was having, but Dr. Summerford took the time to patiently listen to my self diagnosis and offer a (obviously) more informed diagnosis along with various treatment options. He was incredibly helpful and informative. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Mrs. Frederick!

name: Linda Serwecki
text: Arrived at 5:10 PM with my 82 year old father in-law. He cut his hand with a knife( small cut) only a little blood. The front desk person turned us away because he was on blood thinners. Again he was not bleeding hardly at all.

resp.text: Hey Mrs. Serwecki! So sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused you and your father-in-law. We do have signs posted at the front window that have been here since we have opened, stating that this is one of the few things we cannot effectively treat here at the office. This is in the best interest of the patient. Even if the bleeding has lessened since the incident, any aggravation to the area could restore heavy blood flow due to the blood thinners and any walk-in clinic does not have the capabilities to treat this--in the event of heavy bleeding. So sorry for any confusion and hope your father-in-law is doing well.

name: clint glossup
text: The staff here is amazing! I wish they weren't urgent care or they would be our family Dr..Our insurance has a high deductible so it cost us more for urgent care, no fault of thiers. My family has seen both Dr 's and we were very pleased. The nurses treated my family like thier own. This is our urgent care from now on!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Mr. Glossup!

name: Shady Sanchez
text: Dr. Summerford and Dr. Allman are great. The staff is very friendly and they get you in and out pretty quickly without sacrificing your quality of care. I've gone to them for for several years and I like that they can do most everything in house.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Mrs. Sanchez!

name: Kendi Collins
text: Been here several times and always friendly and fast. The office manager went above and beyond trying to help work out kinks with our coverage and went to bat for us by calling the insurance co to get it resolved. Very impressed.

name: Harvey Jones
text: Just visited there today with my granddaughter and my grandson a few weeks back.  The staff and doctor were exceptional.  Not sure what the lady's issue was with the low rating and describing the doctor as 12 years old, but her rude statement speaks for itself.  Yes the doctor is young, but he also seems quite competent and is very personable.  It's possible the lady just didn't meet the criteria for strep throat at the time she was seen...

name: SarahKP
text: I typically despise urgent care facilities in general, I came to Community Urgent Care of Madison out of necessity with a sick kid on a Saturday. My first time coming to this place and I was pleasantly surprised. I had an excellent experience. My son and I got in and out of there in about 30 minutes. The office staff was kind and friendly, the nurse was so nice, and Dr. Summerford was awesome. Next time I have an urgent care need I will definitely go back here.

name: RollTide35756
text: The entire staff was a pleasure to deal with in this clinic. They were organized and didn't leave me waiting more than a minute or two at any point. I'm lucky to have found this place considering my options were very limited at the time. I'll definitely be back when I need a good Dr on short notice. Thanks!

name: Elizabeth Cooper-Golden
text: Walked in last week when I was not feeling well.  The staff was friendly and the wait was short.  The Doctor was knowledgeable and very thorough.  I felt like I was in good hands. I've taken my daughter to another walk-in clinic in Madison and wasn't impressed, so I was really dreading my visit.  I was a bit nervous but it was a really, really good experience.

name: Louise Williams
text: I've been  here numerous  times , if you're  sick  this  is  the  place to go!! Everyone  from the receptionist  to  the  doctors were kind and caring .

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Williams for the kind words and great review!

name: Shannon R. Casey
text: I love this place! After my regular physician shut down without notice I’ve been coming here.  The staff is always nice and Dr. summerford is too.  We are usually in and out in no time. When my son’s pediatrician has been closed or can’t get him in I bring him here. In fact my whole family comes here when we are sick or need our prescriptions refilled.  I would highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!

name: Savannah Brooks
text: I went in this past Sunday around 4:30 and saw the doctor within 10 minutes. I saw Dr. Summerford and thought he was knowledgeable and listened to my concerns. He made sure all my questions were answered. I would recommend this urgent care facility.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words !

name: Elaine Ballew
text: Dr. Summerford is awesome he is always takes time to listen. I have never waited more then 30 minutes. I have read several reviews about the front desk ladies or billing. They have always been nice business focused. Most what I call "Doc in the Box" have different doctors or they don't speak great English so communication is not always easy. The doctors here are like what you would want in a family doctor. Actually consider Dr. Summerford my family doc.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Mrs. Ballew!

name: Brooke Moseley
text: The staff was super friendly and the physican was excellent! From the cleanliness, the awesome care and quickness, I recommend Community Urgent Care of Madison to anyone! Thank you all for treating me with respect and kindness! You all are awesome!

name: Justin Baker
text: I was unapologetically turned away an hour before their posted close. They did not turn away the person who walked in right in front of me. Drove down to AFC on HWY 72 and was in and out with friendly service before the actual closing hours posted on Community Urgent Care's Door. I am now thankful they turned me away, because I got the service I was looking for just down the road.

name: Amber Wyers
text: I have been going here not long after they opened. It is 2 minutes from my house. The staff has always been respectful and the nurses and doctors are knowledgeable. I will always choose them over AFC, who just gives antibiotics and sends you on your way.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Mrs. Wyers!

name: Sophie Crozier
text: I had to get a physical and TB test before work, and I was dreading a long wait. The staff saw me right away, and I was in and out in half an hour. Overall good experience!

resp.text: Great to hear Mrs. Crozier! Thank you for the great review!

name: Shelby Jacobson
text: Absolutely love going here. Not only do you get in and out very quickly, the staff is extremely patient and kind. Will continue to go when needed!

name: Matthew Sabella
text:
So, I called the office.  "I think I have a broken pinky finger."  They tell me I can come in to be evaluated.  If they think it's broken they'll refer me to "The Orthopedic Center" downtown for an x-ray.  I ask, "If it's broken, then why should I come in to see you, be billed, just so I can be billed by another doctor downtown?"

I did manage to get the hours of operation of The Orthopedic Center out of them before they hung up on me.

resp.text: Hey Mr. Sabella! So sorry to hear of your displease! If you could please call the office at (256) 230-6130 and ask to speak with the office manager so she can address this issue.

name: Deena Cox
text: Sunday, May 6, 2018 I walked into the clinic at 12 minutes til 5 PM (closing time).  The closed sign was already on the front door, door was unlocked.  My son was very sick and when I walked in I explained that, they said sorry we are closed and wouldn't discuss anything else.  Even restaurants take customers up to the time of closing.  I am very disappointed and will never go to this clinic again.  You just don't turn people away like that.

name: Kecia Pierce
text: I have been several times now and Dr. Summerford and staff are all excellent! Very friendly, patient, and thorough. Highly recommend.

name: Darlene Woody
text: This is the best urgent care I've ever went to. They have provided excellent care and are prompt to get back to me with test results. The nursing staff and Dr. Summerford are very professional and thorough.

name: Sophie Crozier
text: I had to get a physical and TB test before work, and I was dreading a long wait. The staff saw me right away, and I was in and out in half an hour. Overall good experience!

resp.text: Great to hear Mrs. Crozier! Thank you for the great review!

name: Louise Williams
text: The staff was very pleasant  and Dr Allman was very caring  and listened to everything  I said.  I definitely  will go back .

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Mrs. Williams!

name: Matthew Sabella
text:
So, I called the office.  "I think I have a broken pinky finger."  They tell me I can come in to be evaluated.  If they think it's broken they'll refer me to "The Orthopedic Center" downtown for an x-ray.  I ask, "If it's broken, then why should I come in to see you, be billed, just so I can be billed by another doctor downtown?"

I did manage to get the hours of operation of The Orthopedic Center out of them before they hung up on me.

resp.text: Hey Mr. Sabella! So sorry to hear of your displease! If you could please call the office at (256) 230-6130 and ask to speak with the office manager so she can address this issue.

name: Billie Jo
text:
Very professional and caring staff. Even wished me well as I left. Hard to imagine another local urgent care doing the same.
Thank you for showing sincere concern. Highly recommend.

name: Barry Suciu
text: I was told there was a 45 min wait, filler out paperwork for 20 mins and then was told there was still a 45 min wait.  Now, 1.5 hours after I arrived I am stlll waiting.  They need to be more honest.  Also, they made sure to get my co pay right away so I don’t have the option to leave.  I recommend Going else where.

resp.text: We apologize for any wait you may have Mr. Suciu, but unfortunately that is out of our control. The girls at check in are able to give an estimated wait time but have no control once a patient gets to the back. Unfortunately, there are many factors that come in play such as how many complaints each patient has once in the room with the physician that then could lead to any testing that needs to be done which could add more time. Once again, we are sorry for the wait. If you choose to leave, the girls can simply refund your money or either void a transaction if you paid with a card.

name: Stacey Kimbrel
text:
I am not sure what happened here. This once was a good place to go for care. My sister went a few months ago for a sprain and they were caring enough to give her a brace to leave in. I went for a ex-ray. I had to kind of press for one. I like Dr Summerford. He seems like a good enough guy. I just think when you go there for something. It should be taken care of.

I think the change as happened since they hired the new front desk girl. She is rude and before she waited on me was harassing someone for 3 bucks and change. I know they do this because they called my sister for a 3 dollar bill.

I left this office with a abnormal ex-ray. No wrap no brace. My sister got a brace. I wasn't offered anything. I missed their call and they did not even leave me a voice mail with anything other than call us back . I had to call them back.

I have to pay more than most people because of the insurance at my job is a health savings . For what I paid I would wanted better than oh well your fine here are some pain meds.

Right now I have been told I have a soft tissue injury and it just seems to me I was not cared about. I also suspect no one looked at my ex-ray other than the doctor. I think they just call you and say they did. Because if something was abnormal in my ex ray. You would think I would have a referral to Sports med or something.

I honestly hope one day they have a accident and hurt their arm and are treated the very same incompetent way.

resp.text: We hate hear of any bad experiences at our office Mrs. Kimbrel. We will have an office manager contact you on Monday. Thank you for making us aware of this situation.

name: L L
text: I suffer from severe back pain and during the last 10 yrs it has been hard for me to conduct normal activities, play with my son and etc. When the pain is active I am not able to move out of bed nor even walk correctly. However, after trying everything for many years yesterday I decided to stop by and see if they could prescribe something for me. I saw Dr. Allman and she changed my days. She knew exactly what to do about it and about an 1 hour or so after she provided me with medications the pain was gone. I happened to have family in town and we were going to have to cancel all of the already set plans for the long weekend but thanks to Dr. Allman we were able to get back on track and move along with the plans. I have been pain-free so far. I’m sure I will have the pain again at some point but now I know who to see. Thank you Dr. Allman, thank you so much for changing painful days to normal days. Now I can play with my son, I don’t have to miss work and I can do my normal life things. THANK YOU! The urgent care is lucky to have you as well as we are!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! Glad we could help get you back on track to spend some time with your family!

name: Chris Sandlin
text: Reasonable wait, and office staff and doctor were friendly. No problems.

name: Misty Kyle
text: I had a great experience! No long waits and the staff is amazingly great people!

name: Art Mann
text:
I went there on a Saturday morning with severe flu symptoms - aching joints, chills, painful breathing due to too much coughing. The "Doctor" listened to me breathe from several locations, took my temperature and blood pressure and asked me a few questions. She then proposed to prescribe Tamiflu even though it was way past the time when it is known to be effective. I declined. She left and a girl came in to swab my nose for a flu test. Yet another girl came in a few minutes later to report the quick test didn't confirm flu but she said it may be flu anyway. I was handed a prescription for Tamiflu, which I had already declined, and a bill for about $85. I asked this person to appeal to the "Doctor" to at least prescribe some cough medicine, which she did. It was ineffective. I spent $85 for this woman to fail to give me a diagnosis and then fail to give me any treatment to reduce symptoms. The visit was worthless. To add to my misery, the 16 mile round trip to the office plus the wait got me so sick, I went to bed right after the visit and didn't get up again until the following day. Today, I have a very painful secondary ear infection which could have been prevented. Breathing is still painful, in one lung, making me suspect pneumonia.

I must say that the other girls in the office that morning were just as nice and professional as they could be.

Thank goodness I have an appointment today to visit my primary care physician. He hasn't failed me in 25+ years..

name: Cindy Pena
text: The most helpful, caring and just amazing urgent care I have ever used in my life. The receptionist, nurse and doctor went above and beyond to take care of my son. This will be the only urgent care I will use.

name: Jordan Woolf
text: WORST PLACE EVER. Do NOT go here. I called to ask how much it would be for a flu test..gave the lady over the phone ( I was told she was the manager) my insurance information, she ran it and told me $9 or $10 and then I get a bill in the mail for almost $100. I called to get this settled and she acted like she didn’t even know we spoke. Such a scam! The manager is very rude. Don’t waste your time here.

name: Dorothy Murray
text: Doctor and staff were very attentive and knowleable with my husband's care. No one seem to be in a rush and we will diffidently be back when needed!

name: Julie Durling
text: Nice people. Short wait. Excellent help from Dr S. and his staff. Thank you all.

name: William Davis
text: Dr. Summerford was excellent. Very informative and top-notch.

name: Kandace Fleming
text: I have been a patient for a while. I have thyroid issues so when I run out of meds, I call and when asked to make an appointment i simply explained i just had my labs drawn can I have them forwarded over. I got two refills. When I called back to inform them 2 months later that I needed a new refill instead of asking me to go ahead and make an appointment because they can't refill them until they've seen me. I got a very rude Dr. Summerford who said they don't make money when I don't come in every six months and if I was going to let someone else do my lab testing i could just get them to write the prescription. I have never experienced this level of rudeness from a doctor. Definitely won't recommend to anyone. It cost $0 to be kind. If your going to be a jerk then why would anyone want you as their doctor. Goodluck.

resp.text: Mrs Fleming, this Is Dr Summerford. I would like to respectfully reply to your review which I usually do not do. However, when words are placed in my mouth that I did not say I felt it  necessary. First of all we do not make appointments for anyone as we are a walk in clinic open 7 days a week. All of our patients who have chronic conditions are seen every 3-6 months based on severity of illness. It really doesn't matter to me where someone gets there labs as most of our labs are send outs anyways, but i do like to do a physical exam and history to make sure there arent complications. I am sorry if you felt i was rude on the phone. I am still more than happy to see you as a patient. If you decide to seek treatment elsewhere i understand and wish nothing but the best for you and your health.

name: Katherine Johnson
text: The only pleasant and efficient thing about this clinic was the underpaied nurse practitioner. I got very emotional and upset over their treatment towards me. I was insulted, accused of looking for meds, and almost prescribed toradol with lithium which could have landed me in the hospital with lithium toxication. It was a male doctor who is arrogant and over looks his true patients individual needs. He wants to go by the book to a crippling effect, doesn't truly listen and is very rude. I would never recommend this place just because you may have him. He will be reported to the board.

resp.text: Our sincerest apologies for any issues you had at our clinic today. However, these are issues/complaints never heard of before regarding our physicians that we have at the office. We will have an office manager contact you on Monday to discuss your interaction today at the office.

name: Amy Melton
text: The staff is friendly and compassionate.

name: carolyn cole
text: If I could give this place no stars I would. Most urgent care places open at 7:00 or 7:30, this one didn't open till 8:00.  So we waited in my vehicle for 20 minutes. Then watched others show up to, they all stood by the door waiting  to get in. When we finally got in, I stood in line for 10 minutes gave the lady my information only to  be told they dont take our insurance but they take the lower part of our insurance where you pay more out of pocket. That's stupid! The lady was very rude, when I told we had the one where you only pay a copay, otherwise we had to have a referral.  If I needed  referral I would have gone to a regular doctor. This place was recommend to me because how fast you are in and out. All they are interested in is money....never will go back.

resp.text: We hate to hear of your displease Mrs. Cole and we apologize for your wait, but our office hours are clearly stated on our door and all of our internet postings/accounts. If we don't accept certain insurances or if there are issues with your particular insurance we like to tell you upfront so you don't get a surprise bill in the mail later on. If there are any issues you would like to further discuss, please contact the office and ask to speak with the manager. Best of luck and hope you are better soon.

name: David Cochran
text: Great experience. Friendly, listened, up front about what they charge. Will be back.

name: Sang Yong Lee
text:
Very good service!!
Recommend!!

resp.text: Thank you so much Mrs. Lee!

name: Stacy Soldon
text: Would give clinic a zero for the front desk and billing people.

resp.text: So sorry to hear of your displease Mrs. Soldon. We will have our office manager reach out to you shortly to investigate the issue. Hope we can get this resolved for you and see you again in the office!

name: kristine latham
text: I went there on Thursday with a serious sore throat and a 103.6 fever. The 12 year old doctor looked at my throat and said yup it's red. Didn't swab it at all! Gave me Magic Mouthwash to numb it. Not to fix the issue. It didn't work. Now it's Saturday. I can't swallow, talk, or eat. I have not eaten ANYTHING since Wednesday because I just can not swallow. Just praying this "Magic Mouthwash" that this "doctor" gave me will finally do something! I'm currently at a REAL DOCTOR'S OFFICE. I have strep throat!! That idiot doctor gave me magic mouthwash for strep throat because he skipped steps and was so utterly incompetent at his job that he put my health into further risk. I will NEVER go back. I will also be making further complaints about the situation.

name: Thomas Keene
text: Nice and relatively quick. Friendly staff and doctor.

name: Michael Muriithi
text: Never a long wait and Doctor is very pleasant to work with.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Mr. Muriithi!

name: Mon OK
text: Thank you, Dr. Allman and staff!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review Mrs. O'Keefe!

name: Randall Cox
text: Relatively fast and friendly.

name: Emily of Earth
text: Friendly and fast. Nearby

name: Randall Cox
text: Relatively fast and friendly.

name: Mon OK
text: Thank you, Dr. Allman and staff!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review Mrs. O'Keefe!

name: Angelina Todd
text: I was in and out! Friendly staff, no wait on a Thursday.

name: Brittney Mobley
text: Horrible location honestly. The definition of Doc in a box. This place will take your money and throw a wild guess at your situation. Literally came up w bs both times. It just didn’t sit well with me.  If you are in need of real care please choose another location. I was unknowingly suffering from a real life or death emergency. Had either doctor taken the time to actual see me they would’ve know to advise additional care ESPECIALLY after my second visit. What a joke! They prescribed me Mucinex lol . Do yourself a favorite and go to a real doctor. The only consistent part is the ladies up from who are processing your PAYMENTS and the triage. I was billed $400 for 10 minutes and something I could’ve googled. T E R R I B L E!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. Please reach out to patientadvocate@americanfamilycare.com so we can rectify this issue. Please include your full name, DOB, and a brief detail of your experience.

name: Tymecca Lee
text: This is the worst urgent care ever. I saw nurse at 3:26. She told me to wait 15 mins and its now 4:25 and i am just leaving, after i had to leave room and go upfront and remind them i was still waiting. Completely useless...i need corporate or district number so i can let them know the conversations i also heard from the employess while i sat and waited.

name: Ryan Church
text: I had to get a COVID test back in September for a job site I was working on. My insurance company covers the test and the AFC website states that all insured patients pay no out of pocket cost for rapid test. January 4th $175 came out of my account for the test I received. I was then billed an additional $360 for the same test. I have made countless effort to get this resolved as well as my wife. This location refers us to corporate each time where we are then sent to voicemail with no call back. Our insurance company has even tried to contact to get the same outcome as us. We have even emailed and still no response! I am not paying a total of $535 for what is suppose to be a FREE test!!

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at  American Family Care - McCalla(205) 461-0038 to speak to our manager directly

name: k Harris
text: Incompetent sign in clerk. I called to ask if they do covid lab test. The receptionist says yes. I then ask if the have a long wait. She says no. I immediately drive 2 minutes up the street and the parking lot and lobby are packed. Once I get to the front to sign in, I'm told they are not doing anymore tests today. She then states they have time slots that fill up within the first hour of operation.  She should have stated this when I called. This is also a contradiction of their website which states no appointments required. A  required time slot is an appointment!!

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Dee
text:
Called AFC at 8 anout getting covid test and was told we needed to get here early that there was already a line. We arrived at 8:30. Had to sign up for the 9:20 time slot. Came back in at 9:20 and had to fill out paperwork which took 30 minutes. Then we waited in waiting area, as more and more people came in, for another 35 minutes before they called us back.

However, once we got back, we were tested quickly and the nurse practitioner was very thorough.

But it took 1 hour to find out I tested negative but that they dropped my husbands test. So he had to be retested. They will call us with those results.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Tommy Wood
text: Nightmare..  came in 1st thing this morning  to sign in and was giving a time to be back for covid test.. 220pm. Its 420pm and still not called.. was told to go to car and wait for phone call, I did that for an hour and decided to come back in. Now I see when lady calls patient names, she just keeps calling until someone walks up from inside, no one is being called thats in their car..  I do not recommend...

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Alex Weldon
text:
There is no way that it should ever humanly necessary to spend SIX AND A HALF HOURS at ANY urgent care or doctors office for a Covid rapid test and blood work. It took FIVE, yes, FIVE attempts in 4 different spots among 3 staff to finally get blood. I was forgotten about for the first 2 hours of this visit and I know I was forgotten about. I was told to wait in my car and I would receive a phone call. I eventually called back and, the lady who answered, her reaction clearly said yes, we forgot about you.

Very unprofessional, very poorly trained, borderline mal-practice.

I left in pain, in tears and very unhappy with the staff at this location. Not how anyone should leave the doctor when sick.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Patrick Randolph
text: $175+ w/no insurance to see a doc....just to say hi. Absolute rip off...easily $55 overcharge. All I needed was inhailer for asthma. All the “extra” business from COVID-19 and they still want to jack up their price because they are greedy. My wife went to urgent care in Hoover and was charged $100...I’ll drive 15mins to save $75+.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Betty Gadson
text: Went there &it was packed &super hot&extremely slow.The young lady at the 2nd desk was rude&very uncaring she kept asking me what was wrong with me I tried to tell her I cld not breathe she yelled at me&said what????????Not to mention I cld barely talk the fact that she was so insensitive &rude&laughed with the other young lady there was  ery tasteless.I left&will never ever go back there.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Mark Varner
text: When I walked into this place I told them I wanted a Covid-19 test and that I did not have insurance so I needed to know what it cost up front, which I paid in full. I was the only person in the place and it took a long time to be seen at all. I never saw a doctor. Then, today, about 2 weeks later I got a bill from them for an additional $68. I told them to let me know how much it was up front. I should not be getting a bill now. They took so long to see me I had to get up and leave and was late getting to work, then they bill me. I would not recommend them to anybody.

name: Rere Miller
text: I come here pretty often because it’s the closest clinic to my house, I went about 10 days ago to get test taken and I was told they’d be back the next day and I’d get a call, I never got a call and had to call myself and I’ve called back everyday since then and was just told they haven’t even been sent yet. It’s almost been 2 weeks I am beyond frustrated!!!

resp.text: •	We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Brittney Lake
text: I don’t think it’s right that American family care charges $150 for people with full Medicaid for a covid test. I know they got some type of money from the government to provide FREE corona virus testing! Why do they not accept Medicaid as insurance during the pandemic?

name: Zachary Guilbault
text: Absolutely terrible customer service and no info put people at risk for Covid contact. Front desk was absolutely no help.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Katya Freebie
text: This used to be a good place to go.  I came here with a sinus infection and the female doctor gave me amoxicillin which did nothing.  Not getting better, I returned to the clinic where the other doctor questioned why I was given amoxicillin and said it normally was not given for that and would not help.  Both times it was a long wait.  3 weeks later I am back and was left waiting while everyone else was called.  After 35 minutes I managed to get someone's attention who then got the lady that works at the desk.  She said she thought I was waiting on someone despite having watched me sign in.  I thought ok they will call me back soon.  Nope.  They literally called everyone else first.  Now I did nothing rude or untoward to cause anyone to have a grudge against me so I have no explanation for that behavior. 30 minutes later I am sitting in the exam room waiting for a staff person before the doctor will see me.  No explanation of why.  Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.  I would have left but I'm too sick and have too much time invested for this trip.

resp.text: It's upsetting to hear that your experience was anything but stellar. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at (205) 461-0038 to discuss this further.

name: Jeremy Breland
text: My daughter is a student in Bham and went here last weekend after waking up feeling terrible. We were very unhappy with the service. She saw a nurse practitioner who was incredibly rude when our daughter wanted to have us on speakerphone while talking with her. After 2-3 questions the NP just walked out and said I’m not doing this anymore. I’ll only talk to you. Pretty sure the patient has the right to have her parents on the phone while talking through antibiotic and steroid shot options but that just didn’t suit her so she walked out. I told my daughter to leave that minute. When she got up to leave the nurse practitioner came out to ask if she was going to leave a bad review for her online. What?!? That’s your biggest concern, a bad review? Wow. Just wow. Long story short I had her go  across town to children’s urgent care on Hwy 280 and had a fantastic experience there. Professional, kind (to her AND us) and didn’t leave her sitting in a room for well over an hour. We will never visit AFC again. Terrible service and terrible experience.

name: Tyra Hoggle
text:
We were staying in the area for the Thanksgiving holiday. My granddaughter had fever, sore throat and body aches.  I had severe headache and body aches as well. I had looked up and noticed AFC was open at 8am and was very thankful. (We arrived around 8:30) Only 2 cars in the parking lot at the time.  As we were signing in,  one person came out that had been seen by the NP that was on call.  I was finally taken back to be triaged and put in a room.  My daughter and granddaughter were still in waiting room for another 10 mins or so before they were taken back to be triaged and put into a room.

Once in a room, I waited for a little while and the NP came in and saw me.  She was great! She told me someone would be in to swab me for the flu and strep. Head hurting, lying on the bed...all I heard was talking and laughing coming from the nurses station.  Waited for what seemed like forever...still no one shows up to check on me.  I go to the restroom across the hall from my room and came back out to the nurses sitting at the station talking about Thanksgiving, shopping, etc. I then asked if my orders to be swabbed had been sent to them.  They all opened their laptops and said oh yes, here it is. "Someone will be with you in a moment".  Then a moment of silence from them and then the chattering back and forth began again.

A couple of minutes later the nurse that came in was Kia, very sweet and kind.  I had not met or even saw her until she came into do the swab. She did apologize for the delay and said that she had previously been in with another patient. I laid my head back down and then texted by daughter a few minutes later and asked her if my granddaughter had been swabbed as well.  She said she had not been.  I then went back outside my door and asked if anyone had been in to swab by granddaughter and was told yes...without even giving them her name at first. My daughter heard them bold face lie to me.  I told them that I knew that no one had been in there to swab her and expected it to be done ASAP because she was very sick. A "professional" to lie to my face is repulsive.

Again Kia, was the nurse sent into the room to do the swab.  After the test came back on me, a totally different nurse came into the room and gave me my shots.  I never saw one of the ones sitting at the desk again.  That is where they stayed.  My granddaughter finally received her diagnosis as strep and was also given a shot.  The shot was given by Kia.

Where were all the other nurses that had nothing to do but sit around the desk and chit chat all morning?  For us being the only patients there during all of this time, it should not have taken 2 hours. I don't mind waiting at all if there is a good reason but this particular day and location, there was no reason for this to be a 2 hour visit.  This is what will happen you have a full staff on hand but only a couple of them are actually working.

resp.text: Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 461-0038. We look forward to hearing from you.

text: Extremely slow. Had to wait an hour in the front and another hour in the back. No one came to advise me on wait time. All I needed was two shots. I saw someone else and asked them and she rudely stated that she was the only doctor and had no idea. After waiting another 15 minutes, I finally left and asked for a refund.  It wasn't until then that they finally said they could help me. I was definitely offended at this point. It shouldn't take me asking for a refund to get help. I will never go to this place again because they obviously don't value people's time and patience. I would rate a negative, if that option was available.

resp.text: Kevin Lee, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We regret that you had a negative experience, and will use this as an opportunity to improve.

name: Portia Jennings
text: Don’t visit this AFC. The nurse that took my stats was nice and friendly but the doctor was not thorough. Just immediately suggested a shot. When I told him I didn’t want to do that he never even came back in. He sent another lady in to give me discharge instructions where the doctor put that he discussed all of these things with me—which he did NOT. It’s a waste of time going here.

name: Ken Snider
text: I want to American Family Care off of Eastern Valley Road yesterday and it was great I wish I had met Dr Morgan years ago. She was easy to talk to and to the point. The receptionist the nurse even the vampire who drew the blood easy with the noodles and I can appreciate that. I didn't have time to fill out the forms before they call me in to the back

resp.text: Hello Ken Snider, thank you; we appreciate your feedback!

name: Melinda Jacobs
text: My husband and I went there because they advertise that they do Family Practice. I have a condition that does not allow me to drive and he works 6 days a week with very long hours. Weekends are the only time we have to go. We were open with them about this. Our old primary care physician is too far away now that we have moved. We were treated like drug addicts because we both take some strong medicine which we never asked them to fill. Them called in medicine that was wrong. The amount of insulin they called in for me to take would have killed me. Thank goodness the pharmacist caught it, however it took 3 days to get the doctor to fix it. So I went 3 days without insilin. Then he didn't call in the needles for the insulin pens. I called for those and they called in syringes instead of pen needles like I asked for. So again another night without insulin. When they finally got it right I was told to find a primary care doctor to handle all the issues I have. They are supposed to be my primary care doctor now. The issues I have are that they can't get anything right with my prescriptions. I'm not the problem here. It scares me how bad they don't listen and transfer information and then want to blame the patient.

resp.text: Melinda, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at (205) 461-0038 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Denese Mason
text: The staff was friendly.  I arrived around 515 pm on Saturday and they closed at 6pm.  However, I felt welcomed and important.  I was seen fairly quickly and did not feel hurried or rushed.  The nurse and doctor were very nice and made me feel comfortable.  I will be returning to this clinic if the need arises.  Satisfied patient!

resp.text: Hi Denese Mason, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at American Family Care - Bessemer. We're happy we could meet your expectations!

name: Latrice Cleveland
text: I went there sick and left even sicker. The doctor prescribed me an antibiotic that gave me really bad flu like symptoms. I came back there 2 days later and he then prescribed some Tamiflu. I didnt take it. I was so sick that I eventually went to the ER. They told me that I shouldn't have been given antibiotics for my condition in the first place. So now I'm suffering until the effects of the medication wear off. I'm still feeling sick a week later. 😞

resp.text: It's upsetting to hear that your experience was anything but stellar. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at  (205) 461-0038 to discuss this further.

name: B Reach
text: Always fast paced in & out, friendly staff. Dr. Powell took a lot time explaining ways help me get better, his attention towards me by far best, most doctors write meds & out the door not him. Soon as I entered building all of weekend staff was very nice, courteous to me, I'll definitely be a returning customer.

resp.text: Hi B Reach! We're so happy we were able to help you out! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: Susan Vice
text: Would have given 5 *, but the wait time was a little on the excessive side, once we got in a rm.  We thought we'd been forgotten about, & my husband had to pop his head out to ck.  There was only 1 other person in waiting rm. when we went to get vitals, & maybe 5 cars in the parking lot (inc. ours).  However, it was a Sun. morning, & I think there was only one Dr. there, so all in all, we were treated well.  I would recommend them, esp. as an after-hrs. clinic, & much better than an ER wait!

resp.text: Hi Susan, we are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience! We hope to be of service to you again in the future.  Best wishes,  American Family Care - Bessemer

If you want to be treated like family and feel like they really care about you, not like cattle being pushed thru. Then this is the place to go.

I had bcbs.. unless you have 100 % coverage insurance you might as well go to the er and find someone who knows what they are talking about. Absolutely not worth it. If you need anything besides antibiotics I would highly recommend going some place else. Also, waited 1 hr first visit, 2 hrs second visit before I ever saw a dr.
