text: I dont recommend To anyone the receptionist is very rude and after speaking with her and telling her what services I came for she was even more rude. This will be my last Trip EVER to this walk in clinic save your time and money because you have to wait hours to be seen for a 20 min appointment.

name: Lisa Gunn
text: Very sweet and caring staff! Love that they have cold waters, juices and even coffee to enjoy while you wait ! Awesome place.

name: sunrise Dino
text: Very nice staff but with a 3 hour wait for covid testing, in a packed room, and no guarantee that they will have tests when it's finally your turn, I had to say no thank you. Why can't they count their tests??? I'll take my chances and NOT wait in a holding pen with a couple of dozen possibly infected people just to find out something they can't help anyway.

name: Tim Nahlik
text: I went on Saturday 1/9/21 morning when they opened for a eye infection there where fifteen cars already waiting so I thought I would do them a favor and request tel health which I did and was approved but never received a call so I followed up on Sunday 1/10/21 and was told I was approved and would be getting a call soon.Well now they have closed and didn’t get any treatment.That’s bad business to offer a service that’s not actually provided that’s why you have such a low rating.

name: Julie Rose
text: Very friendly and helpful. Dr went out of her way to make sure I was taken care of. I never usually have to wait very long. I will keep going back!

resp.text: This is great news! We're so happy to know that you had a good experience. Thank you for sharing!

name: Billy Lee
text: Sunday i waited 7 hours to get some relief for a sinus infection. The Nurse Practitioner said she called me in some stuff to Cvs and then sent me on the way. I go to Cvs they say they didn't get anything. I call the Clinic and they won't answer. I drive to the clinic. Its 2 minutes before closing. The door is locked and the girl at the desk won't come see what i need. Monday morning they won't answer the phone 30 minutes after they open. I go there and tell them CVS has nothing. They look on the computer and say it was sent and to tell CVS to look again and for them to call the clinic if they can't find it. I go to CVS. They don't have it. They call the clinic. The clinic won't answer them. I have to drive back over there. I tell the clinic CVS don't have it and that CVS called and can't get an answer. The girl walks in the back a few minutes. She comes back and says they are taking care of it right now. I return to CVS and wait 45 minutes. Still nothing. I went home (20 minutes away) and waited several more hours. CVS still didn't have anything. 24 hours later from when i first left on Sunday afternoon i went back again to the Clinic and they finally got me something sent to CVS.

name: Serita
text: You must get there around 7am for covid testinf.It is not a drive thru rather everyone has to wait in line outside in the heat for hours to get tested. Forget about social distancing as we are all close together. To have people wait in line in this heat outside while sick is highly irresponsible. I kept thinking one of these people may pass out at any moment.

name: Melissa York
text:
If you are from Fl and have medicade, make sure you say "Florida Medicade"
We waited 7 hours to hear "yes we take medicade but you didn't say Florida"  Seriously, she could have been nicer.

name: J.D. Bonham
text: I was visiting from out of town and needed medical attention. I went to Main Street Family Care in Andalusia, Al.  I was nervous being and did not know what to expect prior to going in. Once I checked in (easy process) and was seen by a Nurse then NP, my comfort level improved. I found the staff to be professional, caring, concerned and willing to help. I never felt the shot the Nurse face me. I recommend this very capable group of caring professionals and I thank you for your help.

resp.text: Thanks so much JD! We appreciate you sharing your experience!

name: Charles Nowling
text: The worst Main Street had to sit for 3 hours just to pee in a cup DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION

name: Tracy Willingham
text: MainStreet Family Urgent Care has the most amazing staff! They offer complimentary refreshments, ie. coffee, juice, tea, in the lobby while you wait although most times you are in and out within an hour! I will continue to bring my family to MainStreet Family Urgent Care!!

name: Leah January
text: I specifically said that I was allergic to a certain steroid when they wanted to prescribe that for my sinus infection. I was also asked about the medications I currently take. They logged it all down in their computer in the room. They call in my prescriptions. I wasn't even told what they were calling in. Odd, but ok. So I go pick up my medicine, go home, take it, and within an hour I'm having an allergic reaction to something. I go to the ER. They get me fixed up. They said there are 2 problems here. They prescribed me a STEROID that is 6 TIMES MORE POTENT THAN THE ONE I TOLD THEM I WAS ALLERGIC TO!!! There also is a MAJOR INTERACTION (doctors own words) with one of my daily medicines that I take. The risk is seizures. I feel like they could've killed me!

resp.text:
Hi Leah,

Thank you so much for reaching out! That is certainly concerning, and we definitely want to address this. Our Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Taylor has reached out and left a voicemail and the number we have on file. Please give him a call back as soon as you can so that we can look into this and get more information. Thank you again for bringing this to our attention!

name: Brandon
text:
Went in with a lot of neck and shoulder pain.

After two shots in the butt, I was in a lot more pain.
But after a very uncomfortable car ride home... I'm all better.

10/10. Would feel pain again.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing Brandon! We're so happy we could help you feel better! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Leah Blalock
text: I love this place! The free coffee, late hours, toys and color pads for the kids, this place really thought of everything!! Excellent care from an excellent staff!!

name: kenny Spurlin
text: Amazing staff and service they actually take time to find what will work best for you. they just give don't give you anything and rush you out like a lot of other's.  thank you mainstreet you made me feel like family

resp.text: Thank you Kenny! Treating patients like family is exactly what we strive to do! Thank you for choosing MainStreet and for sharing your experience!

name: Jessica Bulger
text: Please do something with your phone system. I have continuously been trying to call for 2 days to pay a bill. The 877 number listed is "not setup to receive calls" and the 427 number (option 2 for bill pay) just rings until it eventually hangs up on you. If you choose option 0 just hoping to find a live body to talk to, it hangs up on you as well. Update: the 427 number has now been busy for the last 10 minutes solid. You'd think with as much as you're charging patients that you'd at least make it convenient for them to pay their bills!!

resp.text: Jessica, we are so sorry for the inconvenience. We are working on the issue with the phones. Please let me know if are still having trouble reaching someone.

name: Joanna Wu
text: Bad service! Race! Attitude! Don’t tell them you wake up at 1 pm they will tell and give you the attitude you are ware !!!

resp.text:
Hi Joanna,

We are very sorry to hear you did not have a good experience. We'd love the opportunity to follow up and improve. When you have a moment, would you please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your name, DOB, and any details you can provide about your experience? We certainly want to make this right for you! Thank you again for contacting us.

name: Amara Evans
text: They have one of the best ultrasound techs, Tonya Machen. She really knows her stuff and truly cares for her patients.

resp.text: Thanks Amara! We agree, Tonya is pretty spectacular!

name: Heisenberg Parks
text: I was told to come here to take a urine test that it would only take 10 minutes. It's been an hour and a half and I'm still sitting here. My wife had to be at work 30 minutes ago. 1 hour in I told the lady at the front desk I had to go my wife had to be at work. She said he should be with me shortly. Now were going on 2 hours just to piss in a cup!!!!!!!!!!!

resp.text:
Hi Heisenberg,

We appreciate you reaching out regarding your visit. We always pride ourselves on getting patients in and out within an hour, so we are disappointed to hear your visit took so long! We will certainly follow up with our staff to see what the hold up was and ensure it doesn't happen again. Thank you again for providing us with this feedback!

name: SHANNON “styson76” TYSON
text: Since main street took over it is horrible. You can't get them to answer the phone. They are super slow. Not to mention they don't seem to have  a clue what is going on. I have to fill out new papers every time I go. They no longer see primary care on the weekends and insist you give them a credit card even if you pay cash.

resp.text: We are so sorry for your unsatisfactory experience. We are currently working on our phone systems at this time. Our community educator will be reaching out to speak to you about your visit.

name: Becky Baskerville
text: Waiting room stocked with juice, water, etc..Very kind staff. Dr. Norris was very professional and calming. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you, Becky! We love your feedback!

name: Kelly Wilson
text: Great staff, friendly, and professional. I appreciated their kindness and attentiveness to what I needed.

resp.text: Thank you, Kelly!

name: Jason Jackson
text: Went yesterday and staff was great kind and considerate.

resp.text: Thanks so much Jason! So glad we could help!

name: Vincent Shelley
text: Worst experience ever waited almost 4 hours for an employment drug screen! Rude staff, Clueless and very inconsiderate!

resp.text: We are sorry for your wait time- With the rise of flu, we have experienced longer wait times. Again, we are sorry for your unsatisfactory experience.

name: Gorden Litchfield
text: Was here with my wife for over 2 hours first time,,, then they said her paper work was wrong after waiting for a long time we went and got it right then came back and waited for a long time again for a drug test...cold in the lobby bring a coat...customer service sucks...

name: tami killough
text: Told my daughter they dont accept Ins for a physical to be done. What the hell is the purpose of Ins then?

resp.text:
Hi Tami,

Thank you for your feedback! Insurance usually covers an annual wellness physical, but they typically won’t cover other physicals needed for school or work. What type of physical was she inquiring about? I certainly want to follow up to ensure we’re telling folks correctly on this. Thank you again for reaching out!

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great staff great care

name: Lacey
text: The nurses and staff were so kind. However, the doctor was extremely short with me and as I was trying to ask questions. I understand doctors don’t like to be questioned but I deserve to be able to ask him questions about my condition (!!) with a thorough response— not poking your head in the door and giving me 1/4 of your attention. I’m paying YOU, after all. Please don’t write patients off when they’re concerned about their condition. Especially when it’s simple questions they just want clarity on. Give them the time they deserve and the attention they deserve since they are paying for your services. I won’t be returning to this location- ever. And I also will let my friends know that the one down the street has much more kind physicians on staff that actually show compassion for their patients.

name: Carmenlina Ramsey
text: Jenny was the best person to see first. She showed genuine concern and care about how I felt. Almost like a mom. I really appreciated that. She even called me today to make sure I was feeling better. Please let her know that she us God sent and her loving spirit was appreciated!

name: Frank Paul
text: A week ago I came into AFC because my upper right thigh was numb. I paid $175 for the doctor to ask me a bunch of broad questions. He never even looked at my leg or felt my leg. He told me to jog around the office after I explained to him that I could walk and run perfectly fine, and my issue was not pain but the fact my thigh was numb.I'm no doctor but I did not feel well taken care of. The only reason I'm writing this review is that I've talked to a couple of people with similar complaints to AFC.

name: Marian Yurchishin
text: Excellent staff and quick service! Doctor and nurses were patient and friendly and made my visit enjoyable. It took about 1 hour from the time I checked in till the time I left, and I felt very  well taken care of the entire time. Highly recommend.

name: Melissa White
text: Very good service—professional and clean. Even during the pandemic I felt cared for and safe. Everyone was wearing proper PPE. Definitely recommend.

name: Candice Dunn
text: I highly recommend AFC-Vestavia for your primary care needs! I had a minor back injury and they were very professional, kind, informative, and able to get me in and out with great care. I enjoyed that my prescription was ready at their in house pharmacy so I didn’t have to make another stop. All around great first experience!

name: Christopher Hall
text: Jani was phenomenal. She went out of her way to help me out in a way that the was completely not required of her. There was a PCM there who did their best to ruin the experience. Jani and Dr. Thomas fixed it. I recommend them alone based on those 2 people helping me

name: Nurse Bae
text: Waited 2 1/2 hours for a physical only to be told that physician wanted me to sign a release to get my shot records, which were not needed to complete the physical. I had copies of all of my immunizations in my email and informed the physician of that. I was told that it would t suffice and I could go somewhere else after waiting 2 and a half hours. The office manager was able to clear up the problem for me but this was completely unacceptable and I will not be returning to this location or any other locations. This is not the first time I’ve had a negative experience with American Family Care.

name: Lance Huffstutler
text: Great customer service. Get in, get what you need and go. They don’t play around. If your sick they treat you with the best and get you well fast

name: Robert Burdine
text: I have been to numerous medical care locations, and the staff, including the Dr. Brenthall, and most of all the receptionists, have been extremely professional, but mainly caring. I have never felt so well treated. Thank y'all!

name: Danielle Miller
text: My husband I came here while being here for a funeral. Well turns out we both had strep throat. They were the most funniest, caring nurses and can’t forget Dr. Brentnall for being so kind to us as if he had seen us before! Will definitely use them again if I’m ever in the area and need to be seen. They even did a follow up call to see how we were feeling.

name: Maggie Whitfield
text: This was the quickest I've ever been in and out of an urgent care! The whole staff was nice, competent, and efficient. Also, shots and throat swabs were virtually painless. Awesome experience, thank you!

name: Elesya Dinoff
text: Dr. Brentnall is awesome. Such a funny and kind doctor. Also the nurses are great!  And the pharmacist. Best experience I ever had a doctors office! Great staff!!  Thank you!

name: Gina Vines
text: I loved having the pharmacy in the same building as the doctor's office! It's so convenient to get your prescriptions filled on site when you aren't feeling well.

name: Austin Keim
text: AFC went above and beyond. From the staff at the front, to X-ray techs and nurses. We are impressed with how caring they were to our needs. They listened, and we are so grateful for this staff and their hearts to help!

name: Sarah Morriss
text: Everybody was really friendly and professional. The doctor was really sweet, took time to talk to me, and knew what she was about. Not a long wait. And I felt very well attended to and taken care of. I am confident the medicines I was prescribed are helping me get better. Thanks guys!

name: Shanna
text: Extremely slow service, came here to avoid the emergency room wait. But the service at the emergency room would've been faster.... will not be back

name: David DiPiazza
text: Thank you for sharing your feedback, we appreciate your time! If you requested information or follow up, someone will be in touch soon.

name: Jason Lowe
text: Slowest Urgent Care I have ever been to. Was in there approximately 4 hours just to get a antibiotic shot and some amoxicillin. There was only a few people in the waiting room.

name: Lindsey Brooks
text: American Family Care in Vestavia was excellent.  Even as a walk in, I was made to feel like a priority. The entire staff was both professional and personal. I am glad to know that this AFC in Vestavia is an option for me and that is it is open 7 days a week!

name: Brandi Fuller
text:
The only redeeming part of my visit were the medical assistants, who were very kind and helpful. Dr. Brentnall (sp?) was very strange and made me extremely uncomfortable. He seemed very old school, and when I told him I had a sore throat he told me to stay away from lozenges because they would make my throat worse? He offered no medical explanation for how that worked.

He also sat beside me on the table very closely. I have NEVER had a physician do that, and it was very uncomfortable and unprofessional. He also walked in as an MA was administering a shot to my hip.

I don’t know how the other physicians are, but I would avoid him at all costs.

name: Amy-Renee King
text: Dr. FEIST is an amazing doctor.  She is extremely competent and caring! We love her and highly recommend her. The pharmacist at the U-save Pharmacy at the Vestavia location, Brooke Bailey - Simpson,  is wonderful and we get all our prescriptions there! All the staff at the Vestavia location are great, efficient,  and friendly.  And the location is clean and inviting.

name: Mark McColl
text: 10.  The staff was fantastic from the nurses to Dr Brentnall.   Dr Brentnall has a great manner about him.  Professional but relaxed.  The nurses were very engaging and competent.

name: Nik Gentile
text: This place is a sham. They made me pay a hundred dollars upfront because my insurance has a 20% payout from me. Then I was told I would have to go see a specialist for a simple procedure. All and all I was in and out in less than an hour. I have no idea why I have insurance because they dont care. Will never be back.

name: Helen Hosmer
text: I would not recommend taking an infant or young child to this office. I just took my 10 month old in to see if he has an ear infection ( I would normally go to my pediatrician, but we are going out of town and it is a Sunday) They seemed shocked that I brought a young child in, and the doctor said a pediatrician is the last thing he would want to be, which was not comforting to me as a mother. They did look at his ears, but I was in there for about two minutes total with no other questions asked about his symptoms. The dr suggested that if I’ve been giving my 10 month old “coca cola” it could be causing his ears to hurt.....and my response was that he was a 10 month old and has never had Coca Cola.......They may be fine with adults, but I wish I had known they were not prepared in the least bit to see an infant.

name: Benita Allen (Bee Kay)
text: Visiting from Washington State and finding myself at American Family Care for assistance was very warm. The southern hospitality is spread throughout Alabama and I felt at home when I was there.  The customer service experience was awesome, the doctor was very understanding and she spoke layman terms so that I understood exactly what she was saying to me.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone seeking Urgent Care last minute.

name: Kelly Grimes
text: This is by far my favorite branch. I almost never have to wait long at all, even when they seen busy. They have a pharmacy on site, which is also fast and convenient. The staff, doctor & nurse practitioner are all so nice and caring. Got a shot and got dizzy, and nurse stood with me fanning me and talking with me for about 20 minutes. Thought that was very sweet. They did a follow up call with me to check in on me too. Thought that was very sweet as well.  Lab tests were all very quick every time I've ever been there (fast compared to most places, at least).

name: Matthew Murray
text: 2 hours in with only 5 people in the waiting room, and I still haven’t been seen yet. One practitioner at the front has just been on her computer the entire time, and when you try to ask her for help she just sends you to the other window. This AFC wins the award for slowest walk-in clinic in town...

name: Kelly Grimes
text: This is by far my favorite branch. I almost never have to wait long at all, even when they seen busy. They have a pharmacy on site, which is also fast and convenient. The staff, doctor & nurse practitioner are all so nice and caring. Got a shot and got dizzy, and nurse stood with me fanning me and talking with me for about 20 minutes. Thought that was very sweet. They did a follow up call with me to check in on me too. Thought that was very sweet as well.  Lab tests were all very quick every time I've ever been there (fast compared to most places, at least).

name: Kim Norris
text: Good diagnosis and proper medicine given.  I felt so much better the next day.  The Doctor was so caring and kind

name: wendi collins
text: It was great!  The wait time to see the doctor was minimal.  Everyone from the receptionist to nurse was so kind.  The doctor was wonderful and made me feel very comfortable and as if she really cared and wanted me to feel better.  I would 100% go there again!

name: Mick'ael
text: Dr. Heist was amazing, caring, and thorough! The staff was amazing and checked on me periodically. I loved how they were very big on customer service, which was a plus for me! Service to me was fast and efficient. I will definitely visit this location again if I need to.

name: Lori Hogan
text: Everyone was great. Dr Feist, the nurses Teresa, and Jonathon friendly and caring. Love love all of them. They treated me fairly showed love and concern and are A++++. They both deserve a huge raise!!! Teresa is also a very hard worker and seems she doesn’t get the credit for it. I watched her zip around and made things work for me. Thank you Teresa. Janithan was so kind and was very respectable and personable during my intake. It was Fast in and out. No long waits. Recommend this place highly.

name: Lynn Terry
text: I receive more one on one time with the doctors, nurses, lab technicians, receptionist and pharmacist at this location EVERY TIME I VISIT, which is at least every 3-6 months. It's one less stop to make on the way home, having a pharmacy located so conveniently.

name: Barbara Kiousis
text: It truly makes for a better experience to have someone take the time to help when you are not feeling well. These days there never seems to be enough staff that cares or time for getting help with all the red tape. Thank you for your help and kindness. BK

name: Matthew Murray
text: 2 hours in with only 5 people in the waiting room, and I still haven’t been seen yet. One practitioner at the front has just been on her computer the entire time, and when you try to ask her for help she just sends you to the other window. This AFC wins the award for slowest walk-in clinic in town...

name: Ed Landers
text: Excellent experience. Doctor and Nurse professional and kind.

name: Katelyn Bunn
text: Dr. Feist was very kind and caring. She took time to listen to me and genuinely seemed to care. I was a new patient, and was called back less than 5 minutes after filling paperwork out. Would definitely recommend this clinic.

name: Ed Landers
text: Excellent experience. Doctor and Nurse professional and kind.

name: susan gagne
text: I went in two days before Christmas feeling so sick. The staff was kind, efficient, professional and caring. As an uninsured patient I was concerned about the costs but they made sure they only did what was necessary to get me better. And thats what they did. They had me follow up the next day and provided the additional care and treatment I needed to fully recover. I would recommend Dr. Feist and her staff to anyone who needs competent and caring medical attention. Thank you again!

name: Marie D
text: There were only about 4 patients in the office, total. The wait times (in the waiting room and waiting around in the exam room for the doctor and nurse) were as if there were 15 or so patients. I believe there were one or two nurses working, but a woman (albeit a very nice and helpful woman who did her job, or rather someone else's job, well) who's badge said Radiology Tech performed all nurse duties other than blood draw and throat swab. I spent most of the visit wishing I had gone / thinking about going somewhere else. I grew up in Vestavia, and this was one of many poor experiences I've had at that location over the years. About 10 years ago I had a nurse insert the blood draw needle upside down! Meaning, she put it in to where the tip of the needle was pointing towards my wrist. Absurd. I was right near it and looking for a urgent care when I went in this week. It didn't take me long to remember why I stopped going there. Also, I've read multiple negative reviews about Dr. Brentnall, and I'm here to add another. I was there with a cold and an unrelated YI. He asked me, "Well, about that, we can't still get in to see our lady doctor, right?" It was very dismissive, rude, and awkward. He really didn't pay any attention to what I had to say. He ordered a step test when I had clearly explained I knew the only reason my throat hurt was sinus drainage. The only thing he did listen to was my self-diagnoses. After much wasted time and unnecessary labs, he came in with a prescription for an upper respiratory infection and a YI - exactly what I told him I thought I had.  Overall, he made me uncomfortable and wishing I'd seen any doctor but him. Spare yourself, don't go to this office! The only real positive/pleasant interactions I had were with the receptionist and the radiology tech/nurse. Oh, and the pharmacist was nice and helpful.

name: George Frank
text: Everyone was very nice and professional. The nurse and nurse practitioner were awesome ! I was very ill from an upper respiratory infection . I received a shot and some antibiotics and cough syrup and I'm feeling much better.

name: Camron Mercer
text: I had a pleasant experience at this American Family Care. Very nice!

name: Sandii Cain
text: This was my second visit in a week. The staff was very prompt and polite. Dr. Feist, and Teresa are the absolute best. My first visit I was seen by Regina, Parker, Ashley and Dr. Welsh. Both teams are the epitome of prime health care. I would recommend the location at 200 Montgomery Hwy to everyone.

name: Bre Necole
text: What a joke! Dr. Brentnall talked to me like I was a dumb 10 year old.. didn't really listen to my concern and acted like it was just nothing to him .. then proceeds to ask me where is my mom? I AM 29YEARS OLD and you can clearly see that if you took the time to look at my chart or just ask..my god! Just awful.. had to go to another hospital for appropriate treatment.

name: G Caddell
text: I have been to the Vestavia Hills AFC 4 or 5 times and could not be more pleased with their medical care and responsiveness. Dr Feist listens and is very thorough. Very friendly staff who are genuinely concerned.

name: Rebecca Hayes
text:
My best advice to anyone looking to go here is to not go on a Tuesday or Wednesday as that is when Dr. Brentnall told me he works. This was a truly baffling experience, and you should only come here if you want you symptoms ignored or to be immediately referred to an allergy specialist for cold / strep throat symptoms.

Here's a quick list of things that Dr. Brentnall did or said to prevent me from ever coming back here again. I came in after my cold symptoms worsened for 5 days with no sign of improvement plus I had developed a bad sore throat and dizziness:

- He treated me like a child. He grabs the instrument to look in my mouth, ears, and nose. He stares at me for a second then says, "I can see better if you open your mouth." Are you serious?? How about you ask me to open my mouth? For all I know you're going for my nose!
- "your nose is red. Looks like you're bothered by the ragweed". Proceeds to talk about an allergist he recommends and a medication etc. I have had allergies since I was 13, and they are under control. I know what allergies are, and this is not allergies. How about my nose is red because I've had COLD SYMPTOMS FOR 5 DAYS!?
- He never asks about my symptoms. I had to force them on him by blurting them out when he walks in for the 4th or 5th time he's come in the room (usually to talk about allergies some more). He dismissed them all as either being allergies, my IBS (which is also under control), or a side effect of medication I've been taking for 6 YEARS! I have never had a negative reaction to this medication. I know it can start at any time, but what are the odds of all of these things happening at once rather than I actually have a bad cold, or the flu, or something else?!
- He sat on the bed with me twice.... I was very uncomfortable. He should have grabbed a chair since there were practically no other patients in the entire office.
- I cannot count the number of times he talked about allergies or particles in the air.
- He tried to trick me into taking allergy medication. He vaguely described what it was when he listed the meds, and never said it was for allergies. I only found out when the pharmacist mentioned it. I already take a daily OTC allergy medication. I DO NOT HAVE AN ALLERGY PROBLEM!

I'm really curious to know if he treats all of his patients this way or if it is just the female patients. Also, does he get some kind of kick back from the number of people he refers to this allergist?? My boyfriend and I left that place completely furious. Every time Dr. Brentnall left the room, we would rant to each other. I believe the staff could hear us through the door each time, and I really hope they did.

I will say the only positive was the pharmacist. She was knowledgeable yet eager to learn when I told her I needed gluten free medications due to celiac. And there was no way I was going to get that allergy medication filled.

name: Tawnya Yates
text: I was told I could not be seen because I “owe” $200 due to insurance denying a claim from a year and a half ago. I have been to AFC since then, and was never informed of this, and I have never received anything in the mail regarding this. When I called my insurance, they told me there was zero record of a claim ever being sent in. My insurance rep called and spoke with Hayli and asked her to refile the claim. When I called AFC a little later to make sure they actually refiled the claim, I was told they could not do that at the office, and that they hadn’t called corporate about it yet. Long story short: You turn away an injured patient, due to a mistake you made and one I was never informed of, and then dont bother to attempt to rectify the mistake in a timely manner? Got it.

name: Jennifer Gough
text: Dr Feist and Teresa and chris were awesome they were so friendly and took time to answer any questions I had

name: WAB
text: Relatively quick, empathetic staff, excellent treatment. Recommend taking advantage of on site pharmacy to avoid big box chain pharmacy headaches. Professional and friendly.

name: Jack F
text: Great experience! Staff was kind, courteous, and time efficient. Talked through my illness and was very thorough. 10/10 would recommend.

name: Jennifer Jackson
text: I would Love to say that the Staff that was there on June 29, 2014 (Saturday) is the Best Staff.. I came there(on 31 IN HOOVER) in so much aching pain all over my body, and needles to say is that they took good care of me and I LOVE YOU ALL FOR ALL YOUR HELP.. BLESS YOU ALL... such a wonderful staff.

name: Judith Meyer
text: Second time using American Family Care Vestavia. Both time a very good, fast and effecient experience!!! My Poison Ivy is much better, for sure!!!

name: Ariel Payne
text: Waited for over an hour. Still waiting actually. Would leave however already paid a copay.

name: Stephen King
text: My family and I come to the AFC, specifically the Vestavia location, for many of our medical needs. The check in process is a breeze. The triage group are friendly and thorough and get us into a room in as quickly a mannor as possible. Dr Feist medical care is always exceptional professional.  She is warm, kind and goes out of her way to give her patients the best treatment. We get all of our medications from Brooke Simpson at the u-save pharmacy. Whether prescribed by an AFC doctor or from a our Primary or hospital. I recently had a major infection in my left hand that ended having to have surgery. The RN that handled me a Vestavia, I believe literally saved my finger. Thank you for you're time. I could give example after of the exemplary service we have received from the Vestavia American Family care. Thank you for taking the time to ask for our feedback!

name: Takisha Facen
text: I really like it American Family Care I  visited the clinic for a follow up on my blood work I was in and out in like no time at all .The staff was very friendly easy to Talk to they gave  helpful information about my health and steps that  I should take next to better myself and this was  on Saturday 11/25/2017 I will be doing  Follow up on Monday with the results that I was given all good results  thanks so much doctor and staff keep up the good work god bless you....

name: Suzanna McKinney
text: AFC in Vestavia is the best! It's quick and convenient to my workplace, and I've been in for everything from a torn muscle to walking Pneumonia. The staff and doctors are always empathetic and solution-oriented.

name: Rosa Fisher
text: Dr. Morgan was friendly, professional, understanding, and very knowledgeable of my condition and provided the exact treatment and care I needed..The staff was very supportive, efficient and empathetic with my condition. Overall, I am very pleased with the care I received and strongly recommend AFC Vestavia Hills to my family and friends.

name: Clark De Jonge
text: My wife and I were quite ill.  Went to AFC office Sunday afternoon.  Were pleased to be seen individually by Doctor Feist in less that one hour.  Diagnosed with Walking Pneumonia. I was given a steroid shot, and we given prescriptions which they had called into our Pharmacy so we could pick them up on our way home.  Got a follow-up call this morning to see how we are doing.  Excellent treatment by one and all.

name: Teresa Ragan
text: DR. FEIST, CHIS, THE LAB TECHNICIAN, AND HALEY AT THE FRONT DESK WERE THE GREATEST PEOPLE AT AFC VESTAVIA.. THEY WERE SO KIND AND CARING... I WANT ALL MY FRIENDS TO GO TO AFC VESTAVIA THEY ARE WONDERFUL AND THEY CARE ABOUT YOU!!!! THANKS AGAIN AND I APPRECIATE ALL YOUR WORK AND SUPPORT.!!!

name: H W
text:
I've been there multiple times due to a work injury. The staff, nurses and X-Ray tech are always welcoming and kind. It's always great to see smiling face when you're at your wise.
Dr.Fiest was my only problem, very short with each of my Visits knowing my case was going to inspected. She knows well but sometimes pushes PT's to far.
Manager Ashley was very understanding during this time. Overall it's a great staff, just need a new MD.

name: Charles Romano
text: One of the worst experiences I've ever encountered. Waited over two hours for results on simple blood work. I Could hear the doctor walk several other people in and out in the rooms next to me. Only to speak to me for less than 2 minutes. Followed by another 30 minute wait because she didn't have the medication ready. I Would recommend trying witch craft before you walk through these doors.

name: Tj Everett
text: Everyone is pleasant and the doctors listen. I actually don't have my own family doctor because they treat me so well.

name: Elijah Williams
text: I have been waiting in the examination room for over an hour. All I need is a prescription refilled. It takes 40 seconds to write a prescription. The women at the front desk were nice and the nurse who called me back was nice. I stepped outside to ask about a timeframe on when the doctor would come around and was told "it should be shortly." That was 40 minutes ago. I've been waiting back here for almost two hours. I'll receive 5 minutes of service to have them write me a prescription. I'll never come back here again.

name: Mike Rovnak
text: Nurse Teresa and Dr. Brentnall provide top notch care. We have had good experiences at this location.

name: Gwendolyn Grey
text:
Misdiagnosed my UTI twice, once as constipation then as nothing. Details below.

The level of care directly depends on how busy they are, I think, because I've had excellent care here before when they were slow. But they were very busy both times I went in recently.

Went in on a Friday with vomiting, back pain and shaking. Was told I was constipated and referred to GI doctor (who couldn't see me for over a month). Went back the next day due to increasing pain in back and stomach. Was asked literally "we've already referred you to a GI doctor, what more do you want?" Explained how things were getting worse, was told I was NOT constipated and sent on my way with no help or diagnosis, also told my urine looked "not too bad". I paid them again though. Went to my family Dr who diagnosed UTI based on symptoms because the urine tests don't show everything. Prescribed antibiotics and within 24 hours has relief.

name: JoAnn Turner
text: Dr Fiest has seen me several times for sinus infections & walking pneumonia. She is a wonderful doctor & I find out when she is working & then go that day. I am so happy to go there .

name: Salena Stalker
text:
AFC ALWAYS tries to make me pay a $20 fee regardless of the fact that I have met my max out pocket expense.  Liars!

They claimed they were a special case because they’re urgent care!  Funny, MedHelp didn’t charge me a copay. They actually bothered to look me up in the BCBS of AL system and saw that I owe NOTHING!

name: Scott Gilliland
text: Great Service!  Convenient location. Friendly staff.

name: Brian King
text: I have never had a bad experience at this location.  Wait times have always been minimal and Dr. Feist is compassionate and knowledgeable.

name: samuel
text: I have unfortunately had to talk to Haley a few times, on the phone she is rude and as soon as my wife and I went in she was so unhelpful with anything. Wife called later to ask why they didn’t explain some stuff to us in the office about insurance and she went on a spree that she had told us and I was wrong. Never going there again. They should look into getting rid of “Haley my last name isn’t important”

name: Abi Carter
text: Nurses & my doctor were wonderful. Very good experience compared to last time (different dr). Only reason i gave 4 stars is because the front desk staff is very unprofessional. I don't mind different hair colors, but what i do mind is when the front staff talks about how much they hate funerals and certain family members in general. I agree, no one likes funerals. I didn't want to go to the 20 something funerals I attended (1 being my dad's another was my sister's), but it is a celebration of that person's life and the family's last time to see that person. Next time don't express your dislike for them so loudly for the whole waiting room to hear. It is EXTREMELY disrespectful to the family mourning that individual AND very unprofessional.

name: Kaitlyn Nelson
text: Dr. Brentnall and staff are very kind and compassionate. It’s rare to find doctors that actually care but Dr. Brentnall does!

name: Nick Morros
text: Staff very courteous and helpful; although, the staff can only be helpful to a certain level. The overall onus of care is on the treating practitioner as the leader within the clinic setting. I have been in medicine for 25 years and have experienced only a few times in my career an adult Physician as rude and completely out of touch as this one was. We had a 6 year old in the  office for evaluation of an ear and upper respiratory infection. It was obvious, he has a limited knowledge of Pediatric Medicine... Dr. Charles Brentnall was on staff and I would highly recommend not seeing this provider in this office. As a long time Vestavia resident, if this Physician is on staff upon your arrival, you should go to another urgent care in the area...

name: Sarah Hill
text: I was in and out. Everyone was super nice and helpful!

name: Laney Lewis
text: It was cheap, but now I know why. The doctor admitted he had the flu while treating me. As a nursing student, I ask questions and Dr. Brentnall told me, "I don't think I have any more answers." He was very rude and not thorough at all.

name: Rubayet Kamal
text: Service is awful. Took 2 hours to get me in the surgical suit. Once the doctor came finally. He said he wouldn't do the wart removal surgery as he didn't think it looked bad and wanted me to try over the counter medicine which I been trying for 2 months. Went to a different doctor the next day and she took the wart of in 2 min. Moreover Dr park is too old to be a doctor. Can't hear or see very well.

name: Lynn W
text: Great experience each time I've gone. The staff there truly cares about your health.

name: Ginger Smith
text: I had originally given 5 stars because the first time I went there I had such a positive experience. But I guess it just depends on which doctor you see. The second time I had to go the experience was not so great. Was misdiagnosed with a sinus infection instead of bronchitis which is what I actually did have. So if Dr Feist isn't there the day you go in, I would go elsewhere.

name: Terry Widman
text: I walked in and couldn't even complete my paperwork before I was called. Moreover, the doctor and staff identified the cause of my neck pain and have recommended a orthopedist. They also identified a bacterial infection that would have progressed without intervention. I felt like I got first class medical attention.

name: James Cannon
text: Totally uncaring, incompetent staff. I was made to feel like I had done something wrong when I mentioned to the nurse that I was there for a physical. She told me off as if I should have mentioned that when I signed it. I told her the receptionist didn't ask (I've been to similar walk-in clinics and you don't tend to discuss the reason for your visit when you're signing in at any of them.) They brought in the manager, who was nice enough but clarified that if I was there for a PHYSICAL there was other paperwork I was supposed to fill out and it would bill my insurance more. After a long-winded conversation once I told her I was there because I hadn't seen a doctor in a while she says "Oh see you mean a CHECK-UP!" Umm....most people use check-up and physical interchangeably, no?? It's far from weird that I do. Also there was this whole pointless ordeal with the nurse once I mentioned I wanted a prescription for an inhaler for my asthma. I rarely have an attack, so I haven't gotten a new prescription in years so I didn't know the name of the inhaler brand and she says she has to know the name of the brand or the doctor can't prescribe one. In my head I'm like "Can't the doctor just come in and talk to me and we can figure out the kind of inhaler I need." They expect you to know wayyyy too much information and stress you out as a patient instead of COMMUNICATING and LISTENING. I work with the public, so I know what I'm talking about. It was astonishingly unprofessional. Once I saw the doctor, I felt very rushed and like he didn't care at all and I was the ONLY person there. I am actually livid.

name: Katie Seals
text: DO NOT GO HERE! They mainly use nurse practitioners (per contacting headquarters) and do not inform patients that there is no doctor present. Misdiagnosed my husband- and come to find out there could have been MAJOR damage from such misdiagnosis. Do yourself a favor, go somewhere else.

name: Karen Salanguit
text: This is my first time writing a review. I went in on New Year's Eve...The secretary was nice, the older lady who took my vitals and checked my medical history was goofy but also nice. Lab tech who drew my blood was okay. (Got stuck with a huge needle even though i have tiny veins and needed a butterfly needle but at least she showed some sympathy after she had to do it again with one.) Nurse practitioner also goofy but nice as well. My only complaint would be the older guy in black scrubs...I guess he was a lab tech or whatever... I came in for a physical and apparantly he had the wonderful opportunity to check my eyes. Not polite AT ALL. Just told me "come with me"...grabbed my arm and told me "stand here". I work in the healthcare field and deal with patients so I know how you are suppose to treat them and I most definitely did not like how he treated me especially after everyone else was so nice. He was just RUDE RUDE RUDE! Bad day or not, even if you just left a bad patient's room, don't act like you are too busy to do something so simple. Other than that situation and the 2 hr long wait, that's all I have to say.

name: Addie Story
text: Today I met the most wonderful nurse in the world she made me feel like I was her family thank you so much for caring and too Dr. Feist  thank you for making sure that all my medical needs were taken care of thank you so much also so glad I picked you as my Primary Care Doctor.

name: Collin Payne
text: By far the slowest walk in clinic I have ever been to with the entire visit clocking in at over 2 hours with myself being one of 3 patients in the building that entire time.  The entire experience was far less than average, starting with the phone call I made to see if they were open, all the way up to walking out with a prescription, every staff member I spoke with came across as stiff and uncaring, especially the actual doctor, Dr. Feist. I came in with complaints of back pain I believed to be related to a kidney stone, and explained that the main reason for my visit was pain management until I am able to see my urologist next week. From the moment she came into the room I felt that the doctor was accusing me of trying to hustle up pain medications from them like some kind of criminal. I want to make it clear that I did not come in asking for pain pills, I asked about "a pain management plan" for the next week while I wait to see my urologist. I will absolutely never be returning to this clinic and I would not recommend them to anyone.

name: DeAngela Johnson
text: Thank you Dr. Caroline, Johnathon, and DeAngelia! You all were super helpful and efficient.

name: Christopher Hays
text: I've been here twice and both times was horrible! The doctor was very rude and condescending.The staff is mostly new and don't have a clue on what's going on. My last visit there a week ago, they messed my paper work up for a simple physical check up, then 2 different nurse came in and called me by another patient's name. They couldn't even remember who i was! The nurses asked me 3 different times why i was there because no one told them. They had 3 nurses including a lady that worked up front to check my blood pressure. It actually bruised my arm they did it so many times. After all that I was the last person they helped and made mean comments to me when i was finally done. It was the most unorganized clinic i've ever seen and i won't go back. I suggest going somewhere else if you can. The one in Hoover, AL is a million times better.

name: Ruth F
text: I was there for about 3 hours. All the staff were exceptional except for the doctor. The young lady at the front desk was very patient and helpful and so was the nurse that took me back. Dr. Caroline Feist was very impatient; in a huge rush to get out and borderline rude. I was there with my toddler, and she made a comment I felt was rude concerning my toddler. She was walking away as I was talking to her, literally opening the door to walk out of the room. It wasn't until I said "I'm sorry I still had another question" that she came back in, looking annoyed. When you're sick the last thing you need is for the doctor to make you feel like an annoyance. I would not recommend this doctor to anyone. The clinic is clean, the staff is professional and nice and I'm sure there are some pleasant doctors there, but Dr. Feist is not one of them in my opinion.

name: DeAngela Johnson
text: Thank you Dr. Caroline, Johnathon, and DeAngelia! You all were super helpful and efficient.

name: Arthur Charles
text: I am, unfortunately changing my review from what was previously a 5 star review to a 2 star. The ladies at the front desk have been consistently helpful and personable, which I appreciate. Recently, though, Dr. Caroline Feist insinuated to me that I am lazy and just trying to get out of work. OUTRAGEOUS! I came in with an awful case of poison ivy all over both of my hands and arms. I perform strenuous manual labor with my hands every day, so, of course from reading articles and being told by OTHER DOCTORS that bursting blisters and sweating can spread poison ivy, which was my greatest concern. Next time, Dr. Feist, please explain to the patient your professional opinion with compassion and understanding instead of with judgement.

name: Harry Kersten
text: Very courteous and efficient staff. Overall a pleasant experience.

name: Anna Phillips
text: Do not go here. I waited for 2 hours to even be seen and once I got to the back room there were still 3 people ahead of me. I didn’t even get seen by the doctor. Absolutely horrendous, worst experience ever.

name: Anderson Boykin
text: Dr Park and staff are very professional,. Dr Park is an awesome doctor.

name: Halley Granitz
text: I accompanied a friend to American Family Care in Vestavia Hills this morning. He has been suffering from pain in his foot for over two months but could not afford a doctor's appointment. He doesn't have insurance and is working really hard to get back on his feet after a difficult period in his life. The pain finally got so bad that it is shooting up his leg and he is having trouble walking so he decided he had to go. The appointment was a little over $180. The nurses didn't know how to use the computer system. They asked him the same questions and what his name was over and over. One of the nurses smelled so badly of body odor that I could smell her as I was following her down the hall. My friend was gagging while she attempted to take his blood pressure. It took several tries. Finally, we got into a room. The doctor (Caroline Feist) came in and asked what the problem was. She seemed skeptical like she did not believe him. I'm sure she sees many people seeking pain meds and is therefore skeptical, but he never asked for pain pills. He described the problem and how it was affecting his job and how it developed. She touched the area of his foot, lightly, with two fingers (no thorough exam) and sent him to get x-rays. Once the x-rays came back, she told him they didn't show anything and that there were many reasons he could be in pain (she didn't say what any of these reasons were). He asked what he should do: sturdy shoes, orthotics, compression, ice? She said to do whatever he would like to do, wrote him a prescription for anti-inflammatories, and said to go see his primary care physician. He can't afford another doctor visit. Now he has lost a day's wages plus $180 for nothing and will not be able to pay his bills. Dr. Feist demonstrated a lack of empathy and professionalism and strong skepticism throughout the visit. Do not visit this doctor; just set $200 on fire. You'll get the same medical care, you'll get to burn something, and you won't be treated like a piece of crap.

name: Erika McDonald
text: Horrible service.  The tb test I was given was so poorly done it left a bruise, and when I returned they wouldn't even sign the paperwork for my employer verifying the tb test because there wasn't a doctor, only a nurse practitioner. But don't worry, they had me wait in the exam room for an hour before they bothered to tell me they wouldn't sign the needed forms, even though I gave the paperwork to the manager as soon as I arrived.  Don't bother going to this location, go somewhere else and save yourself the added pain of incompetent and unqualified medical care.

name: Christina Workman
text: I was in and out in about 2 hours. My concerns were taken seriously and professionally. Would return.

name: Rehana Perry
text: The staff was professional and caring. My wait time was minimal.

name: Rachal Jones
text:
Dr. Feist was incredible.

I developed symptoms for a mycoplasma infection very quickly on July 3rd. The morning of July 4th, AFC was open and checked me in and out within 50 minutes. During my visit, I explained to Dr. Feist the importance of a quick recovery because I had a very difficult test on Monday (July 6). Dr. Feist was caring, sweet, and very knowledgeable (knowing exactly what questions to ask for the best diagnosis). Within 6 hours, most of my symptoms had diminished greatly. She prescribed exactly what I needed for a VERY quick symptomatic recovery. Thank you, Dr. Feist!

The rest of the staff wasn't anything remarkable, but they performed their jobs with great efficiency, allowing me to leave so I could get home to rest. I'm very thankful for that. It's rare to find a physician that has better personal skills than the rest of the staff.

PS. I never leave reviews, so I hope you can all understand how happy I am with my visit to AFC, specifically with Dr. Feist and her caring nature.

name: JUNAID SHAW
text:
Well, first time when i visit this Homewood Facility, the physician Bolton was very rude and hostile, cannot call that type of person a physician, but the next visit they made it right MS, LISA COLUMBIANA and the supervisor and the staff was nice and took good care of me and the 2nd visit was pretty well. SO I AM GIVING THEM 2 THUMBS UP
SAQIB AHMED
03/30/2015

name: Rachal Jones
text:
Dr. Feist was incredible.

I developed symptoms for a mycoplasma infection very quickly on July 3rd. The morning of July 4th, AFC was open and checked me in and out within 50 minutes. During my visit, I explained to Dr. Feist the importance of a quick recovery because I had a very difficult test on Monday (July 6). Dr. Feist was caring, sweet, and very knowledgeable (knowing exactly what questions to ask for the best diagnosis). Within 6 hours, most of my symptoms had diminished greatly. She prescribed exactly what I needed for a VERY quick symptomatic recovery. Thank you, Dr. Feist!

The rest of the staff wasn't anything remarkable, but they performed their jobs with great efficiency, allowing me to leave so I could get home to rest. I'm very thankful for that. It's rare to find a physician that has better personal skills than the rest of the staff.

PS. I never leave reviews, so I hope you can all understand how happy I am with my visit to AFC, specifically with Dr. Feist and her caring nature.

name: Josey Mac
text: Very helpful friendly and professional thanks for pleasant experience

name: Sarah Fortin
text: Great experience!

name: Warner Ogletree
text: Very slow with seeing patients

name: Heather Byars
text: Excellent doctor, staff, and efficiency.

name: 陈彬彬
text: The doctor’s attitude is very poor and the charges are arbitrary.

name: Caleb Campbell
text: Talk about slow service make you wait for like 2-3 hours.

name: Sally Kibbs
text: Only the nurses are very kind ......

name: Oscar pettway
text: My experience was great and I will go back again for anything I may have problems with in the future.

name: ExpressTowing TANG
text: wrong location.

name: Bill Cox
text:
Received excellent service from the team at AFC Alabaster. Quiana and her teammate at the front desk were excellent in getting me checked in and ready for care. Hannah, a Patient Technician was excellent and painless in specimen collection. Had a quick and informative visit with the PA.

As with any walk in clinic it is luck of the draw as to how busy they are and I hit them a good time. I was very impressed with the courtesy and professionalism of everyone I encountered. Positive experience!

name: Justin Austin
text: Hurt my back at work and wanted to get it looked at. Sign in at 12:30 and they would normally give you a tablet to verify your information/insurance well 2 hours later still hadn't been called up or spoken to anyone. Hadn't had a single person in the waiting room in ayleast 45 min and I finally decided it was best I go some where else

name: Michelle Lucas
text: My daughter went  to this office for ONLY LAB WORK requested by another doctor.  She told receptionist she ONLY needed lab work. Our insurance was charged $136.50 for a Medical office visit for a female NP.....I am assuming a nurse practitioner.   One person came to ask what she needed (she does not know if the person was a nurse practitioner or not) she handed them her lab forms and that was it.  When contacting the office about the charges,  was told this was their policy.   How can they do this?  She should have been told up front they would be charging her insurance a insane amount for just lab work.  On top of that, how can any person...doctor or nurse practitioner feel ok with themselves by allowing that to happen?  You did NOTHING  and you charge someone $136.50 plus cost of the lab work. Very sad!!  So if you need just lab work DO NOT go to American Family Care in Alabaster.  Also, was there an hour and a half just getting this done.

name: Shirley Stewart
text: I visited this location about a month ago. The receptionist Quiana Moore was outstanding. She was polite, thorough and efficient. She made the experience great. I will visit this location again due to the pleasant service at the front desk.

resp.text: Hi Shirley, thank you for posting your positive review. Our team here at American Family Care - Alabaster (205) 605-0495 is committed to providing high-quality customer service, and we’re thrilled to hear that we made a good impression on you. We hope you’ll visit us again soon.

name: Kelly Wilson
text: This place is severely unprofessional. The front desk lady was very rude. I’m unsure of her name, but I went at 5:30ish on Wednesday April 28th. She is the definition of bad patient care. If you hate your job, quit. Do not take your frustrations out on people that are sick or hurt. To AFC, hire better people with actual hearts.

name: Stephen Finch
text: Received great treatment for not having insurance. Paid 175.00 up front was never told of any additional charges that I would be responsible this was back in Sept of 2020 now here March of 2021 I get a bill stating I still owe them 118.00! Infuriating that I was not told there be additional charges before any of the tests they did.

name: Mariah Stewart
text: I had a great experience when I went here. Quiana Moore was working the front desk. She was so sweet and she answered every question that I had. She made my experience very good and I would love to see her for my next appointment.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Katie Riley
text: Came in today to try and get tested for strep. Doctor barley looked at me because i refused to have a covid test done. I know i have strep ive had it a few times. Im not paying $200 for a test i can get for free down the street. I wouldnt have come here if i needed a covid test.

resp.text: We sincerely regret that your experience was less than perfect. We care deeply about our patients and want to provide the most comfortable experience possible. We hope you give us another chance soon, so we can share a more positive experience.

name: thomas sidley
text: On the website they say they can give DOT physicals. After sitting in the office waiting on the doctor for over 2 hours turns out they can not. They can do the urine test but not able to perform an audio gram, Ishihara vision test nor a 20lb lift test.

name: Stephen Martin
text: Quiana was outstanding, as it was my first time going into a health care place by myself, she made everything simple and was very patient with me. As I didn’t know much of what I was doing and kinda nervous, but will be sure to come again first impression are everything to me.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Zombie Slayer
text: Rasheema  was very friendly and super quick experience

name: Carrie Elizabeth
text: I was from out-of-town driving from Tennessee to south Alabama and couldn’t take being sick any longer. I googled this clinic and immediately stopped to be seen. This clinic was so friendly and prompt. They also have a pharmacy on site which I found to be extremely convenient.

name: Frank Barrientes
text: Best care from the check-in to discharge. Nurses were nice and personable and Dr. B has insight, knew what was wrong with my foot/ankle and has great bedside manner. No troubles going to their pharmacy either. Thanks AFC Alabaster.

name: Easy Akins
text: Rasheema did a very good job!

name: Rachel Stuart
text: The doctor at this facility refused to treat me unless I consented to a covid test. I do no have covid. I get sinus infections regularly and I know that is what I have because I get them all the time. The doctor refused to treat me for a sinus infection. I do not have any body aches, chills, nausea, vomiting that would indicate covid. This doctor was irrational and fumbling for her words to justify her actions. I will not be back to this facility.

name: the country millwright
text: They take forever! I’m sick and tired and puked everywhere because of a strep test and now all I need is a shot and I have been waiting for at least a half hour I just wanna go home!

name: Sage Johnson
text:
The quality and speed of service was unmatched. Expect a wait at any healthcare provider’s office. People are just mad because they don’t feel good when they come in (naturally). These people are putting their lives on the line for your life and your family’s lives.
I will always visit AFC because my copay is always low and the people are professional, friendly, and prompt. Thank you AFC for being awesome. ❤️❤️❤️ EDIT: Social distancing is in place! Seating in the lobby was spaced by 6 feet between chairs. Even customers were acknowledging the lines on the ground which is more than we could say for Walmart. They run a tight ship! Seriously!

name: Kaia Leslie
text: Quiana and the entire staff was very helpful and patient with me! I had questions and concerns but they helped me with everything and all in all I had a great experience

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Gina A
text: Unfortunately my visit has lasted almost 3 hours due to my appointment being canceled after I checked in and I am still waiting.    I should have gone to my primary care doctor.  I cannot recommend this location.

name: Martina Allen
text: This place has become a real life joke since all the good doctors have left! I called to get for a refill on insulin and they wanted me to come in, everyone in here coughing and throwing up and I have been sitting here for 2 hours and still have yet to see the doctor and now the pharmacy inside here has closed!!!

name: Elizabeth Gilbert
text: Terrible front desk staff.  They all have bad attitudes.  They basically called me a liar for signing in for a chest xray asking me repeatedly if I was trying to jump the line for a COVID test.  I had COVID 12 days ago and dont need another test, but they still look at you like your a criminal.  Long wait time when they promise prompt service.  I have been to several AFC Locations and I wont be back to this one.  The last time I was here they didnt even do a full assessment, just talked to me from the door because I had COVID.  You cant hear my breathing if you never use a stethoscope.  I'm sure my insurance was billed for provider time I didnt receive.  This location is what is wrong with healthcare.  They employ staff who dont care about doing a good job.  Corporate AFC should come in and restructure this location to be a more productive asset to their infrastructure.  The Montclair AFC is the best! Its across town but you will definitely get much better service.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Joe Noto
text: The absolute slowest and most unprofessional AFC I’ve ever been to. Sat in an exam room for 2 hours 45 minutes before even being acknowledged. Then, after I give them the address to the correct CVS for my prescription, the call it in god knows where. Call them back, they don’t know where they called in! Don’t go here! Take your money elsewhere!

name: Deb
text: Refused to even see my husband. He needed three stitches for a cut on his hand and an xray. Supposedly no doctor on premises, only a nurse practitioner. In reality, it was 45 minutes to closing - most likely the reason. At the ER, he was treated by a nurse practitioner. This is why medical costs go up. NEVER RECOMMEND THIS LOCATION.

name: Cameron Bice
text:
Vanessa (I believe that was her name) was the NP on duty and had a pretty full house to deal with. She was great in her thorough explanation and more importantly, solving the issue.

Her staff was also very friendly and helpful throughout my visit.

name: Brittany Chubb
text: I will never come here again. This place is terrible. They will have signs everywhere asking you to put 5 stars. I didn’t feel like I was fully helped and basically told to see my provider which if I could’ve I would. That was completely pointless.

name: Hart & Sommer McGarry
text: This place is fkg joke!  I waited for and hr and a half while watching person after person that walked in after me be called back!  I finally walked up to the window and asked them if they had forgotten me.  They said, “oh, I’m so sorry we didn’t get a copy of ur DL or insurance card.” I specifically asked the girl when i signed in if they needed anything other than my name and she said, “no, ur good.”  Well obviously NOT GOOD!  Now I’ve been here officially 3 hrs for a simple COVID test!  DO NOT EVER COME HERE IF U VALUE YOUR HEALTH!!!!

name: Barbara Nichols
text: Stay away! If you can find another Healthcare provider do it. Nurse Pratictioner comes in for less than a minute orders all kinds of labs and x-rays that are unnecessary to milk your insurance. You will end up going to a real dr anyway so save yourself time and money by going to a professional.

name: Eric Lind
text: Place is ungodly slow. They have signs up begging people to leave them a favorable review to do damage control on the fact they can’t run a health clinic with any sense of urgency

name: Solomon Sims
text: Great service. The young ladies up front were very nice. Dr. Thomas saw me quickly and was very friendly. Aisha, the young lady in the lab was extremely good at her job and helpful. Would definitely visit again!

resp.text: Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out!

name: Justkeep Swimming
text: always friendly and helpful, usually really quick, I'm surprised by all the negative comments, can always get in and out with everything needed during lunch hour

name: Donna Headley
text: Hardly anyone there.  I was seen quickly, but the CNP said she would get blood drawn and a urinalysis.   45 minutes later a nurse came in and administered two injections, said I was finished.   No blood work,  no urinalysis.  The visit was ok, just not sure if that was necessary.   ???

name: Michael Hawkins
text: Terrible service. Went it for a physical and they said it wasn't covered under my insurance (which it was) without even running the insurance. Said that I could pay for it out of pocket or leave. I left.

name: Robert Miller
text: 3.5 hours for a diagnosis of not flu with antibiotics and cough syrup.  They now have my credit card on file and I had to sign multiple release forms for releasing my personal health information to just about anyone they want to give it to.  Also, a blanket waiver to pay anything they decide to charge me... maybe I should just took my chances with the head cold getting better on it own?

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (205) 605-0495 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: Robby
text: My medication prescriptions ran out so pharmacist calls AFC. They will not renew my cholesterol and BP mess unless I come in and pay my $50 copay just to get my prescriptions renewed. I'm not sick and my blood pressure still is same when I run out of medicine. I don't want to get around sick people during this pandemic. It is a medical scam to get money just to renew medicine  i need...Ridiculous. Wish I could give negative stars

name: Meghan Hurst
text: Wait time was 3 hrs to get a covid test. Don't really understand that since its just swab and run through the machine.

name: Jesse riding
text: Don't take your kids here. They called DHR on us because our daughter said "my daddy throws me in the pool". They'll be lucky if we don't call a lawyer on them.

name: R P
text: I have been waiting on test results for over a week!! The staff and doctor assured me results would be back with 3 days. It has been 9 days and no answer. They will not answer the phones and if they do you will be on hold over 30 minutes. The physician examined me with out a mask on. How negligent is that!!!  Feeling very irritated:(

name: skylar haynie
text: Rude Staff, Never keep paperwork on file, not proper social distancing measures taken place with seating. Highly recommend somewhere else!

name: Amber Phurrough
text: Thank you Krista for your kindness and compassion! AFC has always been very good to me and taken very good care of me. I would recommend them highly to anyone!

name: Leon
text: Horrible service!!!! If I could put 0 stars I would. It’s literally not filled with any patients and is just taking forever. Front desk looked at me so weird as if she didn’t want me there. Came to do a COVID test and it’s been 2 hours!!!! Worst place to come

name: John giancola
text: I called ahead to try and get an idea of how long a wait or how many people where there and the refused to say. All they would say was that they were steady. So I drove 30 mins to get there just to find out that the parking lot is full of cars and would end up being a couple hour wait. So that being said I won’t be going to that AFC again. Maybe a little better communication would help.

text: This always been a great clinic for me to come. My primary doctor is John Watkins for years. Since he moved to the Alabaster location, I always go to him. I had a talk about this issue with the young front desk lady, I don’t know if anyone take it personal or not. I have to wait more than an hour, while 3 people came after me are already call in. I asked the front desk lady, she said the physical is preparing for my 5 minutes vaccination. I knew the vaccination doesn’t have to “pre-cook” before use! Thank you American Family Care for doing great job. It would be perfect if the front desk put more attention on the patients. Thanks

name: Shaye Billingsley
text: This place deserves ZERO stars! Was in Sunday. Had a strep test and covid test done. Covid was a sendout and was told it would be 24-48 hours. Strep was positive. It is Wed and still no results and everyone we have dealt with is EXTREMELY RUDE! Antibiotics have not helped my throat and we are here again in attempt to get a rapid test.  So we have been sitting here for hours waiting on JUST A TEST.  Dont even need to see a doctor. When we asked how much longer it would be they were rude again and asked if we wanted to see the manage . We said yes we do only to be told that she isnt here! Convenient! NEVER EVER EVER waste your time at AFC in Alabaster!

name: Nick Mottola
text: Litterly wasted my time. Took 40 minutes for a 5 minute test. Worst place.

name: Teddy Peller
text:
I used to rate this site 5stars.  AFC  now has a policy in place that allows all their customers to be set up for credit card fraud ..

They want a credit card on file so that They can charge you for what the insurance does not pay.

They are requiring You to provide them a credit card that they can keep electronically onfile. With a third party.   An to protect AFC,  they are also requiring you to sign a paper stating that you are requesting an authorizing them to do this.

When I asked who would be responsible if the computer system of AFC or the Third party they are using to store the info gets hacked.  I get blank faces.

Because why would they be responsible if I an authorizing and requesting that they do so and I was told if I did not sign I could not see a doctor.    Somehow this just seems like fraud or setting everyone up for fraud

The paperwork was supposed to be faxed in August.  Come October it still hadn't been faxed.  I called in again it still didn't get faxed. So i go to explain how my insurance company is charging me and the paper hasn't been faxed and they think it's funny. They were the most rudest individuals I have ever seen at this location!! Does anyone know how I can get intouch with corporate?

name: Jacob Good
text: I saw Dr. Cantley on a Wednesday for what I believed was a bad sinus infection. I got prescribed 4 medications which one was a over the counter the pharmacist pulled for me that was super expensive, which I could have gotten myself without a doctor bill, anyways Friday I got worse than I had been Wednesday all of a sudden. I got sent home from nursing school clinicals and I called the office to speak with a nurse about what other prescription I could try because the provider told me to not take anything else with this medication. The receptionist told me they would call me when they didnt have a patients. I recieved no call, I called Saturday again, no call back, I called Sunday, no call back. Monday I called at 658pm and they told me because the doctor wasn't there it was nothing they could tell me. Couldnt even recommend me another medication. I cant see my primary care doctor until Thursday due to being booked and ive maxed out on Afrin. As a nursing student I know the importance of rebound blocks and max dosages. I will never ever use this AFC or recommend to anyone! I never knew a doctor office could see patients and not return calls within 24-48 hours for their patients questions or concerns regarding treatment of care that they just recieved

name: Tim Bryant
text:
Went in yesterday and after waiting almost two
Hours was diagnosed with a sinus infection. Later in the evening I was running a fever of 102 and called to find out if my test might have been wrong. Was told to call back in the morning if I still had a fever. I woke up and had a fever of 102.8 and called at 8:10 and was told I would have to leave a message for the nurse. I never heard back and ended up going to another doctor who diagnosed strep. I would highly recommend going anywhere but here. Save your money and go to medhelp. All the care about is taking your money not helping or getting to the bottom of any issue. When calling about problems they don’t care and act as if you are bothering them

Update: nurse finally returned my call 25 hours later and all they can is say sorry. I don’t know what happened.

resp.text: Hi Tim Bryant, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit.  We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Elizabeth Mccrea
text:
My husband cut his hand and needed stitches. Our insurance encourages us to use urgent care instead of the emergency room. We go in and the reception area has three ladies in it, who informed us they don’t do stitches.
What is up with that?

name: Angela Carter
text: My son went in the day before Mother’s Day in the afternoon before 5pm. He was taken to the exam room, had his throat swabbed after seeing the physician, sat for 15 minutes, then was told he could leave because they closing early. Didn’t tell him what was wrong or not wrong, not given any prescriptions, or injections or anything. No treatment at all! It seems the physicians and staff do not communicate since an MA can tell a patient to leave without knowing whether or not they’ve been treated!

resp.text: We appreciate all reviews, and appreciate you giving us the chance to improve by providing us with this feedback. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we can improve. We hope you will consider us again in the future. Take care.
