name: austin rob
text: Have a fever been in the waiting room for 20 minutes no one has even checked up on the front desk

name: Kristin Moorhead
text: I visited this clinic yesterday for the first time.  The registration was easy and I was seen quickly. The staff was friendly which is uncommon in urgent cares in my experience. The lab employee was so helpful, nice, and friendly. She made the visit pleasurable. Dr Pita saw me and he was helpful and efficient. I will definitely use this clinic again when my PCP is closed. Great experience.

name: Ashraf Hijaz
text: Great customer service and very professional through the COVID-19 Pandemic. Saftey is ensured through social distance and sanitation.

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Deborah Griffiths
text:
Thank you for the excellent, compassionate service. The office was very clean and organized. The staff was welcoming and professional.
I would highly recommend this facility being a healthcare worker myself.

name: joey shelby
text: Awesome experience, loved the staff! super clean facility! friendly staff

name: Royal Legacy
text:
I want to give a huge THANKS for getting my daughter and I in and out as swift as possible. From the time we checked in to when we left the courtesy and respect the manager and staff displayed was beyond my expectations. I will most definitely be recommending all of my family, friends,and etc. Thank you so much AFC Eastchase!!

The way that this facility is ran is impeccable. Management is doing an outstanding job!!

resp.text: We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. It's experiences like yours that really keep us motivated! If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help

name: Dreew Ci
text:
I normally write newspaper articles and blogs but my experience at this facility warranted a review.

I visited urgent care where I had an absolutely horrendous and definitely terrifying experience with Dr. Kidd. Not only was she extremely rude and dismissive, she offered no assistance or suggestion on my positive COVID-19 results. This “Dr.” literally yelled and spoke to me in a very condescending manner without having any general knowledge on my file, only my appearance. Not only did she walk out the room without notice but also seemingly threw my results paper at me.

I spoke with Jamila, who sincerely apologized. She also said that she would inform her manager, which I have not heard from since visiting.

name: Jabe Fincher
text: Great service. Handy location and wonderful and professional staff.

name: Rosy Nguyen
text: I encountered an unprofessional and dismissive front desk staff who sat on the right side. I came after received a call from a nurse to pick up results. She did not look thoroughly and said results were not available. She gave a business card to call back. When I called, she was the one who picked up and hung up on me. Unable to connect with someone for assistance, I set up the online portal and finally found the results online. The review is a suggestion of staff training.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: olivia hawthorne
text:
My daughter encountered very poor medical treatment  at this urgent care today.  A negative covid test alone, does not mean that patient’s are not sick. You are the health care provider and should know what diagnostic testing is needed based on symptoms,  but I guess you would not know what a patient’s chief complaints are if you are not gathering your clinical data. The female physician was not very professional at all. She did not seem very interested in finding out what was causing my daughter’s medical complaints.
I work in the health care profession also and I understand that we are all stressed to our limits but it still does not change the fact that our main focus is the patient!!
First and last visit!!

resp.text:
We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at AFC PriMed -  Eastchase (334) 323-1330
to speak to our manager directly.

name: Destina1
text: My visit at this facility exceeded my expectations. I cannot believe the level of care that I received today. The staff was friendly, professional and attentive. Therefore, I will definitely use this facility in the future and refer others as well. NP McQueen and nurse Kaitlynn were especially helpful and I’m so thankful for them.

name: Roneika Martin
text: DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE!!!! The customer service is horrible! The doctor is very rude! If you ask questions, they treat you like you are a bother! If you are looking for a facility with bedside manner, this is not the place! You walk in feeling bad & you will walk out feeling worst!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. Please reach out to AFC PriMed - Eastchase  (334) 323-1330 so we can rectify this issue.

name: Cheryl Sludge
text: I had a great time at AFC Thank you Dr.Dixiie and staff for your outstanding services.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Jacquelyn Farasat
text: The doctor and staff were all wonderfully caring and understanding of my young daughter. We received prompt, professional, and compassionate service. AFC PriMed also followed up to check on her the next day. Couldn't have asked for a better experience! Thank you!

name: Pamela Moore
text: I received Great care yesterday.

name: Bill Robinson
text: Rilla, the nursing student and the Nurse Practioner (can't remember her name) were friendly,  very professional and compassionate

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Libby Fitzatrick
text: After a 1 hour and 45 min wait to get in the building (with an appointment), the doctor spent less than 60 seconds with us.  Dr. Kidd behaved as if we had wasted HER time because my daughter tested negative for covid.  I did not make an appointment for covid testing, but that is all they did, no solutions to the symptoms that brought us there.  The doctor literally told us to "come back if symptoms worsen" then turned her back and walked out.  The nurse who took vitals was extremely rude as well and asked my daughter, "What's wrong with you?" (in an annoyed tone) because she was tearful that someone had just stuck a stick up to her brain!  I use AFC in Montgomery all the time, but never again at this location.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Melanie Haynes
text: We had a very pleasant experience. The receptionist, nurse and doctor were all very nice and helpful.

name: Daniel Schrader
text:
Terrible service. I made an appointment for a covid test, and got there on time. They gave me 5 papers to fill out and said "wait in your car for a phonecall." After almost an hour, I go back in to ask what's going on, only to find out that the papers are for a doctor's visit and there's 10 people ahead of me.
Only then was I told I can skip the doctor and pay $150 to take the test. So I do, and get told to drive to the back to get swabbed. The lady at the back says it'll be 15 minutes, and I could stay where I was. Less than 10 minutes later, I get told off by someone else saying I can't park there and need to move.
So, I park in a nearby spot where I can see the door and wait. After 15 more minutes, I go back in to ask for my results, and get told there's someone at the back.

All in all, I was there nearly 2 HOURS for a test that should be 15 minutes, and I spent the whole time being told conflicting info. Never once did I get a call, and things only moved when I called or went inside to ask directly.
Never been here before, and never going here again.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Jakia Jones
text:
Whenever I visit this location I always receive the absolute best care! I've even called in just to see if Nurse Practitioner Bargainer is working. She's very knowledgeable and it's apparent that she enjoys what she does! She always makes me feel very comfortable and ensures that I leave satisfied. Kendra was also very nice as always. She's personable and always asks about my daughter who she's only met once, but to remember her is something that shows me that she is genuine about her connections with her patients. Brad was very nice as well! He walked me through the X-ray process and ensured that I was confident and comfortable with the information I received! My overall experience was great! Better than any location I've ever visited!
-Jakia😊

resp.text: Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out!

name: Del Chick
text: Great experience, I’ve always liked them! The staff is very friendly and the CRNP is very knowledgeable. They made me feel comfortable especially during COVID-19. I really appreciate them being there for me.  Thank you to Felicia and Denise ever so much!

name: Emily Jemison
text: Such a nice, clean facility! The staff there is wonderful! I loved the NP, Sharon Barganier! She was so sweet and very knowledgeable. Brad was excellent as well. I have a fear of needles, and when it was recommended that I get 2 injections I got pretty nervous. But he was super patient and really calmed my nerves!

resp.text: We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. Its experiences like yours that really keep us motivated! If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help.

text: This facility is horrible when you schedule an appointment you will end up waiting over a hour I advised you to find some place else for your medical needs

name: Rachel Paulk
text:
I went in on a Saturday afternoon with an infection in my left eye.  They were supposed to send a prescription for antibiotic eye drops to a local pharmacy.  I drove over to the pharmacy and it had not been sent yet.

On Sunday morning, the prescription had STILL NOT BEEN SENT!  I feel like I wasted my time and money going to this PriMed facility!

Checked on my prescription again after church, STILL NOT SENT to pharmacy yet!  This is ridiculous!

I must say that their staff have a true passion for their work.

name: LATONYA LOVE
text: The staff was amazing! The care they gave was top-notch. This place has the best nurses and Practitioners ever! If you’re looking for the best care for your loved ones, you can count on them! Really not going over board, but for a 12 year old to come back in the room speaking great things about them says a lot and she’s very scary!

name: Shakeria M
text: I went to them because it was closer than my original doctor and they were very nice. They kept me aware of the time I would be seen and I didn’t have to wait long at all. I would recommend going here if you can’t get to your own doctor!

name: Dare Watson
text: I don't usually review places, but this has been on my mind since I got home yesterday. I went into this AFC because I have been feeling ill with sinus pressure and body aches. Everything was quick and easy at first, I got signed in, filled out my paperwork, paid my copay, and in less than 10 minutes, I was in the back getting my vitals done and such. The nurse was very nice and thorough. Then I met the doctor. I didn't catch his name, as he didn't introduce himself. Rather, he walked into the door and commented that I had gained 15 pounds since my last visit. (Keep in mind, I'm here for my cold symptoms) He asked if I was okay with this. (I'm not even remotely overweight or unhealthy) Then he comments on my acne and asks what I'm doing about it. I have hormonal acne and it will flare up when I'm sick or for other reasons. These two things had absolutely nothing to do with why I was here and it left me feeling embarrassed and ashamed. My primary care doctor is who I would talk to about those things, not an Urgent Care doctor. I would understand if it had anything to do with why I was there, but it had nothing to do with it. I will never be back to this location because I would rather not be made to feel embarrassed and humiliated, especially when I already don't feel well physically.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (334) 323-1330 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: Maya Spire
text: The receptionist Katlyinn in the front , has a horrible attitude. She barely lets you get a word out.

name: Donnie Love
text: The staff was great I walked in at 545 close to closing time and I never felt rushed. I am also from out of State, so I was please with the service. 100%. I was treated and today I am feeling much better. Thank you so much you staff was amazing!!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: B Eut
text: I've been going to this place for years and I'm normally very satisfied. I went twice in January 2020. My mom went once. We were both exhibiting flu like symptoms. They never swabbed us even tho we asked them to. Even said, "No, you dont have the flu. It's an upper  respiratory infection. We later found out they tell EVERYONE this same thing. "Needless to say,  we went to Urgent Care.......Me, my mom, and my 4 yr old daughter have the flu. This is something we attempted to catch early on. However, they were so quick to rush us out and misdiagnose us, until the flu was pretty much in rare form by the time we actually were treated for it . I never want to visit this place again.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (334) 323-1330 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: Wyldchilde79
text:
The staff at the berry hill are amazing. They were all smiling and my doc even came into the room singing. They really brightened up my pain filled stay. Also props to Nick for his friendly nature and his enthusiasm and patience when explaining x-ray technics to his coworker. Also props to that same coworker. She was my nurse and did an amazing job. I am so sorry I can't remember her name because she was the first person I saw and 5he first person who made my day better.

You guys have a great team!!

text:

Nurse Cindy was more than nice and explained things so well and told me what each of the shots was for in detail and even the meds that were being prescribed for me to pick up that day. Cindy was so bubbly and happy and made my visit very nice and even made sure I had a note for work to take with me.
I would recommend AFC in eastchase to everyone and make sure you say hi to nurse Cindy.

name: Kara Lynn Moncrief
text:
My experience with Paul Jordan, just hours ago, was horrific.

From saying “wow you smell so good” .. to proceeding to ask, what the exact fragrance I was wearing was.. and constantly attempting to “rub” my right arm and right leg and back was just the the start.

Shea (unsure of her position there as she was not wearing a name badge) was disturbingly rude; lacked OVERALL common sense, especially when needing to aid the WONDERFUL receptionist at the end of my visit, to simply print my paperwork.
She also compared my diagnosis of a viral infection to “AIDS” ..  in-which I kindly suggested that she NOT use that comparison to any other patients moving forward-

I left extremely bothered, disrespected, violated, forgotten about, ALL while feeling even more sickly
with no solution to my illness.
Again, I am beyond discouraged as I trusted my health to be taken seriously.

Being asthmatic, dealing with PAUL JORDAN (whom only practices medicine IN-OFFICE ONCE A WEEK (Friday’s) & SHEA.....apparently closing up that clinic shortly after 6PM was more important than completing the submittal of e-processing my inhaler. [My pharmacist was VERY TROUBLED by this]

I strongly urge others to NOT seek medical attention of Paul Jordan.

This is not a Google rant review as I will be reporting this to the appropriate boards-

name: Amy Dowling
text:
I went in today, as I was assigned this location and a specific provider, Dr. Kidd, by my insurance as my new PCP. Needless to say, I will be asking for a new PCP. Although I did come in for a complaint, which she did not even explore— only listened to my heart and offered me a “shot or pills”— but knowing she was suppose to be my new PCP, she didn’t even inquire about past medical history. She asked me nothing about my problem, nor did she even access any body part that had to do with my complaint.

I’m a nurse practitioner, which I NEVER tell other practitioners when I’m a patient. I was absolutely appalled at not only her lack of professionalism, but also her actual medical practice. This is a great way for something very serious to be missed. Save yourself time and money and go somewhere else. The clinic was also unclean in the rooms. The lobby was nice, but the exam rooms were not.

name: UnbiasedReport
text:
Great staff. Great nurse practitioner , very caring. This was one of my better visits coming here yesterday. Dr. Pita was very kind and was not rushing. He was gentle. He did let me know I have a virus and that taking the ejection was not going to do anything. He did give me some antibiotics. The place was clean, staff was friendly. I didn't feel brushed off or that someone was just telling me what they think. They did take the samples and made it efficient . I also liked the follow-up call. Thanks.

My most recent visit lead to an awkward interaction. The receptionist placed my cards on the counter whereas I handed them to her in her hand. I politely told her I wanted my cards in my hand and thanked her. She may have understood. That didn't  show. I'm changing my review to reflect the experience.

resp.text: It's experiences like yours that really keep us motivated! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! Thank you so much for the positive review!

Shajunda Brown

Thank you Ms. Kadeyia for trying to help me to the best of your ability and keeping your spirts high and personable for the entire visit. To Dr.Kidd, you should do a personality check because the way you treat clients AND your coworkers are unacceptable. If I only had to deal with the nurse on my visit I would’ve had a 5 star visit. It’s such a shame when people with horrible personality work in place where it is so demanding.

My problem was solved.  If I ever have another medical emergency, this place will definitely be my first choice.  The entire staff are some of the nicest people that I have ever met in my entire life.  The world could use more people like this staff.

name: Brandon Richardson
text: Went last week for a dot physical. I arrived at 11:45 am and didn’t leave until a little after 5. The dot doctor seem unfit in my opinion. She wanted a full squat with feet together. Which is very strange since that’s about almost impossible. A normal squat was needed for my last 2 exams.  Staff seem confused on what forum to use. The staff was very nice and helpful tho. In general I try to avoid afc due to previous issues.

text: I am pregnant, and I've been having coughing fits. I was told to go somewhere like AFC by my O.B. office a couple of months ago when I had the flu. Right off the bat the doctor was rude. The doctor told me that I likely have walking pneumonia, but said she doesn't treat pregnant women. That would have been nice to know 2 hours ago before you took my insurance money. She told me I need a prescription of antibiotics, but she refused to write one for me. 🙄

name: Nikitta Forbes
text: DO NOT go here. They are misleading and will misdiagnose you. PLEASE DO NOT COME HERE. Went in for a DOT physical only to find out a health condition prevents me from getting my CDL. The doctor knew of this condition prior to the physical (I overheard her discussing my case with someone outside of my room) but did not disclose this info until AFTER she'd given the physical. During the physical, she rushed through it...she didn't even introduce herself. She hopped on this chance to take advantage as she gave the WORSE and rushed physical.  DO NOT SEE DR. DIXIE KIDD

text: AFC is my 1st choice for urgent care. They are quick to help, comforting, and friendly. They've taken care of me and my children with top-notch precision and even called back to make sure we're ok. Thanks friends!

name: Mason Chandler
text: This is the most incompetent medical clinic I have ever visited.  I went to them during the summer of 2015 for allergy injections.  Each time, it took an hour after I was in the examination room to receive my allergy injection, which is something a nurse performs, not a doctor.  The staff was constantly changing, so they always had to verify what amount to inject and had to call the clinic in Birmingham that makes the serum as no one could find the written record from the previous visits.  My last visit with them was in September of 2015.  A year later, I received a call from a collection agency saying I owe them money.  No letter came in the mail to me letting me know I owed them money because they put a different address into their system than where I lived.  I wrote on the check-in sheet on the very first visit where I lived.  They mailed statement letters to an incorrect address and never made a phone call in an attempt to receive payment from me.  When I called them about this, they could not explain why my address was incorrectly put into the system and said it was not their policy to make phone calls.  I would never recommend this clinic to anyone, and, in fact, would recommend finding anywhere else to go for medical care.

text: Everything was going good till I was put in a room four 3 hours. I never saw a Dr. That day. Just wish someone would have keep me updated.

name: Donna Lovelette
text: Went in because of coughing,sneezing, low grade fever, slimy white mucus. Vitals taken at 1:17, went to exam room 6. Within minutes tech came in to do flu & strep swabs. He informed me the test would take about 17 minutes. After sitting a long time, dr came in asked what my symptoms were. Told him. He then looked in ears, nose, throat, listened to lungs. Said I have a viral infection, then asked if I had swab test done. Said yes. He left to check results, came back said they were fine. If I wanted him to prescribe medicine for cold, otherwise over the counter medicine would work. He left room. Tech came back in with a script for Alahist, information on upper respiratory illness with wheezing, walked me to check out. I checked out at 3:15. 2 hours!!! For a 17 minute test, 5 minutes with doctor. Terrible since my husband was sitting in lobby and saw people come in & leave before I came out. The script was useless since pharmacies don't carry that medicine. It would have to be ordered, available on Monday! Pharmacist said to get 3 over the counter medicines that contain what Alahist has in it and take that. Problem is they all have different duration times. Spent night up coughing, no rest. Today I'm still coughing, low grade fever, sore throat, green mucus now. Ribs hurt from the deep coughing, added Tylenol for fever also. 1:45 minutes of being ignored. I will not go back to this facility, nor recommend it to anyone!

name: CORINE JUNE
text: My experience with AFC was totally awesome, front assistance was helpful and professional, I give front office a 10.  My nurse was very knowledgeable, helpful and professional, I give him a 10.  The physician was awesome, he explained eveything to me and was very caring. I give the physician a 10.  AFC was great and I would recommend to others.

name: Michael Maddox
text: Great, friendly, and very hospitable to their patients. Fast service is always key which they have mastered. Great doctors and staff.

name: Riley J Szabo
text: I hadn't intended on posting a review,  but upon receiving a phone call asking me to change my review about their clinic because "it does not reflect them and their service", I feel it is necessary. If you're sick, don't bother going here. I went in at about 11:00 and I was the only patient in the lobby. I signed in and paid my $20 copay the woman at the desk insisted I had to pay, even though my insurance card (which I handed her to look at) says "copay $0"). I am brought back pretty quickly by a nurse who takes my vitals and I have a low grade fever. I get seated and the doctor comes in decently quick, but she is cold and seems to be standoffish. I tell her my symptoms and she looks at my ears, throat, and listens to my breathing. She quickly orders the flu test and walks out. The nurse student says that the test will take about 15 minutes and she swabs my nose. I wait for a total of 48 minutes until some other nurse walks in, hands me a paper that says Influenza Type A on it and tells me to read it. She then walks right back out without seeing if I had questions (which I did!). While I waited, I could hear the nurses and doctors sitting there talking about their lunch plans and weekend plans, not doing their jobs. Also, after about 20 minutes of sitting in the room, I hear the nurses start talking about how my flu test was positive, and they were being super loud about it. That is a HIPPA violation! I then wait another 15 minutes for the student nurse to walk back in and give me my perscriptions and school excuse. Not once did anyone bother to come in and tell me I had the flu and bronchitis or to see if I had any questions. On top of it all, I heard the doctors outside my door arguing about whether or not I could continue to take the Tamiflu with my iron pills, and they still never told me if I should or should not take the Tamiflu and my iron pills. These doctors couldn't even tell me if my medications would conflict or react with the perscriptions they gave me! Overall, my experience was unprofessional, excessively long, and completely rubbish. I will NEVER go back here, and neither should you.

name: Quanda Williams
text: Great staff and didn't keep me waiting longMy provider and the staff were all wonderful.nice,friendly and took care of my needs in a timely manner I would definitely recommend you all to my family and friends

name: Bessie Lucas
text:
I arrived at the east Chase afc on 10/22 for a blood pressure check,  it was very elevated.  The MA was very concerned that i be seen. I spoke to Tiffany Humphrey for a few minute and then signed in. I was having a medication reaction to coreg. Dr. Robinson evaluated me and stop the coreg. Prescribed me losartan. My bp has gone down out of the danger zone. Afc east Chase is great. Thanks staff and
provider.

text: Truly recommend this location. The wait time is always minimal. Everyone here was very professional and EXCELLENT bedside manners. Thalia Turniseed is the manager and is doing an oustanding job.

text: Great place. In and out with in a hour.

name: Susan Goldthwaite
text: LESS THAN 2 MINUTES WITH THE DOCTOR AND THE WRONG DIAGNOSIS:  I went to AF before closing on a Sunday evening due to a horrible sore throat.  I was quickly taken back as very few people were there.  Once in the back I was swabbed for strep.  When the doctor came, he stated I did not have strep.  He Check my ears, nose, and lungs and told me I had drainage that was making my throat hurt.  He never looked in my throat.  He gave me a steroid shot and a week of amoxicillin. Over the next days I got worse.  After visiting another doctor, it was determined  that I had a bacteria in my esophagus and needed to be treated with a different class of an antibiotic.  Here is my review:  after a $50 co-pay, the doctor spent less than 2 minutes with me, doing a very poor job of considering all the possibilities for my sore throats and just treating me like I had a sinus problem.  He never looked at the back of my throat to see that it was not inflamed and the problem with further down in my esophagus.  I will never go back.  If you choose to use AFC, be sure you get the doctor attention to look at all possibilities as to the cause of your illness.  The doctor is working for you.

name: Ali Sami
text: The worst one ever. Don’t go there. They are damn slow and unprofessional

text: I have been there 4x in the last 2yrs and the front desk staff and nurses are welcoming.

It seemed like nobody manning the desk knew anything and their phone ediquette was lacking as well. Once I’m done with this workman’s comp claim I will never go back.

text: Not a good place to take a toddler. Worst experience ever. I left out and the middle of the service I was receiving crying do to the way Dr. DAVID WILLIAMS handle my daughter. I will be reporting him. No child should never have to ever go through that type of treatment.

text: Terrible! I will never return again. 4 hours to get assistance. It took the receptionist 30 minutes to enter my data on the computer. One of the techs, a tall young man, literally stunk. During my discharge he said he couldn’t remember all the instructions. The lab tech was in training with the xray tech. When I asked the xray tech about her qualitfications for helping the lab tech draw my blood without success, she replied: We are all trained to do all the jobs. The Practicioner precribed 6 different meds in one visit, two days later the MD changed all the drugs. Very confused professionals, not a team to take care of the patient. Professionals seen, lab tech, medical assist, techs, techs, 1 LPN, 1MD one visit. A whole bunch of office assistants just roaming around.

name: MIguel Fabricio
text: Terrible! I will never return again. 4 hours to get assistance. It took the receptionist 30 minutes to enter my data on the computer. One of the techs, a tall young man, literally stunk. During my discharge he said he couldn’t remember all the instructions. The lab tech was in training with the xray tech. When I asked the xray tech about her qualitfications for helping the lab tech draw my blood without success, she replied: We are all trained to do all the jobs. The Practicioner precribed 6 different meds in one visit, two days later the MD changed all the drugs. Very confused professionals, not a team to take care of the patient. Professionals seen, lab tech, medical assist, techs, techs, 1 LPN, 1MD one visit. A whole bunch of office assistants just roaming around.

name: Priscilla Morgan
text: Enjoyed visit at American Family Care Center Eastchase, broke my finger, was seen quickly, then referred to specialist.  On the way to healing!! Thank you Dr. Williams and staff.

name: Jarvis Frazier
text: The Nurse and Practition we very in tune to my needs.

name: Bill Bozeman
text: What a joke. Not even really a visit to the dr. Looks like I will have to drive back to fl to see a REAL dr. Don't waste your time.

name: MARTY EDDLEMAN
text: Fast, friendly and professional service.

name: Jedidah Milton
text: No wait time and Very good staff.

name: Natalie Orum
text: Everyone I encountered were very professional and friendly.

name: TheRoyalQueen
text: Everthing was great as always!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

name: Sharon Katona
text: Excellent care. Friendly and concerned staff!

name: Bridgett Tucker
text: Great staff, thanks for being so nice

name: Beckie Rhyne
text: 5 stars ,all the way !! My sweet nurse was the,best !!

name: Susan Urbina-Figueroa
text: The staff and physician were all very friendly. I would recommend them.

name: Ayanna Jones
text: It was a great experience!

name: Angela James
text: Wait too long. No doctor on duty.

name: Matt Miller
text: Fast service

name: Brian Lyle
text: In and out in less than an hour!

name: Tamara Bozeman
text: Dr Kidd is awesome!!!

name: Kim Martin
text: Short wait and professional staff.

name: Paula Harris
text: Great service

name: Kandi Nichols
text: Wonderful, knowledgeable staff. Very friendly. Great nurses who make you feel cared for. Most well run walk in clinic I've ever been to. Clean facility. Sometimes they get you back quickly, sometimes not - but hey, you're going to wait way past an hour or three in any other walk in clinic - that's the trade off for just walking in without an appointment. There is only a reasonable wait period here, and they'll take care of your needs. And they're open on Saturdays!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences, Ms. Nichols. We'll make sure our entire staff sees your nice comments.

name: Jay Pearson
text: Fast, Efficient service. As I walked into the building your staff jumped into action (Danielle), foregoing with new patient paperwork. Although I’ve been seen numerous times I was informed there’s a new system being used and I must complete the forms again in which is totally understandable. The front office staff were very professional and attentive all while assisting several others. I waited 15 minutes before being called to the back. The staff in the back had me in and out in approximately 20 mins. Thank you Hallie and Cynthia. I received a work note along with a smile from the front office before my departure. If you need a quick fix without going to the ER Huntsville Walk-in is the place for you. They are even open on the weekends!!!!!

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Pearson. We appreciate the nice five-star review and your kind words. Thank you for choosing our practice to care for you.

name: James G
text: What happened to the walk in clinic.Who do you have working in your front office? She is slow, lost, and talks too fast. I got so angry I left. Treat senior citizens better.  I waited for 45 minutes then she tells me about paperwork I'm 80+ and I am ill please get a better process. One employee checked his mail while several other people waited.  I am beyond disgusted. My wife called to complain and was put on hold. We were faithful patients who are now seeking new care. Thanks for nothing

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear about this. Please consider calling the practice administrator at (256) 265-0770 so we can work to address your concerns. Thank you.

name: Joel Monet
text: Been here a few times in the last year and have always been pleasantly surprised with their cordiality and quick service

resp.text: We appreciate the great review, Mr. Monet. Thank you for your continued trust and support.

name: Collis Sims
text: Walked in and completed the sign in sheet, told the lady at the front desk my son had been here before after he was asked and sat in waiting area. Forty-five minutes later after watching several people complete forms and asked for their insurance information I asked did they need something for my son. It turns out they had completely ignored him and then decided to give him the appropriate forms. Left him sitting in a waiting room with a high fever and bad cough for an hr and a half. We finally left after 2 hours!!! I could understand if they were busy but they were not.

resp.text: We apologize for your wait and would welcome the opportunity to speak with you about this. Please call (256) 265-0770 and ask for the practice administrator. Thank you.

name: Jackson Priest
text:
WITHIN TWO HOURS, THE NURSES HAD ELIMINATED MY MENTAL ANXIETY AND PAIN CAUSED BY AN INFECTIOUS AREA ON MY BACK.  THE PROBLEM WAS QUICKLY DIAGNOSED, AND THE NURSES WERE ABLE TO LANCE AND DRAIN THE INFECTED AREA.  THE PAIN WAS RELIEVED, AND I FELT BETTER IMMEDIATELY, JUST KNOWING THE CAUSE OF THE PAIN AND THAT THE PROBLEM HAD BEEN RESOLVED.   OF COURSE, THIS ALL HAPPENED ON THE WEEKEND, WHEN THERE WAS NO ACCESS TO OUR FAMILY DOCTOR.  FORTUNATELY FOR US, THIS FACILITY IS AVAILABLE ON WEEKENDS.
THANK YOU, THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Walk-In Clinic, Mr. Priest. We're so glad that our team was able to make you feel better and also put your mind at ease. That's our goal for every patient.

name: Dionka S
text:
I went a few weeks ago. Refused treatment. I told the receptionist I was having trouble breathing. Still turned away. I went a couple of times in the past. New to the area. Not established with any doctors. This is unacceptable. I worked in the emergency room for 12 years, never seen them turn a patient away. Especially shortness of breath. Went to another urgent care. Keeping costs down. I was seen immediately.

Poor lack of judgement from this facility. If this is the only hospital in this area, I will drive back to Georgia and go to the ER before I go near another one of there facilities. I believe this urgent care is affiliated with the Huntsville Hospital. A wreck of medical care. Never will I see this hospital again. I would have be on my death bed.

let me suggest the urgent care in Madison off wall Triana in front of holiday inn and next to oreillys. Heather Howard  the NP was great. Really cares. I feel 99 %better. Only took 1 visit versus this other clinic I was back and forth every month. Then they refused to see me.

name: Stacie Felice
text: Had a great experience! Went there for the first time today. Walked in and didn't wait hardly at all! The staff was so nice. I will definitely return and refer. Thanks so much!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Ms. Felice! It's a privilege to serve the people in our community.

name: Greg Martin
text:
Got in fast on Sunday morning , pleasant staff and helped me out. Now I’m on the mend and will be back up and running soon..
Thank you

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Martin. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Walk-In Clinic. We're glad you are feeling better and will pass along your compliments to our clinic team.

name: Johnnie Jude
text: So, I walk in at 5:05pm, and am told that they've taken their last patient because they're so backed up. They don't close until 6pm. Really!!

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear that you did not to get the care you needed. Please consider calling our Practice Administrator so we can learn more about your visit and address your concerns. Our number is (256) 265-0770. Thank you.

name: jamia gibson
text: Waited in the waiting area for TWO hours before I was seen, and an additional HOUR in the room waiting for the doctor. Horrible experience

resp.text: Hello. We are sorry to hear that you had a negative experience. Please call (256) 265-0770 and ask to speak with the Practice Administrator so we can properly address your concerns. Thank you.

name: Justin Wright
text: The staff was friendly and informative, the facility was very clean, and the wait time was reasonable for a walk in. I’ll definitely be back.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star rating, Justin!

name: Brooke Graham
text: I have had good and bad experiences here.  Last fall I had been feeling flu-like - achey, sore throat, coughing.  I went here because I cannot stand the American Family Care walk-ins.  The doctor was nice and told me I had a minor upper respiratory infection and ordered lots of rest and fluids,  but no shot or prescription.  I took 2 days off before returning to work.  2 weeks later, I'm not better and my co-workers suggest to go back or even see another doctor for a second opinion.  I tried to hold off because I rarely go to the doctor, but it began to worse.  I went about 2.5 weeks after my first visit to find out the infection was worse and I now had an ear infection.  So, 2 co-pays and a round of medicine FINALLY.  Not sure why we couldn't have nipped it in the butt the first time.  I hate to complain because the staff and doctors are very friendly.  I imagine I'll be back since I don't go to the doctor frequently on this fact alone and just hope this was a one time thing.

resp.text: Hi Brooke. Thank you for contacting us. We value feedback from our patients and use it to improve our services. We will pass your comments along to Walk-In Clinic leadership. We hope you are feeling better.

name: Jason Jarnagin
text: Fast and thorough!  Great for weekends and after-hour needs.  Staff is very friendly.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and the nice rating, Mr. Jarnagin!

name: Abetta Place
text: Came in for respiratory issues and sore throat. Very happy with the care I received, wait time not too bad, and everyone was very kind and professional. Happy to have found this place.

resp.text: We appreciate your nice comments and hope that you feel better soon!

name: Elise Goff
text: I've been to this clinic maybe 3 times and only once had a long wait (walk in clinics usually have long waits) The other 2 times I went were in and out, including yesterday's visit. The staff have always been friendly and courteous and they know exactly what to prescribe. They also provide tissues and sanitizer and facemask in the waiting room which is just going above and beyond if you ask me. The place is super clean overall. Yesterday when I went in I was at about a 3 on the feeling good scale, had a fever and a miserable cough, could barely speak. In less than a day I'm at least back to an 8. Feels like a minor miracle.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Goff. We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a nice review!  It's wonderful to hear that you were feeling better so quickly. We will be sure to share your compliments with our Walk-In Clinic team.

name: Denis W
text: We came in for the first time with three of our family with the Flu. The staff was great - prompt, curtious and friendly. I was pleasantly surprised. Our wait was not that bad, considering there were a few ahead of us. I don't give 5 stars for anything, but they came close. The only shortcoming was the nasal swab flu test results were inconsistant between us. (Are they ever??) Fortunately, our doc treated us all for the flu based on the positive. We will be back. Hopefully, we won't need to any time soon though!

resp.text:
Hi Denis.
Thank you for taking time to write a review. We are sorry to hear that three family members were sick, but are so glad we were able to help. We hope that your family gets well very soon!

name: Michelle Salehi
text: Awful place and uncaring..... walked in with a screaming 3 year old whose ear started  hurting bad enough to be screaming at the top of her lungs and so I drove to the clinic and they refused to see her because it was 10 minutes before they closed.  There wasn't even anyone in the waiting room.  Then lock the doors and turn your sign to closed.  I can't believe they turned away a screaming toddler.  I will NEVER go back to this place.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Salehi. We shared your comments with the Walk-In Clinic administrator, and we understand that you two have now spoken. We hope she was able to address your concerns.

name: pam chandler
text: Was seen quickly. Cynthia Whitten CRNP was very knowledgeable. Feel I had a thorough exam and appropriate medical treatment. I will certainly return to this faculty and will recommend to others.

resp.text: Hi Pam. We appreciate you taking time to share your experience with us. Thank you for choosing Huntsville Hospital Walk-in Clinic.

name: Katherine Moody
text: Receptionist is literally the nastiest most unprofessional person I have ever met in health care. Go to American family care instead they will take care of you and without the ugly attitude.

resp.text: We use patient feedback to improve our services and appreciate your feedback, Ms. Moody. We are sorry to hear that you had an unpleasant experience.

name: Christy Fuqua
text: I went Monday because my Dr's schedule was full and they advised me that since they were HH that they could pull up my history. The nurse, Lindsey, basically triaged me as I stood in the waiting room. Isn't this a HIPAA violation? She basically told me what all they COULDN'T do for me, ie x-rays would be done somewhere else, they cannot prescribe narcotics. Wow. I guess it was assumed that I was a pill seeker? Then she said "but we can evaluate you, if you'd like." No thanks. I left, and I don't recommend them. I wonder if the poor guy standing outside puking was told the same thing. It was a basic way of saying "we can't treat you."

resp.text: Hello Ms. Goode. We apologize that your encounter with our clinic was unpleasant for you. It's beneficial to have your feedback. We use it to improve our services. If you would like to talk with someone about your visit, a Patient Advocate can be reached at (256) 265-9449. We hope you are feeling better.

name: Marty Traller
text: Third patient to sign in upon them opening at 0800. It is currently 10:00 am and I am still waiting. I think I hear tiny hooves on the roof. I should have packed a lunch.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Traller. We apologize for your wait and will share your comments with our practice administrator.

name: Charles Brinkerhoff
text: Wife waited in lobby 1hr 30 min, put in exam room and waited there for another hour. RIDICULOUS!  Will not come here again.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Brinkerhoff, we are sorry to hear about your wife's wait time and that our walk-in clinic didn't meet up to your expectations. If you would like to speak to our patient advocate, call (256) 265-9431.

name: Amy Williams
text: Very clean! Wait time was quick & staff was very friendly!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Amy. We are happy to hear that you had a great experience.

name: Kevin Quimby
text: Very caring nurses.

resp.text: Thank you, Mr. Quimby!

name: jessica cox
text: Awesome staff!!!

resp.text: We appreciate your kind words and the nice review Jessica!

name: Morgan Fogg
text: Very nice and caring staff.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: Victoria Jackson
text: Always appreciate the staff here ! Since moving back home due to COVID they were able to take care a lot of medical needs for me like vaccines, annual physicals and other stuff! I think I have also found the sweet spot for the prefect time to come with a shorter wait 😁

name: grace bailey
text: I went in today to this clinic very discouraged. the staff was absolutely wonderful and did a great job of getting me in and out of the clinic in a timely manner. Ms. Vee was the lab technician that assisted me in my time there. She was very personable and the sweetest lady. She was an absolute blessing to me today as was the rest of the staff. She could tell I was having a difficult time and made an effort to make me feel better. She even gave me a bag of candy with that sweet note. The doctor was also very reassuring and listened to all my concerns. Overall, I had a wonderful experience and I am very glad I chose that clinic. I will be recommending this clinic to everyone!!

name: Shane Anderson
text: Waited well over an hour despite the office being nearly empty to see the doctor equivalent of Googling and diagnosing yourself. After tapping and flicking my swollen eye I had just told him hurts to touch, the doctor asked for my phone, Googled my symptoms and then showed me what I had, when I asked questions, he pointed to the article and told me read it later, then proceeded to Google image search bad cases and show me pictures. He asked me the standard medical questions, "how long have you had it?", etc about 4 times, seemingly never listening to what I said. I paid $25 for someone to Google for me on my own phone while smacking gum in my face. By far the most unprofessional experience I've had with any doctor. DO NOT SEE Dr. Patrick Bianchi!!!!

name: Mathew Anderson
text: This place is my backup when I can’t do a walk-in at my normal place. I think this will be my first choice now bc of Dr. Gray. She was absolutely fantastic. The nicest doctor I think I’ve ever had. Incredible bedside manner and very knowledgeable.

name: Catherine Gradle
text: Staff were absolutely wonderful! I was informed throughout my appointment by the nurses and provider. Vert well-run/managed. 100% happy with my experience

name: Katherine Holdren
text: I walked in as a new patient without an appointment. The front office staff was very friendly and got me checked in very quickly. I saw Erin Gray and felt like she really listened and asked questions to get to the cause of my symptoms. Their pharmacy had my prescriptions ready to go before I left the facility. Definitely would go here again.

resp.text: Hey Katherine, Thanks for the kind words! It's great to know that we were able to provide you with the highest levels of service. We'll be sure to share your experience with the rest of our team members as inspiration! We look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Michael Wood
text: Either they book more appointments than they can handle or they put walk-ins ahead of appointments. In either case, they’re wrong for doing so. No one should ever have to wait an hour or more after their scheduled appointment time, much less when they arrive 10-15 minutes early and are fully checked in 5-10 minutes before their appointment time, and it is a regular occurrence here. Only go here if you have nothing else going on in life and don’t mind wasting half a day.

name: Matt m
text: The service at the clinic is wonderful. However their billing department has repeatedly sent bills with past due notices months after visits with no prior indication of any money being owed. This is after they tell you that they will automatically charge you. When their billing department is called you will sit on hold for a half hour until a representative answers only to tell you to hold for another half hour.

name: Ryder Smith
text: Don't bother calling up here, you won't get put to anyone. You'll either listen to the phone ring, or be routed between a ton of automated services that offer zero assistance to what you need. Trying to pay a bill currently, don't live anywhere near an AFC anymore, and can get not a soul.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Annie Crenshaw Cullins
text: Dr Erin Gray saved my life. Many thanks.

name: Leslie Hamilton
text: Absolutely love this location. I was extremely ill over the New Years holiday. The staff and providers took excellent care of me!  Even followed up the next day! The wait was minimal. I can’t say enough about the professional and care that I received!!!

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Cindy Miller
text: I wish I could give this office a negative star review. My son, an Auburn student, had been sick for a few days and felt he should see a doctor. (Which means he was really sick) As it was on Sunday the AU clinic was closed so he randomly chose this clinic. The doc told him he had “the crud”and sent him home. No tests, no antibiotics, nothing. Turns out he has strep and mono. If you want competent treatment, I would definitely not trust these people!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. Please reach out to American Family Care - South College so we can rectify this issue.

name: Dan B.
text:
ONLINE KIOSK CHECKIN DOESN'T WORK

I responded to a text 2 days before or my 2nd Covid vaccination and completed the online kiosk checkin. I received a second text 4 hours before my appointment. For the second time online , I reviewed my contact and insurance info, Then I was asked to select a box when I arrived. I did when I arrived 15 minutes early for my appointment. The message in my browser said I would be notified. It indicated I could stay in the parking lot. I went into the waiting room.

After being in the waiting room for 40 minutes, I approached the receptionist and asked why I had not been called. She told me, "That online thing doesn't work. I'll have to copy your ID and insurance info."

SAVE. YOUR SELF TIME AND IGNORE THEIR TEXTS

resp.text: Dan we're very sorry to hear that you're unhappy with your experience. Feedback like yours is what drives us to improve and if you're open to it, we'd like to look into the issues you're experiencing. Please reach us directly at  patientadvocate@americanfamilycare.com and our team will be happy to assist and help resolve these issues.

name: Marion Dukes
text: I have waited in the parking lot for 4 hours for a friends who was a patient to get out. It was incredibly ridiculous. I sat here an hour and a half past closing and watched employees leave. No one answered my calls and no one was inside to help me. This is the most ridiculous experience I have ever had.

name: Haley
text: After having a bad experience at Auburn Urgent Care I decided to come here a few days later, I am so glad I did! The staff was kind, professional, and knowledgeable, the building was very clean, and I wasn't there for more than 15 minutes. I was able to get my TB Skin Test in less than 2 minutes once I was brought to the back, and an added bonus - it didn't hurt at all! The staff's communication skills are unmatched, I will definitely be coming here for all of my work/school medical needs.

name: Marilyn Bradbard
text:
I went for COVID testing today. I went inside and signed up for an appointment time of 2:40 then went to my car to wait for the appointment time. At 2:40 I went inside assuming I would be seen soon. Instead it took more than 2.5 hours to be seen. The waiting room was extremely crowded and no provision was made to allow me to wait in my car and to be called when they were ready. If I didn’t have COVID when I got there, I probably have it now. I probably should have just left but by the time I thought about it I had already invested too much time with the appointment.
It is a ridiculous setup. There should be nobody in the waiting room for longer Han a few minutes. People should be sent to their cars to wait and be called when they are ready to see them. This is a medical facility. They should know better.

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at American Family Care - South College(334) 203-6489 to speak to our manager directly.

name: Life As Duke
text: My family and I visited for COVID testing. We signed a clipboard with our name and number beside a time slot and was called in at our time to be tested. We are heading to Hawaii as we speak. Things were smoother than we though. We read reviews before going and was hesitant but we’re so glad we decided to go ahead and try them out. Great experience.. It’s a PANDEMIC people CALM DOWN!!! 3-5 hours is not bad for a WALK IN CLINIC that sees more than just COVID testing.

resp.text: We’re so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! Thanks again for the recommendation, and have an amazing day!

name: Jon Adams
text: Very disappointed with service. Overcharged for COVID test and getting nowhere when we try and get someone in billing. They are taking advantage of a pandemic, overcharging you, and  making it impossible  to try to get in touch with a human being. Definitely would find somewhere else to go

name: Katelyn Miller
text: Today was my second time visiting this location for COVID testing. The first time I waited 4 hours to be seen and get my results (for a test I was told that takes 15 minutes), but I chalked it up to me being a first time patient and the holiday rush before Thanksgiving. Today I waited 3 hours to be seen for another COVID test despite getting there 15 minutes after opening with roughly 10 people ahead of me in line. During this time I watched the lobby fill up and empty twice, and watched several people show up, be seen, and leave that were also there for the same test as me. I was not given any explanation when I inquired on the hold up. I was willing to overlook this issue once but never again.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Sarah holston
text: I waited for several hours because I’ve been sick, but I knew it wasn’t covid. The staff was very nice, but they never tested me for anything other than covid— no bloodwork or anything after I waited SEVERAL hours. Cut to now, I am sicker than I was before and going to my own doctor. Will not be going back

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. Please reach out to American Family Care - South College(334) 203-6489   so we can rectify this issue.

name: Janice Nguyen
text: So they have a system where you have to register and check in for covid test upon walking in. I’ve done that and gave them my insurance card and phone number because there is a waiting list. They say that it’s takes about an hour until they call you. But I’ve been waiting for over an hour and still no call. So I went in to check on that, and I see two people in the front desk struggling to find my insurance card and phone number that was written down! I watched them looking everywhere for it and it was misplaced behind someone else’s card! Then the lady told me that I am behind all the other people that came in after me! So now I have to wait another hour!!!!

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Adrian Steward
text: Came here twice in one week. The first time I got here at 1pm and signed there sheet for 3:40pm. Came back at 3:40 and it took them until after 6pm to actually see me. So, for my second visit I decided to come before they open and be the first person in the list. I walk in at 8am and they ask me to sign the sheet. I sign for 8:40am and sit down. At 10:40am I went to the front desk and asked how much longer it would be and I was responded with “have you checked in”. Apparently I was supposed to check in at 8:40 but was never told that step. Very disappointed with the lack of communication in this facility in such critical medical times.

resp.text: Thank you for providing us with your valuable feedback. We’re disappointed to hear that American Family Care - South College  wasn’t exactly to your liking. We hope you give us another chance soon, so we can share an even more positive experience.

name: Brian Plowcha
text: Friendly staff - very helpful

name: Ashwin Kumar
text:
Why name it "urgent care" if the visit is going to take 2+ hours?

And SUPER RUDE!!

name: Mary Dawson
text:
Don’t bother coming here if you have anything to do the rest of the day. Even with an appointment, I’ve waited over 2 hours to get out of here.

They never see patients on time. When they do take you back, they often leave you in a room by yourself for 30+ minutes, come in and see you for a few minutes, then leave you again for another 30 minutes.

Best part? They don’t give you the opportunity to leave feedback. It’s ridiculous.

name: Xavier Luciano-Torres
text: This has got to be the fastest urgent care I’ve ever been to. Drew blood (and gave me a Gatorade when I almost passed out) and took a urine test and came back to me within 15 minutes. Everyone is really nice too.

name: EthanG
text: I was told i was going to be contacted about my lab results and 2 days later i go in ( because their phones never work or their too lazy to answer) and am still unable to talk about my lab results with a doctor. I was told the receptionist will read it to me which is completely unprofessional. I wouldnt be upset if it wasnt something very important concerning my health.

name: Charis Hampton
text: After my daughter had a HORRIBLE experience at AFC Tiger Town,  I called this location and explained the situation on how to read my insurance card and when my daughter showed up they treated her AWESOME.

name: Ansleigh Banks
text:
I have never been to a more disorganized clinic in my life.  Only rating it this well because of the wonderful reception staff and physician assistant that I saw on the day of my visit.  The lack of covid-19 precautionary measures is alarming.  The waiting room is packed full of people (many coughing) waiting for covid testing (walk-in appointments). There should be some kind of wait in your car if you're there for covid testing available, entry through another door, make an appointment to be tested, etc, to limit the amount of contact between potentially infected patients and people who are there for things like a sprain or a bite wound. On top of that there was no cleaning of seats in the waiting room going on between patients.
They failed to ask for my pharmacy during the triage process, so when they told me I was ready to go, I asked where to pick up my meds as I noticed a pharmacy in the waiting room.  They told me my meds were ready to go at the pharmacy I was asked for in triage.  When I said there was no pharmacy asked for in triage, they asked me for my pharmacy, which then never sent my meds to.  They conveniently closed a few minutes after I left (I was in the waiting room for 2 hours).  When I called the next morning, I was on hold for 45 minutes constantly having my call transferred to the back staff who would never pick up only to be told they were too busy to deal with sending my call to the back again and that I could come to their pharmacy to get the prescriptions.  Which if they had told me that the night before I would have already had 2 doses of much needed medication.
Basically this place is pure chaos.  I understand that things are hard with covid and healthcare workers are stretched thin, but this clinic is likely creating more cases by their poor planning and crowding of those exposed to covid with uninfected people.  It's a shame that this is the only choice that blue cross blue shield members have for urgent care in Auburn.

name: Julia Jackson
text: If you are a student do not come here on a class day!!! You will wait for an insane amount of time (usually over 3 hours). The staff is rude and definitely not worth the 3 hour wait time.

name: LaDonna Moss
text: My daughter visited this facility on 8/23 so sick and they sent her home with ZERO prescriptions.  I called on Tuesday and spoke with Mia and told her she was still VERY congested and she said they would call her in scripts to the local pharmacy.  They never did!!!  My husband called Mia the next day and asked for the doctor to please call her in something for congestion, she’s very sick and was told they would.  Today is August 31st and still NOTHING!  As a parent many states away from my daughter, I’m so worried for her health!  She will NEVER use this urgent care again!  Don’t waste your time and money at this facility 😡

name: Kittichai Kerdsongsang
text: If you just have a headache and fever,  do not come here. You may probably end up paying $470. Thankfully I had an insurance but I still have to pay ~$200. I had a bad experience here. The doctor came to check on me and gave me some Tylenol, but the fever was not going down. They had my blood tested which took more than an hour, but it was negative. so I asked the doctor, there was anything wrong? She said " I don't know!!?? I had to lay down in the room for 2 hours to wait for whatever they were working on. I was so hungry and the headache was getting worse. The doctor came back and gave me more Tylenol. They also gave me 2 injections. Finally they prescribed me the antibiotic pill and some allergy medicine. I don't understand why they gave me so many medications, because I didn't have any allergic. I also had a bad diarrhe when I was taking thoes pills. I used to take an anti biotic pill from Auburn Med clinic but it did not show a bad side effect. Also the doctor an AU med clinic seem more professional. They can identify the symptoms and tell me when I will get better. Unlike this place, charge me ~$120 for office evaluation and told me " I don't know what was wrong!!  They charged so many fee but low performance (took so long). By the way, AU med clinic doesn't charge any lab performance fee if you have an insurance. If they wasn't close that day I would have gone there.

text: I have visited here several times in the past year, but will NEVER be going back again after my experience today. The service was anything but urgent. There was no one in the waiting room and the parking lot was empty. I made another plea to be seen sooner because of my pain and was met with little reaction, even though I couldn't open my eye and was about to cry. Went down the street to Auburn Urgent Care and was in and out, and went to the pharmacy to pick up my prescription all within an hour's time. Not to mention, there were four people ahead of me there, but I waited maybe 10 minutes. Usually don't write reviews, but don't want someone to actually have an emergency and have the same experience as me.

name: James Mowery
text: Fast, efficient, and thorough. Not sure why others have complained so much. I have been to the Auburn facility three times and my son has been there five times with me. In all of those instances the longest we waited was about 30 minutes. Most times the wait is less than 15 minutes. I have seen Dr. Powell and Dr. Hooker. Both were very pleasant and caring. Each took the time to explain what I was going through and the reason for the medicine they prescribed. My son sees Dr. Powell and cannot say enough good about her. I have Medicare and my son has Tricare. In each case the insurance process was fast and efficient. The onsite pharmacy has reasonable co-pays and is also fast and efficient. The pharmacist took the time explain what each medicine was for and wrote notes for me to use in establishing the best times to take the medicine. The receptionists, and the medical staff were pleasant, courteous, and through. I have been in hospitals of four continents and seen by doctors on five. This facility gets a 100 out of a 100 in my assessment.

name: Victoria Sims
text: This is by far the worst urgent care on the planet. I have RA and went in with an extremely swollen knee and ankle and could barely walk. Everything was fine until it came time to pay. When I explain to the woman at the front desk that my father handles all my medical bills and he wouldn't be able to pay until the afternoon because he was at work she turned me away saying I couldn't have any care until I paid. Thanks urgent care👍🏼👍🏼 I guess everyone can see that you only care about the money coming in and not your patients.

resp.text: Greetings, I am the patient advocate with American Family Care. I am truly saddened that you are dissatisfied with American Family Care, as we strive for 100% patient satisfaction. In keeping with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, I cannot post a response that directly addresses the concerns mentioned. I do, however, welcome the opportunity to personally address all patient concerns, and ask that the patient or authorized representative be forwarded this message as it details my contact information. I can be reached directly by telephone at (205) 403-8902 ext. 2269. The patient or authorized representative can also complete a secure patient satisfaction survey at www.americanfamilycare.com. On behalf of American Family Care, I wish you and your family good health now and in the future.

text: I waited for nearly two hours to be seen and told repeatedly that there were four people in front of me.  When the doctor came in to see me finally she stated in less than a minute that I had strep and began to exit.  I told her that if I had strep I would prefer to have the antibiotic and steroid shot to be sure it didn't get out of hand.  The doctor didnt seem to know what I was talking about and then said I would still need to take oral antibiotic as well.  Shortly thereafter a nurse came in and brought in stapled sheets and told me to check out at the front desk.  After getting to the pharmacy and seeing the prescription I told the lady at the pharmacy that it gives me an allergic reaction the doctor told her that she wanted me to take the medicine because of the strep!  I've been breaking out and went back to get the doctor to check the reaction but I couldn't be seen unless I paid another $30 copay for a continuation of the prior visit!  The doctor has not called me back with my multiple attempts.  This is very unprofessional and they've lost my business!  Clean or nice facility doesn't make up for crappy service!

text: Two family members sent to the ER for what the dr thought was pneumonia. No chest X-ray, O2 sats, or temp was even taken.  It was a cold/sinus infection and asthma that wasn't acute. I can see sending the asthma to the ER--but it wasn't severe enough to warrant an immediate Nebulizer treatment at the clinic. When asked if I needed to rush, I was told no, she's been sick for days already. All we needed was prescriptions--nothing was emergent. Over $200 later, turns out it could have easily been taken care of at the clinic. They were kind enough to refund the co-pay since they weren't treated. Never again.

resp.text: Greetings, I am the patient advocate with American Family Care. I am truly saddened that you are dissatisfied with American Family Care, as we strive for 100% patient satisfaction. In keeping with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, I cannot post a response that directly addresses the concerns mentioned. I do, however, welcome the opportunity to personally address all patient concerns, and ask that the patient or authorized representative be forwarded this message as it details my contact information. I can be reached directly by telephone at (205) 403-8902 ext. 2269. The patient or authorized representative can also complete a secure patient satisfaction survey at www.americanfamilycare.com. On behalf of American Family Care, I wish you and your family good health now and in the future.

resp.text: Malcolm, we regret to hear that you had this experience with us. Joe Freeman

text: Arrived at the very last minute,  no problem. Went back quickly for BP and EKG. Saw Doctor quickly, brief review, all important questions asked. Just a biannual checkup, but was thorough and quick. Polite Doctor, polite staff, quick and painless! 5 stars out if 5!

text: I saw Dr. Coleman, he is one of the nicest Doctors I have ever seen. Answered all my questions and really made me feel better about my defibrillator. After seeing Dr Bailey a few times and not spending any time with me, Dr Coleman was completely different.

I would wholeheartedly recommend them!

text: I have had great success with Dr. Cockrell at Birmingham Heart Clinic and know I am in good hands. He is caring and responsive and professional and easy to talk with.

name: Angie Johnson

I don't love having to see a heart specialist but I do love Dr Yoe and all of the staff. I have always been treated with respect, care and concern. Having a Dr that ask to pray with me means everything 🙏.

❤💜❤💜❤💜❤💜❤💜

name: DeAngelia Bush
text: I have several health issues  that keep me  in and out of doctor's offices on a regular basis. I never leave Google reviews for any of the offices that I use. However, due to the wonderful staff, clean exam rooms, spacious waiting rooms, and kind nurses, I felt the need to let them  that they were knocking it out of the park. The best thing about BHC is doctor Flowers though. He is so genuinely interested in how you feel in all areas, that I was amazed. His bedside manner, professionalism,  heart,  and thorough understanding of all issues makes him an amazing doctor. If you need him for a medication,  questions, or anything else,  his nurse Jill is a phone call away. She responds quickly, effectively, and kindly. After several months and more than a dozen visits, they are still standing up to this standard!

resp.text: We’re happy to hear you had such a positive experience with our teams! Thank you. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: La'Toria Jones
text: It’s a nice comfortable environment with a friendly staff.

name: Allison Jones
text: BHC Vein Center is amazing! Everyone from the sweet ladies at the front desk to the nurses and dr were so nice, professional and willing to do everything needed to help me. Very informative and thorough! Clean and safe environment!

name: Rebecca Yancey
text:
I went in scared to death.  I had a nurse who was so sweet and comforting.  I figured she was just doing a good job. (Discovered she was really being herself.  Just a good person).   Once in there and it started,  I freaked, I am a big baby.  I didn’t really hurt, just the thought.  But everyone was so nice, friendly.  Understood.  I had my own person who had worked  there two weeks. She smiled and reassured me the whole time.  I LIVED.
Haha.
These are great people.  Really do care about the patient.  And that is unusual now days.
I have my other leg to do and still not looking forward to it.  But I know I am in good hands.  VERY GRATEFUL TO THEM.

name: David Conwill
text: Awesome  place .there on the spot.  Very  personal and  and take care of  your  needs  and  very  professional  .
